loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth is 30 years old and married with two children who are 5 and 8 years old.  She sells clothes to earn a living. She has been in the business for three years and has employed one person.  Through Faulu Kenya, she has been trained in business management.  This has helped her to improve her business.

Ruth hopes to open other outlets of her business in the future.  She has requested 50,000 Kenya shillings to buy more clothes.

loans.use: To buy more clothes to sell

loans.name: Modesta

texts.en: Modesta is 52 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is single. Modesta has a sari-sari store or retail shop that sells a variety of products like canned goods, snacks & beverages. She has had this business for seven years. She requested a loan for PHP 25,000 to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages. Modesta has been a member of HSPFI since 2009. In the future, Modesta hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en: Joseph is 58 years old. He is a hardworking, social and honest businessman. He is married and blessed with four children who are school going. For the last five years, he has been keeping poultry to make a living. Previously, he used to sell charcoal. He wants in the next five years to have expanded his business. He is requesting a loan of 20,000 Kenyan shillings to buy more chickens and renovate the poultry house. Thanks to Faulu Kenya, he is now business oriented.

loans.use: To buy more chickens and renovate the poultry house

loans.name: Martin

texts.en:
Martin is 33 years old and married to Keziah. They are not blessed with children yet. He has been running a boda boda (motorcycle transport) business for the last two and a half years, making a monthly profit of KES 30,000. He has been loaned KES 50,000, which he plans to use to buy another motorbike.

With the anticipated profit made, he plans to buy a taxi. In the near future, he hopes to own a Mini-bus (a transport vehicle).

loans.use: to buy another motorbike

loans.name: Marichi

texts.en:
Marichi is 34 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with five children. 

Marichi has a shop that sells fish like sardines & mackerel. She has had this business for three years. She requested a loan for PHP 16,000 to buy fish to sell.

Marichi has been a member of HSPFI since 2009. In the future, Marichi hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy fish to sell

loans.name: Nelda

texts.en: Nelda is 53 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has seven children. Nelda has a shop where she sells fish like mackerel and sardines. She has had this business for 26 years. She requested a loan for 16,000 PHP to buy fish to sell. Nelda has been a member of HSPFI since 2009. In the future, Nelda hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy fish to sell

loans.name: Everlyn

texts.en: Everlyn is a hardworking 37-year-old business lady. She is married and blessed with an eight year old child who goes to school. To make a living, she has been selling second-hand clothes and eggs. She wants in the next five years to have opened up another business outlet. She is requesting a loan of 70,000 Kenya shillings to buy eggs. Thanks to Faulu Kenya she has been empowered economically.

loans.use: To buy eggs

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to add more stock of spare parts like wheel spanner, spare tyres, reflectors, jerks, lights, windows etc

loans.name: Yvonne

texts.en:
This is Yvonne, 48, a resident of Silang, Cavite City, Philippines. A single parent and a mother to her three children, the oldest is already working while the two others are still in high school. She, together with her children, manage their own household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Yvonne maintains a direct selling business. She sells clothing, footwear, undergarments, cosmetics and other products through the popular direct selling brands like Avon, Fuller life and other direct selling brands. A customer's order is bought in cash by the dealer and then given to the customer with a one-month-to-pay credit. Dealer’s prices are lower than those in the catalogue, and these are the profits that dealers are investing on as their income. Aside from this she is also selling silver and beads accessories. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of 4,500 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every week.

To help her continue the operations of her business, she is requesting a 35,000 PHP loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy merchandise items and products needed in her business. She expects a boost in her income as she expands her business.  

Yvonne dreams to expand her business and hopes to have an apartment unit some day. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for merchandise items and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Junifen

texts.en:
Junifen is a hard-working father who owns and operates a rice farming business in the village. He is now 50 years old and has two adult-age children. He has cultivated their rice fields for almost 38 years, earning a net profit of only 25,000 PHP per cropping. He aims to increase his productions and income to support all his family's needs and renovate their house to live more comfortably. 

But due to financial difficulty, Junifen is asking for a loan of 10,000 PHP to buy fertilizers and pesticides to sustain their rice production. He hopes that this coming harvest season he can increase his production and he believes that his efforts and sacrifices will make it possible to gain success in the future.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and pesticides to sustain rice production

loans.name: Jean

texts.en:
This is Jean, 36, a resident of Silang, Cavite City, Philippines. She is married to Alfredo, a driver, and is a mother to her only child. She, together with her husband, manage their own household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually proviD. income for their everyday expenses and support her child’s schooling. 

Jean operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a PHP 5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. AsiD. from this, she also sells home-cooked meals and retails electronic cellular phone loads to her customers.  Her store is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 800 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every day.

To help her continue the operations of her business, she is requesting an 11,000 PHP loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products needed in her business. She expects a boost in her income as she expands her business. 

Jean dreams to grow her business in the coming years, just as she fervently hopes that her child will be able to graduate one day, and finish his studies. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Kapaito

texts.en:
Kapaito is 33 years old and married to Lilian. They are blessed with one child who is nine months old. He has been selling milk for the last thirteen years. He has been loaned KES 30,000, which he plans to use to buy more goats,

With the anticipated profit, he plans to start a dairy in Kitengela. In the near future, he hopes to become a milk supplier to Kenya Creameries Company to make more profit.

loans.use: to buy more goats

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine is 48 years old and is married with three children, between 10 and 20 years of age. She owns a business of selling local drinks and some food like cakes and other items. Her business hours are from 8 am until 5 pm every day except on the weekend. She has two years of experience in this business. 

Christine has requested a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company in order to increase her business by buying a large quantities of sorghum to make local drinks and to add more food like cakes for sale. With any profits, Christine will reinvest in her business and save for the future.

loans.use: To purchase a large quantities of sorgum to make a local drinks.

loans.name: Anecita

texts.en:
Anecita is 42 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with two children. 

Anecita has a rice farm that plants and harvests rice and grains in due time. She has had this business for five years. She has requested a loan for PHP 15,000 to buy fertilizers for the rice field.

Anecita has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Anecita hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for the rice field

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy sugar, cooking fat, salt, and soap.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more tools for his business

loans.name: Rhea

texts.en:
This is Rhea, 28, a resident of Quezon City, Philippines. She is married to Christopher, her business partner, and a mother to her children. She, together with her husband and children, manage their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses.  

Rhea operates a tailoring business. She mainly offers curtains, bed sheets, blankets, and other home trappings. Seasonal demands for clothing like uniforms and such are available all year round. She also does repairs and alterations. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 800 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 10,000 loan. She will be using the loan to buy more quantities of raw materials like fabric, thread and newspapers for patterns. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Rhea hopes to be able to expand soon and dreams of being able to give her children a good and high quality education through all her hard work in her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for raw materials and items needed in her business.

loans.name: Mwarabu

texts.en:
Mwarabu is a 33-year-old single man. Mwarabu runs a barber shop in Kilifi. His business has been in operation for the last two years and it has been a success. This marks his first loan from KADET to finance his business. 

With this loan, Mwarabu plans to purchase more shaving equipment for his business. The anticipated profits will be used to repay the loan and to gradually expand his business. His dream is to improve his living standards.

loans.use: to purchase more shaving equipment

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a printer, playstation, and TV

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase spare parts to repair her tuk tuk

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy canned gods, snacks & beverages

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Lucy has practiced small-scale farming in Ndunyu Njeru town since 1980.  She is 47 years old and a single mother of three school-going children.  

She was introduced to KADET LTD by one of our field officers and this will be her first loan. She plans to use the loan to buy seeds and fertilizer, which she will sell at the local market.

In the future, Lucy hopes to become one of the leading farmers in the Ndunyu Njeru area.

loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Abir

texts.en:
Abir is a 41-year-old married woman and mother of five children. She works hard to cover most of their expenses. She started this business in 1980. As of now, she has 30 years of experience in this domain. She started this business too early, in order to help her parents in their living, and she's doing the same with her husband through helping him to cover most of their family's expenses.

Abir is requesting a loan from Al Majmoua, a Kiva partner, for the fourth time, in order to increase her business capital by adding new flower collections for the Ramadan Eid's season.

Abir is a courageous woman with a good reputation and a hard worker who seeks perfection all the time. Abir loves her business a lot and hopes to expand it to a wider shop in the future, and to improve her wedding planning sector.

loans.use: To buy more flowers

loans.name: Emy

texts.en:
Emy is 58 years of age. She is married and has five children. Three of them are married already and two are still single. She is engaged in a retail shop business where she sells a variety of groceries such as canned goods, shampoo, soft drinks and ingredients. She is a woman who really enjoys her work and waiting on her customers. She has been earning a living in this business for more than four years and gets up early every day to wait on her customers.

Her greatest dream is to improve her earnings in order to continue providing daily sustenance to her grandchildren and her family. The loan of P10,000 she is seeking will be used to purchase soft drinks, canned goods, ingredients and shampoo for her retail shop business. She hopes that she can maintain her business.

loans.use: to buy groceries such as soft drinks, canned goods, ingredients and shampoo for her retail shop

loans.name: Susana

texts.en:
Susana, age 46, operates a buy-and-sell business. What she basically does is buy general merchandise from wholesalers and resells it at a small profit. Her products are shoes, slippers, sandals, and kitchenware. She earns about PHP 5,000 in sales monthly. She has to work hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses.

The entire family helps each other to manage their household while operating the business. Due to the high cost of basic commodities and the expense of daily allowances for her three children who are still studying, she is requesting a PHP 23,000 loan. She will use the loan to buy more shoes, slippers and different kinds of kitchenware. She believes that through her patience in managing her retail shop business, she can generate a bigger income. She hopes that she can support her children until they finish their college level of education.

loans.use: to buy different kinds of shoes, slippers and kitchenware for her retail shop

loans.name: Safari

texts.en:
Safari is 35 years old and the married father of three children. He has owned a tailoring shop in Kilifi for two years. The business is doing well.

Safari has been a KADET client and this marks his third loan to finance his business. He plans to use this loan to purchase more thread, needles, scissors and cloth materials for his business. Safari will use the anticipated profits to repay the loan, for his upkeep and for the expansion of his business. His dream is to excel in business.

loans.use: to purchase more thread, needles, scissors and cloth materials

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy more Baobab fruit.

loans.name: Penina

texts.en:
Penina is the 40-year-old married mother of one son, aged 20 years. She has operated a carpentry workshop store in Kilifi for the last four years. Her business has been doing well.

Penina has been a KADET client and this marks her second loan to finance her business. She plans to use this loan to expand her business by purchasing more stock of timber for her workshop. Penina will use the anticipated profits to repay the loan and for her family’s upkeep. Penina’s dream is to become a successful businesswoman in Kilifi.

loans.use: to expand her business by purchasing more timber for her workshop

loans.name: Thelma

texts.en:
Thelma is a 39-year-old married woman with 3 children aged 17, 16 and 6. She is engaged in farming and hog raising. Thelma's husband is the one who mainly manages their farm and Thelma spends most of her time raising pigs in their backyard. She also helps work at their farm when she can. They grow rice and corn crops to sell.  

Thelma has requested a loan to purchase 4 sacks of pig feed, 2 sacks of fertilizers and 2 quarts of herbicides. She hopes to be able to sustain her children's education.

loans.use: to purchase pig feed, fertilizers and herbicides

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia is 45 years old, married and has three children. She operates a cafeteria to earn a living and also relies on her husband for financial support. Lydia has been operating her business for nine years and has employed three people.

Since she joined Faulu Kenya, Lydia has been able to improve her business because she has been trained in business management. She has requested a loan of KES 20,000 to buy ingredients such as wheat flour, cooking fat, sugar, salt and baking powder.

loans.use: To buy ingredients such as wheat flour, cooking fat, sugar, salt and baking powder.

loans.name: Bebiana

texts.en:
Bebiana is 62 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is widowed with 13 children. Bebiana has a shop where she sells canned goods, breads, biscuits and snacks. She has had this business for 10 years.

Bebiana has requested a loan of PHP 8,000 to buy canned goods, detergents and snacks. She has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Bebiana hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, detergents and snacks

loans.name: Geoffrey

texts.en:
Geoffrey has practiced farming in Ndunyu Njeru for the last 25 years.  He is 51 years old, married to Waithira and they have two school-going children.  

Geoffrey was introduced to KADET LTD  by one of our field officers and this will be his first loan, which he plans to use buy seeds and fertilizer. In the future, Geoffrey hopes to become one of the leading farmers in the Ndunyu Njeru area.

loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph has practiced farming in Ndunyu Njeru for the last four years. He is 44 years old, married to Rose and they have three school-going children.  

Joseph was introduced to KADET LTD by one of our field officers and this will be his first loan, which he plans to use to buy seeds and fertilizer. In the future, Joseph hopes to become one of the leading farmers in the Ndunyu Njeru area.

loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Henrita

texts.en:
Henrita is 65 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 2 children. Henrita has operated a carenderia (a mini-restaurant) for 5 years, selling choice dishes such as bihon (Filipino stir-fried rice noodles with meat and vegetables), chicken and pork adobo and caldereta (Filipino beef stew).

Henrita has requested a loan of PHP 13,000 to buy raw ingredients needed for cooking her dishes. She has been a member of HSPFI since 2009. In the future, Henrita hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients needed for cooking

loans.name: Fridah

texts.en:
Fridah is a businesswoman who sells clothes. She has been in the business for six years and employs one person. Fridah is able to raise her 15-year-old child with the income she gets from her business. She also relies on her husband, who is employed, for financial support.

Fridah has requested a loan of KES 40,000 to buy more clothes. She hopes to open a big boutique in the future. Fridah is very grateful to Faulu Kenya for training her in business management.

loans.use: To buy more clothes

loans.name: Corazon

texts.en:
Corazon, commonly called "Cora" in her village, is 48 years old. She chose to be single because she wants to take care of her parents who are now old and incapable. Due to financial difficulty, Cora didn't continue her secondary education.

Cora manages a general store in her village to earn income and satisfy the family's needs. She has been in this business for almost 18 years, earning a net profit of only PHP 7,000 a month. Cora aims to improve her general store in order to increase her income to satisfy the family's daily basic needs and save for future emergencies. Due to inadequate capital, she is asking for a loan of PHP 6,000 to buy additional stock of mineral water, soft drinks, breads, detergents, junk food, candies, canned goods and beverages to sell in the village. She hopes that the loan will help a lot to make her business grow.

loans.use: to buy additional stock for her store

loans.name: Muhogo Group

texts.en:
Nuru, who is in her early 30s, is married with two children who go to school. She has had a food-vendor business for one and a half years now. She works from 6 a.m to 10 p.m. daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be her first loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She wants to use it for increasing her stock of food and to buy some chairs and tables. Her dream is to one day be able to build her own house.

She will share this loan with her loan group, "Muhogo," which has a total of eight members who will hold each accountable for paying back their loans.

loans.use: To increase food stock and buy a few chairs and tables.

loans.name: Scolastica

texts.en: Scolastica is a hardworking business lady who was born in 1978. She is married and blessed with two children who are school-going. For the last three years, she has been selling construction materials to make a living. In the next five years, she wants to have a large firm dealing with the supply of construction materials. She is requesting a loan of 20,000 Kenya shillings to buy pipes. Thanks to Faulu Kenya, she has been able to embrace the culture of saving.

loans.use: to buy pipes.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John has practiced farming in Ndunyu Njeru town for the last 26 years. He is 55 years old, widowed, and taking care of his four school-going children. It's the farm income that he uses to sustain his family.

He was introduced to KADET LTD by one of our field officers and this will be his first loan. He plans to use the loan amount to buy seeds and fertilizer.

In the future, John hopes to become one of the leading farmers in the Ndunyu Njeru area.

loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to expand his business by purchasing more timber and a new power saw

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fish to sell

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en: Nancy is a hospitable business lady. She is married and blessed with 5 children, 3 of whom are in school. For the last two years, she has been running a beauty salon to make a living. She supplements income from this venture with the salary she earns from her employment.  In the next 5 years she wants to have progressed and expanded her business so she can cater to a greater clientele. She is requesting a loan of 20,000 Kenyan shillings to buy a blow dryer and hair shampoo. Thanks to Faulu Kenya she is now able to budget.

loans.use: To buy a blow dryer and hair shampoo

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy seeds, fertilizer and spraying chemicals.

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en:
Vilma is a 40-year-old married woman with three children. She lives in the town of Banga, South Cotabato, with her family.

Vilma is a farmer. She primarily grows rice crops to sell. With her income, she is able to provide for their daily needs and send her children to school.

Vilma has requested a loan to purchase fertilizers and other farm inputs. She hopes to have a stable income that would help sustain her family, especially her children's education.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and other farm inputs.

loans.name: Marcyline

texts.en:
Marcyline is 24 years old, married, and has one son. She runs a pharmacy in Chaani, Mombasa and her business has been in operation for the last six years. It has been doing well.

Marcyline is a KADET client and this marks her second loan to finance her business. She plans to use the money to expand her business by purchasing more stock of drugs and cosmetics. The anticipated profits will be used to repay the loan, and for her upkeep, and to further expand her business. Her dream is to satisfy her clients and to open up new outlets in other parts of Mombasa.

loans.use: to expand her business by purchasing more stock of drugs and cosmetics

loans.name: Anna

texts.en:
Anna is 50 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has two children.
 
Anna  has a shop that sells canned goods, detergents and beverages. She has had this business for five years. 

She requested a loan for PHP 8,000 to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

Anna has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Anna hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages to resell.

loans.name: Georges

texts.en:
Georges is a 61-year-old Lebanese married man living with his wife, three children and one brother. He has owned a metal shop since 1976. His job consists in cutting up metal in order to give those shapes as the clients ask for. 

Getting older, Georges must move on with his business operation in order to earn good revenue as he is the only income source of the family and must also pay his only employee’s salary. Today, he is requesting to borrow $1200 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to purchase additional materials needed. In the future, he is planning to improve his business and expand his operations still further.

loans.use: to purchase additional materials needed for cutting up metal.

loans.name: Ongechi

texts.en: Ongechi is a hardworking businessman. He is married but has no children at the moment. For the last 4 years, he has been running a welding business in order to make a living. In the next 5 years he wants to have opened up another shop in the town centre. His dream is to acquire a piece of land and develop it. He is requesting a loan of 20,000 Kenyan shillings to buy more metal for welding. Thanks to Faulu Kenya he has been able to embrace the culture of saving.

loans.use: To buy metal for welding

loans.name: Jack

texts.en:
Jack is a 27-year-old Lebanese single man living with his parents. He has five years of experience working with mobile phones and in 2009, he opened his own shop. With his requested loan  of $2000 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l, he will be able to increase his merchandise selection of new mobile phones to sell. He states that both his business sales and income will increase as a result of the loan. 

In the future, he is looking to further expand his business and increase his capital. This will be his second Kiva loan.

loans.use: to increase his merchandise selection of new mobile phones to sell.

loans.name: Kamolchon

texts.ru:
Камолчон умный, целеустремленный и добросовестный человек. Он женат и любящий отец одного ребенка. Он занимается производством пряников. Он занимается этим бизнесом уже 5 лет. Камолчон мечтает о том, что когда то расширить свой бизнес и будет открывать цеха в других городах и районах Таджикистана. Он хочет, чтобы его ребенок вырос хорошим и умным человекам. Он хочет, устроит своего ребенка в хороших садиках и школах, чтобы он стал образованным. Камолджон запрашивает займ для покупки продуктов для приготовления пряников. Он хочет заранее благодарит всем за поддержку и милосердие.     

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj
texts.en: Kamolchon is a smart, goal-oriented and conscientious person.  He is a married and loving father of one child.  He is involved in making spice cakes (pryaniki).  He has been in this business for five years.  Kamolchon dreams that when he is able to expand his business, he will open bakeries in other cities and districts of Tajikistan.  He wants his child to grow up to be a good and smart person.  He wants to place his child into good kindergartens and schools, so that he becomes educated.  Kamolchon is requesting a loan for the purchase of products needed for making spice cakes.  He wants to thank all in advance for the support and mercy.

loans.use: to purchase products for making spice cakes

loans.name: Wilma

texts.en:
This is Wilma, 53, a resident of Pasay City, Philippines. She is a single mother with two children. 

Wilma has managed to support her older child's schooling up to college level. At this time, she is working hard to send her other child to school. She, together with her children, manages their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses.  

Wilma operates a cell phone accessories business. She buys cell phone accessories and merchandise from wholesalers and sells them per item with a little profit. Customers are attracted to buy due to the low selling prices and the many options offered. Her regular customers are the local community.  She earns a minimum of 400 PHP in sales every day.

To help her continue operation of her business, she is requesting a PHP 10,000 loan. She will be using the loan to buy more quantities and varieties of products to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Wilma dreams of being able to give both her children a good and high-quality education through all her hard work in her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for cell phone accessory items and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Dany

texts.en:
Dany is a 24-year-old single man living with his parents and one sibling. He is from Lebanon. He has owned a car repair shop since 2009. His job is specialized in repairing all types of vehicles. 

Today, he is asking to borrow $1000 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to purchase a scanner machine in order to reinforce his business operation. In the future, he is looking to diversify his business and open a new shop where he can buy and sell car spare parts. His income is needed to help support his family.

loans.use: to purchase a scanner in order to reinforce his business operation.

loans.name: Alima

texts.en:
Alima is a widowed woman with six children, all of whom graduated from school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past 13 years, she has operated a retail shop business, selling to her neighbors and passersby. Alima faces a major challenge of delayed payments by those who purchase goods on credit. She dreams of expanding her business in the future.

With the KES 60,000, she wants to purchase sacks of beans, sugar, rice and cooking oil. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase sacks of beans, sugar, rice and cooking oil.

loans.name: Mwanasha

texts.en:
Mwanasha is a married woman with four children, two of whom attend school while two are still too young for school. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For over ten years, she has operated a retail shop business, selling to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. Mwanasha dreams of expanding her business in the future.

With the Kshs 40,000, she wants to purchase sacks of beans, maize flour, wheat flour, rice and sugar. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase sacks of beans, maize flour, wheat flour, rice and sugar.

loans.name: Melita

texts.en:
Melita believes that "poverty is not a hindrance to success." She is now 31 years old and still single. Due to hardships in life, she only took a vocational course. Because of the lack of job opportunities, she manages a general store in the village to earn income. She has been in this business for almost four years, now earning a profit of only 5,000 Philippines pesos (P) a month. 

She aimed to make her business grow to increase her income and help her parents in financing the education of her younger brothers and sister, and to save for her future. Due to inadequate capital, she is asking for a loan of P6,000 to buy additional stock of shampoo, spices, soaps, breads, candies, snack foods, beverages and soft drinks to sell in the village. She hopes that the loan will help her to make her business viable and profitable in the future.

loans.use: to buy additional stock of shampoo, spices, soaps, breads, candies, snack foods, beverages and soft drinks to sell in the village.

loans.name: Carolina

texts.en:
This is Carolina, 53. She is a resident of Pasay City, Philippines, and a widow with two children; both are already working. She, together with her children, manages their own household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Carolina maintains a direct-selling business. She sells clothing, footwear, undergarments, cosmetics and other products through the popular direct-selling brands like Avon, Fuller Life, Natasha, Boardwalk, Marikina Shoe Exchange and other direct-selling brands. A customer's order is bought in cash by the dealer, then given to the customer with a one-month-to-pay credit. Dealer’s prices are lower than those in the catalog, and these are the profits that dealers are counting on as their income. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of 2,700 Philippine Pesos (Php) in sales every week.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php15,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy orders for her customers. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Carolina dreams to expand her business and have a permanent store in the near future. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members* to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for merchandise items and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Mwanamisi

texts.en:
Mwanamisi is a married woman with four children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past three years, she has operated a potatoes and water vending business. Her potential customers are neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of the high cost of purchasing potatoes and seasonality in her business. She dreams of expanding her business in the future.

With the 20,000 Kenyan shillings, she wants to purchase sacks of potatoes and cooking fat oil. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase sacks of potatoes and cooking fat oil.

loans.name: Basma

texts.en:
Basma is from Al Baqa'a, Amman. She is a 40-year-old married woman and a mother of three children.

Basma is manufacturing school bags and sewing clothes from home.

Basma is requesting a loan of 1500 Jordanian Dinar (JOD) to purchase a new technological machine to print pictures on the bags she makes.

Through her business Basma is creating job opportunities for her family members, such as her sister and her sister's husband.

Basma is looking to improve her family life conditions and expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase a machine that prints pictures for her bagmaking buisness

loans.name: Jackson

texts.en:
For the last six years, Jackson has been buying and selling livestock in Makueni town. He is 54 years old and married to Munyinya. They have been blessed with six children.

He was introduced to KADET by KADET staff. He has been loaned 30,000 Kenyan shillings. He intends to use the loan amount to buy two cows.

In the future, he hopes his business will grow and that he will be able to sell 10 or more cows per month.

loans.use: To buy two cows.

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en:
Daniel is a married man with eight children; five attend school while three are underage for school. He lives at a rental house that has neither electricity nor piped water. His greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past two years, he has operated a jua Kali (recycled scrap metals) business, selling at the market to his neighbors and passersby. He faces a major challenge of seasonality in his business. He dreams of expanding to a wholesale shop in the future.

With the 20,000 Kenyan shillings, he wants to purchase materials for his workshop business. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business.

loans.use: To purchase materials for his workshop business.

loans.name: Begz

texts.en:
Mr. Begz is 44 years old and an electrician. He lives with his wife and two children in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. For 13 years, he has been working as an electrician in a power plant, and he is a clever electrical specialist. 

Begz requested a loan of 1.500.000 Mongolia tugriks to finish his mother’s house repair. His mother is a 67-year-old retiree who lives alone in her house. But recently, her house has been becoming very bad, uncomfortable and absolutely too cold to live in. The Mongolian winter is very harsh and freezing cold. Therefore, her son Begz is trying to make a renovation or some adjustments to her house before this winter. The loan he is taking will be dedicated to purchasing some necessary building materials to finish his mother's house repair.

loans.use: To purchase some necessary building materials to finish his mother's house repair before winter.

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca has been operating her general shop for the last 10 years in Oloitoktok town. She is 51 years old and married to Francis. They have three children.

She was introduced to KADET LTD by a friend who is also a KADET client. This will be her first loan. She intends to use the loan amount to add to her stock of sugar, maize flour and cooking fat.

In future, Rebecca hopes to expand her business and be able to buy a piece of land.

loans.use: To add to her stock of sugar, maize flour and cooking fat.

loans.name: Rana

texts.en:
Rana is a 29-year-old single woman. She works in a grocery store which she opened six years ago, in order to build her future career and not to rely on others to help her.

Rana is a hard-working woman. She is improving her business year after year in order to reach an important level in the future to cover all of her  customers needs.

Rana is requesting a loan from Al Majmoua, a Kiva partner, for the first time, in order to buy a freezer to start selling frozen vegetables, meat and chicken. in addition to many other frozen foods.

Rana's good reputation is an investment in her career path; her customers are supporting her, and she is wiling to give them back what they deserve to get, as soon as possible.

loans.use: To buy a freezer so she can start selling frozen foods.

loans.name: Azim

texts.ru:
Азим добросовестный и честный человек. Он женат и любящий отец одного несовершеннолетнего ребенка. Он занимается купля продажей риса более 25 лет. У него очень богатый опыт и много клиентов. Азим любит свой бизнес и занимается с удовольствием. Он всегда привозит высококачественные товары, чтобы его клиенты были всегда довольны. Азим хочет расширить свой бизнес и улучшить свое жилищное условия. Он хотел бы получит займ в размере 2500$ США для покупки риса. Он надеется, что кредиторы будут поддерживать его.  

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj
texts.en: Azim is a conscientious and honest person.  He is married and a loving father of one underage child.  He is involved in buying and selling rice for over twenty-five years.  He has a rich experience and many customers.  Azim loves and enjoys his business.  He always delivers high quality products, so that his customers are always satisfied.  Azim wants to expand his business and improve his living conditions.  He wants to obtain a loan in the sum of $2500 for the purchase of rice.  He hopes that the creditors will support him.

loans.use: to purchase rice

loans.name: Philip

texts.en:
Philip is a married man with two children, both of whom attend school. He owns a house that has electricity and piped water. His greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past two years, he has operated a water vending business, selling from home to his neighbors and passersby. He faces a major challenge of seasonality in his business. Philip dreams of expanding his business in the future.

With the KES 15,000, he wants to purchase a water tank for water storage. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business.

loans.use: To purchase a water tank for water storage.

loans.name: Batjargal

texts.en:
Batjargal is a carpenter who lives with his wife and two children in Darkhan, the second largest city in Mongolia. 

He started his carpentry business with USD 2,500 in January of 2009. But in fact, his monthly earning is not enough for his life. 

Before, he and his family used to live in a rented apartment. But Batjargal bought an apartment with three rooms that he purchased through another loan this May. But it is not so good and fully installed.  

Most of his income is dedicated to apartment fees at this time. Therefore, he needs financial support to make an adjustment to his new apartment so it  will be comfortable for their life.
 
The loan will be dedicated to purchasing decoration and building materials to repair his apartment.

loans.use: To purchase decoration and building materials to repair his apartment.

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
Since 2005, Ahmad is the proud owner of a small shop where he sells car spare parts and oil. He is the only income source for his family. He is a 30-year-old married man and lives with his wife and only child. Today, he is requesting to borrow $1500 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to increase his purchases of new car spare parts and oil. 

This will be his third Kiva loan and we note that he is an excellent client with payments on time.

loans.use: to increase his purchases of new car spare parts and oil.

loans.name: C2177 Tuzamurane Group

texts.en:
Nadine is 23 years old and married. She has two children, age 2 and 5. Her business is well organized and is well known for selling sorghum in the market. Nadine is the team leader of this group, which is called "Tuzamurane" in local language.

In the picture, Nadine is a second person on the right side. Her business hours are from 6 a.m. until 7 p.m. every day except Sunday, and she currently employs two people to help her. She has one year of experience in this business. 

Nadine and her team have requested a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company in order to increase their businesses by buying more products such as sorghum, beans, vegetables and so on for sale, and fields to cultivate. With any profits, they will reinvest in their businesses and save for their future. Nadine will be also able to renovate her own house.

loans.use: To purchase large quantities of sorghum for sale.

loans.name: Purevdorj

texts.en:
Purevdorj is 21 years old, a young father who is trying to build a life. His wife is a student. 

He has been working in an auto service called “Sky” as a serviceman since this January. He works from 10 a.m. to 9 p.m. and has just one day off in a week. When he accomplishes his work well, he is rewarded by 10 percent of his salary as an encouragement. 

Just a half year ago, he became a father, and now he should increase his income in order to rear their child. So he is planning to start a taxi business during the night to increase his income. He needs a good car for taxi service in the city. But there is MNT 1,400,000 lacking for a car payment. The loan he is taking will be dedicated to help pay the car payment.

loans.use: To help pay the car payment for his taxi.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane lives in Uganda. She is married and has four children, three of whom are in school.  Jane lives in a home that she owns. She has access to electricity and piped water. Her major monthly expenses include school fees and feeding the family.   

Jane has a beauty salon business. She has been in this business for over 10 years, and she works six days out of every week. She also generates additional income through rental houses.

Jane has requested for a loan of 1,300,000 UGX from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more boxes of cream relaxers, braids and weaves. The main business challenges for Jane include thieves and seasonality. Her goals and aspirations for her business are to own a bridal salon and also to build other rental rooms.

loans.use: To buy more boxes of cream relaxers, braids and weaves.

loans.name: Rosithel

texts.en:
Rosithel is 35 years old, married and has two school-age children. She runs a general store to help her husband earn income. Due to the high cost of commodities, she wants to improve her business to increase her income and satisfy their family needs and finance the education of their children. 

She wants to ask for a loan of P6,000 to buy additional stocks of fruit, beverages, soft drinks, breads, snack foods and candies to sell in the village. She hopes that the loan will help a lot to make her business grow and become viable through her patience and hard work.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of fruit, beverages, soft drinks, bread, snack foods and candies to sell in the village.

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
Ahmad is a 62-year-old man, who has five sons. All are married except for one who lives with him. Ahmad lives in Khanyounis in Gaza located in Palestine, and  he is getting a decent retirement salary from the Palestinian National Authority. 

Ahmad works in agriculture and wants to prepare greenhouses and purchase seedlings for the coming season. Ahmad doesn't have enough money to pay for these expenses especially with the decent retirement salary he gets, so he needs to take a loan of amount $3,000 from FATEN.

When Ahmad gets his FATEN loan, which is repaid on a monthly basis, he will be able to prepare for the new season of agriculture and enhance his desire to work hard and earn better income and improve the family life positively. Ahmad is a conservative man so his son Mohammad is photographed instead.

loans.use: To pay expenses for preparing greenhouses and purchasing seedlings.

loans.name: Liza

texts.en:
This is Liza, 40, a resident of Manila, Philippines. Her husband is Roberto, a driver, and they have four children. Her eldest child is in college and the youngest is not yet studying. She, together with her husband and children, manage their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for everyday expenses.  

Liza operates a laundry soap retailing business. What she basically does is buy laundry products from wholesalers, sell them per item with a profit. Customers are attracted to buy due to the low selling prices and the many products that she offers. Her regular customers are neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of 700 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php 50,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy more quantities and varieties of products to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Liza dreams of being able to give all her children a good and high quality education through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for additional products needed in her business.

loans.name: Dorcus

texts.en:
Dorcus is a single woman who lives in a rental house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is rent bills.

For the past three years, she has operated a beauty salon; her potential customers are neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. She dreams of expanding her business and establishing another beauty shop in the future.

With the Kshs 20,000 she wants to purchase hair pieces, hair dryers and perfumes. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase hair pieces, hair dryers and perfumes.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: redecorate his salon in order to offer his clients a comfortable place.

loans.name: Bema

texts.en:
Bema is married with one child. She is 32 years old and lives in the Philippines. Sema is a farmer and grows pigs to earn a living. She has been doing this for 2 years. 

She has requested a loan for 14,900 PHP to purchase feeds for her pigs. Bema has been a member of PMPC for one year.

loans.use: To purchase feeds for her pigs.

loans.name: Omina

texts.ru:
Омина целеустремленная, умная и добрая женщина. Она замужем и любящая мать 3 детей. Она занимается купля продажей фруктов около 25 лет. Её муж водитель и она сама занимается в данном бизнесе. Её сыновья уехали в Россию, чтобы зарабатывать денег. Она хочет улучшить свое жилищное условие. Она хочет расширить свой бизнес и получит прибыли. Омина хотела бы получить займ на сумму 2200$ США для покупки нового ассортимента фруктов. Она заранее благодарит вас за вашу поддержку и поощрения. 

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj
texts.en: Omina is a goal-oriented, smart and kind woman.  She is married and a loving mother of three children.  She is involved in buying and selling fruits for about twenty-five years.  Her husband is a driver, and she is involved in this business too.  Her sons left to go to Russia in order to earn money.  She wants to improve her living situation.  She wants to expand her business and receive profits.  Omina wants to obtain a loan in the sum of $2200 for the purchase of new assortment of fruits.  She thanks you in advance for your help and support.

loans.use: to purchase new assortment of fruits

loans.name: Merlinda

texts.en:
This is Merlinda, 45, resident of Pasay City, Philippines. Her husband is Rosindo, they have one daughter who is now studying. She, together with her husband and children, manages their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses.
  
Merlinda maintains a direct selling business. She sells clothing, footwear, undergarments, cosmetics and other products through the popular direct selling brands like Avon, Fuller life, Natasha, Boardwalk, Marikina Shoe Exchange, and other direct selling brands. A customer's order is bought in cash by the dealer and then given to the customer with a one-month-to-pay credit. Dealer’s prices are lower than those in the catalog, and these are the profits that dealers are counting on as their income. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of 1,500 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every week.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php 14,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy orders for her customers. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Merlinda hopes to expand her business and dreams to be able to give her daughter a good and high quality education through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for merchandise items and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Gorrret

texts.en:
Gorret lives in Uganda. She is married and has 3 children, all of whom are in school. Gorret has a pharmacy business.  She has been in this business for over 10 years, and she works 6 days out of every week.  She sells her products in a shop, by means of retail.  

She has requested for a loan of 1,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more boxes of syrups and tablets.  She also generates additional income through rental houses. The main business challenges for Gorret include thieves and seasonality.  

Her goals and aspirations for her business are to own a fully stocked pharmacy and also to build other rental rooms. Gorret lives in a home that she owns where she has access to electricity and to piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include rent, school fees and feeding the family.

loans.use: To buy more boxes of syrups and tablets for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy canned goods, soft drinks, assorted biscuits, ingredients and junk foods for her store.

loans.name: Julie

texts.en:
Julie is 44 years old and earns her living by selling vegetables in the market. She has been in this business for more than 14 years. Even though the work is hard, Julie knows how to do her job well. Her husband help her with their household expenses through his motorcycle transport business. 

Julie would like to engage in a hog raising business, but she doesn't have enough funds due to her three children who are studying. She is grateful because, through her hard work in maintaining her business, she is able to sustain the allowances, school fees and daily needs of her family.

She is requesting a loan amount of Php 10,000 which will be used to buy vegetables such as squash, tomatoes, string beans and eggplant for her stall in the market. Her business is located in the market where she can accommodate many customers. She makes sure that she provides them with good service. She hopes that she can send her children on to higher levels of education.

loans.use: to buy vegetables such as squash, tomatoes, string beans and eggplant for her stall in the market.

loans.name: Hala

texts.en:
Hala is a 45-year-old married woman from Lebanon living with her husband and three children. She has been working as a private teacher for the past 16 years. During the school season, she teaches five students at her house, and during the summer she gives private lessons to students who need to improve their education level.

 Today, she is requesting to borrow $1200 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to pay university education fees for her daughter who is studying interior design. Hala aims to insure a good education path for her daughter to enable her to get hired in a proper company in the future.

loans.use: to pay her daughter's university education fees.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy varnish and wood for his furniture business.

loans.name: C5656 Indahemuka Group

texts.en:
Claire is 37 years old and is married with four children. Her business is well-organized and is well known in this business of selling secondhand clothing. She is the team leader of this group which is called "INDAHEMUKA" in the local language. 

In the picture, Claire is in the red shirt, the first person on the left side. Her business hours are from 7:30am until 5:30pm every day except on Sunday, and she currently employs one person to help her. 

She and her team have requested a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company in order to increase their businesses by buying more secondhand items for resale. They will reinvest the profits in their businesses and save for their futures.

loans.use: To purchase more secondhand clothes for resale.

loans.name: Fidaa'

texts.en:
Fidaa' is a 21-year-old woman who is married. Her husband is a Palestinian National Authority employee having a decent salary, and the family has got another source of income from raising livestock animals and selling them. Fidaa' wants to purchase new home furniture such as bedroom, living-room seats etc., but the money she has isn't enough, so she needs to take a loan in the amount of $1,000 from FATEN.

When Fidaa' gets the FATEN loan, that is repaid on a monthly basis, she will purchase new home furniture and live in comfortable healthy home conditions. Fidaa' is a religious woman, so her husband is photographed instead of her.

loans.use: To purchase new home furniture.

loans.name: Roberto

texts.en:
Roberto is 49 years old and married. He is engaged in performing services, particularly in repairing all vehicle tires. He has managed it for fifteen years, and through his patience he was able to set up a small garage to do the services he offers. He has gained a loyal customer base and experience in his field. Aside from the service business, he also raises goats and ducks to gain extra income for his family's needs.

Roberto is requesting a loan amount of Php 20,000 so that he can buy a compressor and a welding machine for his vulcanizing and welding shop business. Through this amount he requested, he will be able to make his work easier. He will be able to do his work more efficiently in less time.

loans.use: to purchase a compressor and a welding machine for his vulcanizing and  welding shop business.

loans.name: Esmeralda

texts.en:
Esmeralda is 51 years old and a resident of Liwayway Diffun Quirino. She is married and has been blessed with four children. She works hard to continually provide income for her family's everyday expenses.

Esmeralda operates a variety store, where she sells different kinds of groceries in small quantities to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a small amount of cooking oil, or an egg. Esmeralda makes a profit by buying supplies at wholesale prices and selling by pieces. Her store is located in front of her house. 

To help her continue operating her business, she is requesting a Php18,000 loan which will be used to buy groceries such as soft drinks, biscuits, ingredients, sugar, shampoo and junk foods for her retail shop. She is hoping that she can maintain her business so that she can support her youngest daughter for whom she spends her income for daily allowances and school fees.

loans.use: to buy groceries such as soft drinks, biscuits, ingredients, sugar, shampoo and junk foods for her retail shop.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is a married woman with seven children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past five years, she has operated a water vending business, selling from her home to her neighbors and passersby. She faces the major challenge of seasonality in her business. During the dry, hot season the availability of water for sale is lower. She dreams of expanding her business in the future to meet her customers' needs.

With the Kshs 40,000 she wants to purchase a tank for water storage. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase a tank for water storage.

loans.name: Mohamad

texts.en: Mohamad is a 24-year-old single man living with one parent and one sibling. He is from Lebanon. In 2006, he was able to open an aluminum factory in his town. Even at his young age, Mohamad showed high competency at his work. And today, he is requesting to borrow $1200 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to purchase additional tools and supplies needed to reinforce his business. In the future, he is hoping to further expand his business and continue his work properly to earn good income for his family.

loans.use: to purchase additional tools and supplies needed.

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice is a married woman with three children, all of whom attend school. She lives in a rental house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees. 

For the past three years she has operated a retail shop business, selling to her neighbors and passersby. She faces the major challenge of seasonality in her business. She dreams of establishing a poultry business in the future.

With the Kshs 20,000 she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, salt and sugar. She decided to join Yehu in order to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, salt and sugar.

loans.name: Thou

texts.en:
Thou, 31 years old, lives in Prey Chor District in Kompong Charm province in Cambodia. She is married and has three lovely children, all of whom are enrolled in school.

Thou is a farmer who earns approximately $2 a day. She works hard to support her family. Her husband is a construction worker in the village where he earns about $3 a day.

Aside from these jobs, Thou and her husband would like to raise a cow but lack the money to do so. Thou is requesting a $600 loan from HKL to purchase a cow for the purpose of increasing her income.

Thou hopes that this loan will bring happiness to her family. In the future she wishes to send all of her children to study at the university.

loans.use: to purchase a cow.

loans.name: Alfredo

texts.en:
Alfredo, age 24, is married and has two children. He cultivates rice. During the last  season in May, Alfredo earned P20,000 from his crop. He used it to pay electric bills, school fees, daily expenses, and to save for security purposes for times when his income is low.  According to Alfredo, he has been cultivating two hectare of rice fields.

Alfredo is now asking for a loan of P20,000 in order to buy fertilizer and insecticides used in farming and for payments for the labor of transplanting rice in the rice fields.He hopes that he can increase his yield in the next crop so that he can provide for the financial needs of his family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer,insecticides and payments for the labor of transplanting of rice in the rice fields

loans.name: Muslihitdin

texts.ru:
Муслихитдин трудолюбивый и добросовестный человек. Он женат и любящий отец 3 детей. Его жена домохозяйка и воспитывать детей дома.  Более 13 лет Муслихитдин занимается купля продажей сухофруктов, такие как фисташки, миндаль, изюм, шиповник и арахис.  Он имеет арендованный склад, где он может, сохранит сухофруктов в сезонное время, а продает в зимний и осенний период. А также раздает сухофруктов предпринимателям. Ещё он имеет свой абрикосовый сад. Он хотел бы получит займ в размере 3000$ США для покупки арахис, миндаль и фисташки. Заранее Муслихитдин благодарен всем за поддержку и поощрение.


More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.
texts.en: Muslihitdin is a hard-working and conscientious person.  He is married and a loving father of three children.  His wife is a homemaker and is raising their children at home.  Muslihitdin has been involved in buying and selling dried fruits, such as pistachios, almonds, raisins, rose hip and peanuts.  He has a leased storage space, where he can save dried fruits during the season and then sell them during the winter and autumn seasons.  He also gives dried fruits to entrepreneurs.  He also has his own apricot garden.  He wants to obtain a loan in the sum of $3000 for the purchase of peanuts, almonds and pistachios.  Muslihitdin is grateful to all in advance for the help and support.

loans.use: to purchase peanuts, almonds and pistachios

loans.name: Fatouma

texts.en:
Fatouma is a 42 year old single woman. She opened a grocery store in 1995. She has her customers' trust and loyalty.
Fatouma is a hard working woman. She is requesting a loan from Al Majmoua in order to increase her shop's merchandise. This is Fatouma's sixth cycle as a Al Majmoua borrower. She has a good  paying back history.
Fatouma is working hard to get this loan to improve Ramadan and summer requests as soon as possible, and to get ready for the schools that are going to open in mid September, to meet the students' needs.
Fatouma hopes to expand her business and to do necessary decorations to her shop to compete with others.

loans.use: To increase her merchandise

loans.name: C9237 Abishyizehamwe Group

texts.en:
Fidelite is 46 years old and is married with nine children. Her business is well-organized and is well known in this business of selling products such as:fruits and vegetables, beans, Irish potatoes etc. She is the team leader of this group which is called "Abishyizehamwe" in local language which means in English "Being together". 

In the picture, Fidelite is the second person on the right side. Her business hours are from 7am until 6pm every day and she currently employs one person to help her. She has four years of experience in this business. 

Fidelite and her team have requested a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company in order to increase their businesses by purchasing large quantities of products such as: vegetables and fruits, beans etc for sale. With any profits, they will reinvest the profits in their businesses and save for their future. They will be also able to pay school fees for their children.

loans.use: To purchase a large quantity of products such as: vegetables and fruits, beans etc for sale.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary  lives in  Uganda.  She is single and has no children.  Mary has a business of a bakery.  She has been in this business for 2 years, and she works 6 days out of every week.  Mary sells her products in a retail shop.  Mary has requested a loan of 1000000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more cartons of baking flour, cooking oil and cowpeas (black eyed peas) for making samosas.  She also generates additional income through rental houses. The main business challenges for Mary include  ever increasing prices of cooking oil and baking flour and seasonality.  Her goals and aspirations for her business are to see her business grow, to own a big bakery and also to build her own house. Mary lives in a house that she rents. She has access to electricity and to piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include rent and medication.

loans.use: To buy more cartons of baking flour, cooking oil and cowpeas (black eyed peas)

loans.name: Farhat's Group

texts.en:
Farhat is married and has three sons. Her eldest son operates a business selling sugarcane juice. His juice corner is in a popular public place where he serves a good customer base every day and earns income. Her second son works with a lawyer while her youngest son works in a water supply company. 

Farhat herself is a housewife, stays at home and does her household responsibilities. She is a very active and energetic lady and performs her duties very well. 

She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah to help her son improve his business selling sugarcane juice. With the loan, he will purchase sugarcane in larger quantity to be able to sell juice to many more customers and earn more profit. 

The demand for sugarcane juice becomes high in the summer season and Farhat is confident that an investment will help her son make his business more profitable.

Note: In the photo, the lady with a book (called Asasah Passbook) is Farhat.

loans.use: To buy sugarcane for her son to use to make juice.

loans.name: Graca

texts.pt:
Nasceu na Provincia de Inhambane , tem 32 anos de idade é solteira mãe de 2 filhos todos vão a Escola. Responsabiliza se pela irmã que vive com ela na sua casa. Fez a 7ª classe vive na casa própria e consegue poupar 500.00mt mensalmente.

Muda se com seu marido para o Distrito de Namaacha fixa sua residência e abre um estabelecimento, sofre assalto e por consequência disso fica falida. Anos depois aproxima se a Hluvuku onde consegue um empréstimo e da inicio do seu negócio ate então. trabalha das 7h as 18h e consegue um lucro mensal de 5.000.00mt que aplica nas dispesas da casa e do seu estabelecimento.

Nunca trabalhou com outros Bancos para além da Hluvuku este é seu quarto empréstimo no valor de 10.000.00mt com o qual pretende comprar produtos( massas, batatas , arroz, feijao e mais) para aumentar o volume da sua mercadoria. Os anteriores de (5.000.00, 8.000.00 e 10.000.00)mt foram para o comércio. Espera pagar com muito sucesso e pedir outro para ampliar o seu estabelecimento.
texts.en:
Graca was born in Inhambane Province. She is 32 years old and is a single mother of two children. Both children go to school. Graca supports her sister who lives with her in her house. Graca finished seventh grade. She lives in her own house and is able to save 500 meticais per month.

She moved with her husband to Namaacha District to establish their residence and open a store. She was robbed and because of this went bankrupt. Some years later she approached Hluvuku where she got a loan and began her business.She works from 7:00 am until 6:00 pm and has a profit of 5,000 meticais per month, which she uses for expenses for the house and the store.

Graca has never worked with any banks besides Hluvuku. This is her fourth loan, and she is asking for 10,000 meticais to buy products (pasta, potatoes, rice, beans and other items) to increase her inventory. The previous loans (5,000 meticais, 8,000 meticais and 10,000 meticais) were for the business. 

Graca expects to pay off the loan successfully and ask for another to expand her store.

loans.use: to buy and sell products (pasta, potatoes, rice, beans, etc.).

loans.name: Joaquim

texts.pt:
Nasceu em  Inhambane tem 33 anos de idade é solteiro pai de 4 filhos, dos quais dois vao a escola. Fez a 9ª classe , responsabiliza se pela sua cunhada que vive com ele em sua casa

Muda se de Inhambane para o Distrito de Namaacha com seu tio para continuar com os estudos. Comeca a trabalhar na empresa G4S como seguranca. Trabalha das 7h as 14h no periodo da manha e das 14h as 22h no periodo da noite auferindo mensalmente 4.199.00mt que aplica nas dispesas da casa e conseG. poupar 1.000.00mt por mes.

Conhece a hluvuku atraves dos seus colegas que sao clientes da instituicao, nunca trabalhou com outros bancos. Este e o segundo emprestimo na hluvuku no valor de 12.000.00mt para compra de material de construcao da sua casa ( blocos, areia e pedrinhas). O emprestimo anterior  foi de 10.000.00mt usado para a legalizacao do seu terreno. 
 Pretende adiquirir mais emprestimos para concluir a sua obra.
texts.en:
Joaquim was born in Inhambane. He is a 33-year-old single father with four children. Two of the children go to school. Joaquim finshed ninth grade. He supports his sister-in-law, who lives with him in his house.

He moved from Inhambane to Namaacha District with his uncle in order to continue his studies, then began to work at G4S as a security guard. Joaquim works from 7:00 am until 2:00 pm on the morning shift and from 2:00 pm to 10:00 pm on the night shift. He earns 4,199 meticais per month, which he uses for household expenses. He is able to save 1,000 meticais per month.

Joaquim learned about Hluvuku through coworkers who are also customers of this institution. He has never worked with other banks. This is Joaquim's second Hluvuku loan, and he is asking for 12,000 meticais to buy construction materials for his house (blocks, sand and small stones). The previous loan was for 10,000 meticais and was used to register the title to his land.

Joaquim intends to get more loans in order to finish his house..

loans.use: to buy materials for home construction (blocks, sand and small stones).

loans.name: Zilda

texts.pt:
