Nasceu na Provincia de Inhambane, Sul de Moçambique, de 32 anos, vive maritalmente é mãe de 3 filhos 2 é que vão a Escola. Esta do momento a frequentar 7ª classe . Não responsabiliza se por ninguem e consegue poupar 1.000.00mt nos xitique ( colecta entre negociantes).

tem um estabelecimento comercial na sua residência e, para  aumentar o volume dos seus produtos, aproxima se a Hluvuku solicitando um empréstimo. Conta com ajuda do seu marido que é motorista e proprietario de 3 dependências de aluguer em sua casa estando 1 ainda em construção. 

Está convicta que vai pagar com muito sucesso, para aceder a outros empréstimos. Nunca trabalhou com nenhum Banco, estes 10.000.00mt pretende comprar produtos de primeira necessidade para revenda ( massas, farinha, arroz e mais). Tem como plano recuperar o tempo perdido, dando continuidade dos estudos.
texts.en:
Zilda was born in Inhambane Province in southern Mozambique. She is 32 years old, married, and has three children. Two of the children go to school. Zilda is currently attending seventh grade. She does not support anyone else and is able to save 1,000 meticais through Xitique (collection among businesspeople).

Zilda has a store in her home and, to increase her inventory, she approached Hluvuku asking for a loan. She depends on help from her husband, who is a driver and also owns three rental rooms in their house. One of the rooms is still under construction.

She is sure that she will pay off the loan successfully so she will be able to take out more loans. Zilda has never worked with other banks. She will use these 10,000 meticais to buy staple goods for resale (pasta, flour, rice and other items).

She plans to make up for lost time and continue her studies.

loans.use: to buy and sell products (pasta, flour, rice, etc.).

loans.name: Bonifacio

texts.pt:
Nasceu na Provincia de Sofala, tem 39 anos de idade, é casado pai de 3 filhos todos vão a Escola. Fez o ensino médio Proficional. Vive na casa propria com sua familia  e responsabiliza se pela sua irmã que vive com ele na mesma casa. Consegue poupar 1.000.00mt na sua conta bancaria  pos conta com ajuda da sua esposa que também é Docente.

Muda se para o Distrito de Namaacha após cocluir seu curso de Professorado e fixa sua residência, trabalha ha mais de 23 anos no periodo das 7h as 12h, mas devido ao cargo de Direstor da Escola tem prolongado ate as 17h auferindo mensalmente 5.655.00mt e com um subcidio técnico de 1.590.00 que aplica nas dispesas da casa e da sua obra de construcao da sua casa convencional.

Ja trabalhou com o BIM conhece a hluvuku atraves dos seus colegas. Este é seu  terceiro empréstimo com a Hluvuku no valor de 16.000.00mt com o qual pretende comprar material de construção da sua casa( blocos. Cimento e areia) para conclusão da sua obra. Os anteriores de 10.000.00 e 30.000.00mt foram para a mesma finalidade. Esta prestes a pagar antes do tempo e solicitar outro para concluir os seus estudos.
texts.en:
Bonifacio was born in Sofala Province. He is 39 years old, married, and has three children who all go to school. Bonifacio has taken teacher training. He lives in his own house with his family and supports his sister, who lives with him. He is able to save 1,000 meticais in his bank account because he has help from his wife, who is also a teacher.

Bonifacio moved to Namaacha District after finishing his teaching courses and made his home here. For more than 23 years he has worked from 7:00 am until 12:00 pm, but because he is the school Principal he stays until 5:00 pm. He earns 5,655 meticais per month and has a subsidy of 1,590 meticais, which he uses for household expenses. He also uses the money for construction on his house.

He has worked before with BIM (Millennium bim Bank). He learned about Hluvuku from his coworkers. This is Bonifacio's third Hluvuku loan, and he is asking for 16,000 meticais to buy construction materials for his house (blocks, cement and sand) so he can finish building. The previous loans were for 10,000 meticais and 30,000 meticais, and both were for the same purpose.

Bonifacio is ready to pay off the loan ahead of time and ask for another to finish his studies.

loans.use: to buy construction materials for his house (blocks, cement and sand).

loans.name: Dzame

texts.en:
Dzame is a widow with seven children, all of whom have graduated from school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and water bills.

For the past 15 years, she has operated a quarry business, selling wholesale to constructors. She dreams of establishing a goat meat business in the future.

With a Kshs 30,000 loan Dzame wants to purchase stones for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase stones for resale.

loans.name: Abdusabur

texts.ru:
Абдусабур образованный, трудолюбивый и добросовестный человек. Он женат и любящий отец 3 детей. Более 18 лет он занимается изготовлением лепешек. Он взял одну месту на аренду, чтобы готовить лепешек и продать. Он имеет помощников, который помогает ему для приготовления лепешек. Он сам предоставляет лепешек по магазинам и имеет много регулярных клиентов. Он хотел бы получит займ в размере 800$ США для покупки муки. Заранее Абдусабур благодарен всем за поддержку и доброты. 


More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj
texts.en: Abdusabur is an educated, hard-working and conscientious person.  He is married and a loving father of three children.  He has been involved in making flatbread for over eighteen years.  He leased a space in order to make and sell flatbread.  He has assistants who help him with flatbread preparation.  He delivers flatbread to stores and has many regular customers.  He wants to obtain a loan in the sum of $800 for the purchase of flour.  Abdusabur is grateful to all in advance for the support and kindness.

loans.use: to purchase flour

loans.name: David Bern

texts.pt:
Nasceu no Distrito de Namaacha, tem 32 anos de idade, vive maritalmente é pai de uma menina de 2 anos. Fez a 6ª classe, vive numa casa alugada com sua familia e responsabiliza se pela sua mãe.

 Passa a sua infância ao lado da Avo materna, começa a trabalhar na empresa Aguas de Namaacha como Operador de Maquinas, é funcionario permanente ha mais de 5 anos trabalha das 7h as 17h auferindo mensalmente 4.700.00mt que aplica nas dispesas da casa.

Nunca trabalhou com nenhum Banco, este é o primeiro empréstimo com a Hluvuku no valor de 10.000.00mt com o qual pretende comprar material de construção( cimento, areia e blocos) para dar continuidade da sua obra de construcao da sua casa. Conhece a Hluvuku atraves dos seus colegas que também são clientes da instituição.

Este confiante que vai pagar antes do tempo para aceder a outros empréstimos e dar ainicio de um negócio.
texts.en:
David Bern was born in Namaacha District. He is 32, married and has a little girl who is two years old. David Bern finished sixth grade. He lives in a rented house with his family and supports his mother.

He grew up with his maternal grandmother. He began working as a Machine Operator at Aguas de Namaacha (a bottled water company). He has been a permanent employee for more than five years and works from 7:00 am until 5:00 pm, earning 4,700 meticais per month, which he uses for household expenses.

David Bern has never worked with other banks. This is his first Hluvuku loan, and he is asking for 10,000 meticais to buy construction materials (cement, sand and blocks) so he can continue to build his house. He learned about Hluvuku through coworkers who are also customers of this institution.

He is confident that he will pay off the loan ahead of time so he can take out more loans and begin a business.

loans.use: to buy construction materials (cement, sand and blocks).

loans.name: Pili

texts.en:
Pili is a married woman with five children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past three years, she has operated a retail shop business, selling at wholesale and retail to her neighbors and passersby. Pili dreams of expanding her wholesaling in the future.

With the Kshs 20,000 loan, she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour and sugar. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour and sugar.

loans.name: Bahati

texts.en:
Bahati is a married woman with two children.  One attends school while the other is still too young for school. She owns a house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For more than 10 years, she has operated a tailoring business, selling in a shop to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. Her major goal is to establish a dressmaking school in the future. 

With the Kshs 40,000 loan, she wants to purchase an overlocking machine and cloth. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase an overlocking machine and cloth.

loans.name: C5655 Wisigara Group

texts.en:
Faustin is 40 years old and married, with four children aged between 2 and 12 years old.  He is the first person on the right side.  His business is well-organized and is well known in the business of selling crops.  His business hours are from 10 am until 4:30pm every day. He has two years of experience and he currently employs two people to help him.

Faustin and his group have requested a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company in order to increase their businesses by buying more crops for sale. With any profits, Faustin and his team will reinvest in their businesses and save for their future. They will also be able to pay school fees for their children.

loans.use: To purchase more crops for sale

loans.name: Mbodze

texts.en:
Mbodze is a widowed woman with five children.  Four attend school while one has already graduated. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past four years, she has operated a charcoal-selling business, selling at the market to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of high cost of transportation in her business. Her major dream is to expand to wholesale charcoal selling in the future.

With the Kshs 40,000 loan, she wants to purchase sacks of charcoal for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase sacks of charcoal for resale.

loans.name: C5658 Twisungane Group

texts.en:
Odette is 34 years old and is married with 5 children. Her business is well-organized and is well known in the business of selling clothes. Odette is the team leader of this group which is called "TWISUNGANE" in local language. In the picture, Odette is in the middle with a bag in the hands. Her business hours are from 7am until 6pm every day except on the weekend. Sometimes, she works on the weekend and she employs 2 people to help her. 

Odette and her team have requested a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company in order to improve their businesses by buying various second-hand clothes for sale. With any profits, they will reinvest in their businesses and save for the future.

loans.use: To purchase second-hand clothing for sale.

loans.name: Paul

texts.en:
Paul is a married man with four children.  Three attend school while one is still too young for school. He owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. His greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past five years, he has operated a boda boda (motorcycle) transport business; his potential customers are passersby and neighbors. He faces a major challenge of seasonality in his business. During rainy season it becomes difficult to operate. His major dream is to own a matatu (motor vehicle) for transport business. 

With the Kshs 40,000 loan, he wants to purchase another motorcycle for transport business. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business.

loans.use: To purchase another motorcycle for transport business.

loans.name: Mbeyu

texts.en:
Mbeyu is a married woman with nine children; eight attend school while one has already graduated. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past 10 years, she has operated a charcoal-selling business, selling at the market to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of the high cost of transporting charcoal from the rural areas to her place of operation. She dreams of expanding her charcoal business in the future.

With the Kshs 10,000 loan, she wants to purchase sacks of charcoal for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase sacks of charcoal for resale.

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is a 44-year-old married man, the father of two beloved children. Ali has worked in a  laundry for 25 years.  The laundry was opened in 1949 by his father.  Ali took it after him with loyal customers that are changing from one generation to another. His good reputation, and his father's, have given him a very important position in the area.

Ali is trying to improve his business as much as he can. He requested his first loan from Kiva's partner Al Majmoua to buy a necessary air conditioner to keep him cool in this hot summer season, and to buy a television for the shop.

Ali is planning to do some changes in the future, he'll start with a suitable decoration to make the shop more attractive to new customers.

loans.use: To buy an air conditioner and a television for his shop

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is a married man with three children; two attend school while one does not attend school. He owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. His greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For over 10 years, he has operated a charcoal selling business, selling at the market to his neighbors and passersby. He faces a major challenge of theft because of insecurity in his area of operation. He dreams of operating as a retailer in the future.

With the 25,000 Kenyan shillings, he wants to purchase sacks of charcoal for resale. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business.

loans.use: To purchase sacks of charcoal for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To exchange her old home furniture for new furniture.

loans.name: Nargiza

texts.ru:
Наргиза трудолюбивая, честная и добрая женщина. Она со всеми общается с улыбкою и всегда старается сделать всем добро. Она замужем и любящая мать 2 детей. Более 11 лет она занимается купля продажей продуктов питания на местном рынке. Она начала свой бизнес с продажей мелочевки, а затем постепенно перешла на продаже продукты питания. Она хочет расширить свой бизнес и максимизировать свой прибыль. Она хочет, устроит своих детей в хорошую школу и поэтому ей нужна денег.  По этой причине она запрашивает займ для покупки нового ассортимента продуктов, который позволяет ей максимизировать свой прибыль.  Наргиза хочет заранее благодарить вас за вашу помощь и поддержку.  

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj
texts.en: Nargiza is a hard-working, honest and kind woman.  She interacts with everyone with a smile and always tries to show kindness for everyone.  She is married and a loving mother of two children.  She has been involved in buying and selling food products at the local market for over eleven years.  She started her business with selling small items and then gradually moved to selling food products.  Nargiza wants to expand her business and maximize her profits.  She wants to place her children into a good school and needs money for that.  This is why she is requesting a loan for the purchase of new assortment of products, which will let her maximize her profits.  Nargiza wants to thank all of you in advance for your help and support.

loans.use: to purchase food products

loans.name: Anaam

texts.en:
Anaam is a 32--year-old mother of three daughters. She works as a nanny in a kindergarten. 

Her husband Mohammad is a distributor. Recently they decided to concentrate on distributing kids toys to the shops. Using his experience in the retail and distributing business and her experience in what type of toys kids love has made their business a successful one.

Now Anaam has applied for this loan to renew the distribution bus registration and to buy more types of toys to be distributed to the shops.

And because Anaam is a conservative person, she has requested that her husband appear in the picture.

loans.use: to renew the distribution bus registration and to buy more toys to distribute to shops

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase sacks of charcoal for resale.

loans.name: Hamida

texts.en:
Hamida lives in Uganda. She is single and has five children, all of whom are in school. Hamida has a restaurant. She has been in this business for over 10 years, and she works six days out of every week. Hamida sells her products in a shop, by means of retail. 

Hamida has requested a loan of 500,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bunches of bananas, sweet beef and Irish potatoes. The main business challenges for Hamida include seasonality and the increasing prices of foodstuffs.  

Her goals and aspirations for her business are to see her business grow bigger to a fully stocked restaurant and to educate her children up to university. Hamida lives in a home that she rents; she has access to electricity and has access to piped water. Her major monthly expenses include rent and medication.

loans.use: To buy more bunches of bananas, beef sweet and Irish potatoes.

loans.name: Mwanahamisi

texts.en:
Mwanamisi is married and has three children; two attend school, while the third is not yet old enough to attend. She owns a house that has electricity but not piped-in water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees. For the past three years, she has run a successful business selling coconuts out of her home. Most of her customers are neighbors and passersby. Her main challenge is seasonality, and her big dream for the future is to become a leading supplier of coconuts in her area.

Mwanamisi is applying for a loan for Kshs. 10,000 to buy more coconuts to sell to her customers. She joined Yehu as a way to access loans that will allow her to boost her business.

loans.use: to buy coconuts to sell to her customers during the upcoming festival season.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is divorced and has one child, who is enrolled in a local school. She lives in a rental house that has electricity but not piped-in water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food, school fees and rent. For the past two years, she has earned a living by selling coconuts, mostly to neighbors and passersby. She supplements her income by selling food from a stall located on a nearby street. Her main challenge is that her business is very seasonal. 

Fatuma is applying for a loan for Kshs. 30,000 to buy sacks of coconuts to sell during an upcoming festival season and to open a stall where she can conduct her coconut-selling business. She decided to join Yehu as a way to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to buy sacks of coconuts to sell during an upcoming festival and to open a stall where she can run her business.

loans.name: Elham

texts.en:
Elham is a 28-year-old mother of three children who lives in al Salt where she has a big space of land around her house. A year ago, Elham bought a few goats to raise and started making cheese and yogurt from the goats’ milk. Because she is careful of the hygiene and the expiration date, people trusted her product.

Now Elham wants to improve and increase her productivity by buying more goats and more equipment for making cheese and yogurt. In the future, Elham would love to have a few horses on her farm.

loans.use: to buy more goats and more equipment for making cheese and yogurt

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce lives in  Uganda.  She is single and has five children, one of whom is in school.  Joyce has a business selling milk. She has been in this business for over 10 years, and she works 6 days out of every week.  Joyce sells her products door-to-door, retail.  

Joyce has requested a loan of 400,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more jerrycans of milk. The main business challenges for   Joyce include seasonality and increasing prices of milk.  Her goals and aspirations for her business are to see her business grow big and own permanent business premises and to sell wholesale only.

Joyce lives in a home that she rents; she has access to electricity and piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include rent, paying utility bills and medication.

loans.use: To buy more jerrycans of milk.

loans.name: Zaddock

texts.en:
Zaddock is a married man with one son who is still too young for school. He lives in a rental house that has electricity but not piped water. His greatest monthly expenses are food and rent bills.

For the past four years, he has operated a hardware business, selling in a shop to his neighbours and passersby. He faces a major challenge of seasonality in his business. Zaddock dreams of becoming a leading supplier of timber in the future.

With the Kshs 20,000 he wants to purchase timber for resale. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business.

loans.use: To purchase timber for resale.

loans.name: Mohamed

texts.en:
Mohamed is a married man with one child who is still too young for school. He lives in a rental house that has electricity and piped water. His greatest monthly expenses are food and rent bills.

For the past three years, he has operated a hardware business, selling in a shop to his neighbours. He faces a major challenge of theft because of insecurity in his area of operation. He dreams of becoming a leading supplier of timber in the future.

With the Kshs 20,000 he wants to purchase timber for resale. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business.

loans.use: To purchase timber for resale.

loans.name: Aykaz

texts.ru:
Айказу 59 лет, он живет в деревне Ддмашен, Севанского района, вместе с женой. Сыновья Айказa живут со своими семьями, отдельно от родителей. Айказ окончил Севанское проф. техническое училище. 
20 лет Айказ проработал в сельском совхозе механизатором, а начиная с 1993 года он занимается сельским хозяйством на собственной ферме. Жена Айказа помогает ему и, благодаря совместным усилиям, они разводят коров, овец, поросят и кур. Также Айказу принадлежит небольшой участок земли, на котором он выращивает корм для своих домашних животных, а недостаток корма закупает у своих односельчан. Полученную сельскохозяйственную продукцию (молочную продукцию, говядину, баранину, свинину, яйца и курятину) Айказ продает на Разданском городском рынке, а полученный доход использует на содержание своей семьи. 
Айказу необходим кредит на сумму 500,000 драм для приобретения недостающего корма и для ремонта своей косилки. Полученный доход Айказ и его жена намереваются потратить на завершение строительства своего дома.
texts.en: Aykaz is 59 years old and lives in the Ddmashen village in the Sevan district together with his wife.  Aykaz's sons live together with their families separately from the parents.  Aykaz finished a Sevan professional technical college.  He spent twenty years working as a mechanic in the agricultural collective and then started his own farm in 1993.  Aykaz's wife helps him, and thanks to their joint efforts, they breed cows, sheep, pigs and chickens.  Aykaz also owns a small plot of land, where he grows feed for his domestic animals and buys the remaining feed from his neighbors.  He sells his agricultural products (milk products, beef, lamb, pork, eggs and poultry) at the Razdanskiy city market and uses resulting profits to support his family.  Aykaz needs a loan in the sum of 500,000 dram for the purchase needed animal feed and to repair his lawn mower.  He and his wife intend to use the obtained income to finish the construction of their house.

loans.use: to purchase additional animal feed and to repair a lawn mower

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase mobile phone batteries, mobile phone cases and chargers.

loans.name: Mohamed

texts.en:
This is 60-year-old Mohamed. He is married and has six children who are adults and now independent. His last child is 8 years old and is in primary school. 

In 1972, Mohamed established a palm oil and garri (fermented cassava) business. Working seven days a week and nine hours a day, he earns about 1,200,000 Sierra Leone leones (Le) every month from this business. He would like a loan in the amount of Le 4,000,000. Mohamed hopes that this loan will enable him to increase his monthly profits by approximately Le 300,000. Mohamed has a very good loan repayment history. Mohamed requires a loan to buy drums of palm oil and some bags of garri for his business. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy drums of palm oil and some bags of garri (fermented cassava) for his business.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary lives in Uganda. She is single and has five children, all of whom are in school. Mary has a retail shop. She has been in this business for three years, and she works six days out of every week. Mary sells her products in a shop, by means of retail.  

Mary has requested a loan of 300,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bags of sugar, cartons of salt and boxes of soap. She also generates additional income through rental rooms and piped water. The main business challenges for Mary include seasonality and increasing commodity prices. Her goals and aspirations for her business are to own a wholesale shop.    

Mary lives in a home that she owns; she has access to electricity and has access to piped water. Her major monthly expenses include utility bills and medication.

loans.use: To buy more bags of sugar, cartons of salt and boxes of soap.

loans.name: Ola

texts.en:
Ola is a 35-year-old woman who is married and has four sons and two daughters. She lives in Jenin city located in Palestine. Her husband is employed and earns a decent salary in addition to his work in the cafe. Ola wants to improve this project by purchasing a new refrigerator, chairs, tables. etc. Since she hasn't enough money to pay for these items she needs to take out a loan of $1,500 from FATEN. 

As Ola gets the loan, which is repaid on a monthly basis, she will help to improve the image of the cafe and the increase number of customers, which will lead to increased income and let the family live in better conditions. 

Ola is a conservative woman, so her husband is photographed instead in the cafe.

loans.use: to equip her cafe by purchasing a new refrigerator, chairs, tables, etc.

loans.name: Bihidu

texts.en:
Bihidu is a married woman with eight children, all of whom graduated from school. She owns a house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For over 10 years, she has operated a charcoal-selling business, selling from home to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. Her major dream is to become a leading supplier of charcoal and firewood in the future.

With the 10,000 Kenyan shillings, she wants to purchase bundles of clothes and food for the festive season of Islam’s religion. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase bundles of clothes and food for the festive season of Islam’s religion.

loans.name: Zuhra

texts.ru: Зухра проживает в городе Турсунзаде. Ей 42 года. Она замужем. У нее трое детей. Ее муж работает электриком. Сама Зухра имеет средне - специальное образование, она медсестра. По специальности она работает 15 лет. Кроме того она занимается шитьем. Она у себя дома шьет национальные платья, наволочки и шторы. Этим видом деятельности занимается более 15 лет. Кредит берет для приобретения еще одной швейной машинки и покупки цветных ниток и бисера.
texts.en: Zuhra lives in the city of Tursun-zoda.  She is 42 years old, married and has three children.  Her husband works as an electrician.  Zuhra has a secondary specialized education and is a nurse.  She has been working in this field for fifteen years.  Besides this, she is involved in sewing.  She sews national dresses, pillow cases and window drapes.  She has been involved in this business for over fifteen years.  Zuhra is requesting this loan for the purchase of one more sewing machine and purchase of color threads and beads.

loans.use: to purchase one more sewing machine and color threads and beads

loans.name: Robinah

texts.en:
Robinah lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is divorced with four children, all of whom go to school. She has a restaurant and works seven days a week. 

She has requested a loan of 200,000 Ugandan Shillings (UGX) from MCDT SACCO from to buy more bunches of bananas, beans, rice, and beef. Her business challenges include ever-increasing prices of commodities and defaulters. Her goal is to educate her children up to the university level and also to own a fully stocked restaurant. 

She lives in her own house and the family has no access to piped water and electricity. Her monthly expenses include school fees and food.

loans.use: to buy more bunches of bananas, beans, rice, and beef

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more foodstuffs for her business

loans.name: Milly

texts.en:
Milly lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is divorced and has 3 children who all go to school. She sells charcoal which she works seven days a week. 

She has requested  for a loan of 200,000 Ugandan Shillings (UGX) from MCDT SACCO from to buy more bags of charcoal Her business challenges include the ever-increasing prices of charcoal and the rainy season. Her goal is to educate her children up to the university level and also to start going to villages for charcoal. 

She lives in her own house and the family has no access to piped water and electricity. Her monthly expenses include school fees and food.

loans.use: To buy more bags of charcoal

loans.name: Moses

texts.en:
Moses is a married man with one child who is still too young for school. He owns a house that has electricity and piped water. His greatest monthly expenses are food and motor vehicle repairs. 

For over one year, he has operated a motor vehicle transport business, his potential customers are passersby. He faces a major challenge of seasonality and competition in his business. 

With the 80,000 Kenyan Shillings (KES) he wants to purchase spare parts to repair his motor vehicle. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business.

loans.use: To purchase spare parts to repair his motor vehicle.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase computer software and drivers for his servicing business.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en: Rose lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with 3 children, and all of them go to school. She has a retail shop. She has been in business for the last 5 years. She works seven days a week. She has requested a loan of 200,000 UGX from MCDT SACCO to buy more bags of sugar and flour. Her inspirational goal is to expand into a wholesale shop. Her major business challenges are seasonality and transportation. She lives in a rented house and the family has access to piped water and electricity. Her monthly expenses include rent and food.

loans.use: To buy more bags of sugar and flour.

loans.name: Aurelio

texts.es:
El Señor Aurelio es oriundo de la ciudad de Carapeguá tiene 52 años de edad, está casado hace más de  20 años con la Señora Isidra y tienen tres hijos ya mayores de edad.
Desde temprana edad comenzó con la venta de las colchas que el mismo produce junto con su madre, después de 8 años se independizó y empezó a trabajar por cuenta propia. El se dedica a la venta de hamacas, frazadas y sábanas artesanales. Lleva los productos a vender por las ciudades aledañas a Carapegua, transportándose en su propia motocicleta. Gracias a este trabajo logró construir una modesta casa para su familia y pudo hacerse de varias comodidades en su hogar. El comenta que todo el sacrificio que hace es por darle a su familia una vida digna y decorosa.
Solicita el préstamo para la compra de hamacas, frazadas y sábanas puesto que tiene muchos pedidos de estos productos y le gustaría cumplir con la demanda de sus clientes. Agradece a la Fundación por la oportunidad que esta le brinda.
texts.en:
Aurelio is a native of the city of Carapeguá. He is 52 years old, has been married for more than 20 years to Isidra, and they have three already older children.

From an early age he began to sell bedspreads that he himself produced together with his mother. After 8 years he became independent and began to work on his own. He makes a living selling hammocks, blankets, and handmade sheets. He takes his products to sell in the neighboring cities of Carapeguá, using his own motorcycle as a means of transportation. Thanks to this work he managed to build a modest house for his family and was able to make his home more comfortable. He says that all the sacrifice he makes is to give his family a good, respectable life.

He is requesting the loan to buy hammocks, blankets, and sheets since he has many orders for these products and he would like to fulfill his customers' demands. He is thankful to the Fundación for the opportunity they have given him.

loans.use: to buy hammocks, sheets, and other things for future sales.

loans.name: Fathiya

texts.en:
Fathiya is a 33-year-old housewife married to Nader, a mini-market owner.
 
To be able to support their five children, they decided to work together by opening a mini-market last year in al Wihdat. They started small and through the last year, they were able to fill the shop with the most wanted items.

Now Fathiya has applied for a loan to give her husband more support and buy more items that are requested by their customers, and expand their business to become a super market in the future.

Fathiya is a conservative person who preferred that her husband Nader appear in the photo instead.

loans.use: To buy more food items requested by his customers

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more timber and lubricants for his business.

loans.name: C5654 Twizamure Group

texts.en:
Peace is 39 years old and is married with four children between 1 and 12 years old. Her business is well-organized and is well known in this business of selling soft drinks. Peace is the team leader of this group which is called "TWIZAMURE" in the local language. 

In the picture, she is the first person on the right side and she is in the white shirt.  Her business hours are from 7am until 3pm every day except on Saturday, and she currently employs one person to help her.

Peace and her team have requested a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company in order to increase their businesses. They will reinvest any profits in their businesses and save for their future. Also, Peace will be able to pay school fees for her children and to renovate her own house.

loans.use: To purchase various soft drinks for resale.

loans.name: Asteria

texts.en:
Asteria is 51 years old, married with four children, and she takes care of two dependents. Her business is well-organized and is well known in this business of selling second hand.  Her business hours are from 7am until 6pm every day except on the weekend. Asteria has twenty years of experience in this business.

She requested a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company in order to increase her business by buying various secondhand items for resale. With any profits, Asteria will reinvest in her business and save for the future.

loans.use: To purchase various secondhand items for resale.

loans.name: Filadelfia

texts.es:
La señora Filadelfia tiene 63 años D. edad, está casada desD. hace mucho tiempo con el señor Rodolfo, tienen hijos ya adultos y viven en su propia casa situada en la ciudad D. Encarnación.
La señora es comerciante, posee desD. hace tiempo en su domicilio una linda despensa que es atendida por ella misma en donD. venD. todo tipo D. productos D. primera necesidad. Su esposo es mecánico y posee un pequeño taller también en su domicilio. Gracias a esta actividad ella pueD. cubrir los gastos del hogar y tener buena ganancia ya que tiene mucha clientela D. la zona que diariamente acuD. a su local. Comenta que le gustaría poder seguir ampliándose y agrandar su negocio, con lo que podrá atraer a más clientes.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra D. productos para abastecer su despensa, como ser bebidas, comestibles, lácteos y panificados. Está con muchas esperanzas en el crédito, ya que le será D. mucha ayuda.
texts.en:
Filadelfia is 63 years old, she has been married for many years with Rodolfo, they have adult children and they live in their own house in the town of Encarnación.
Filadelfia is a merchant and she has been running a nice small pantry in her house for many years. She tends to it herself, and she sells every kind of basic necessities. Her husband is a mechanic and he owns a small workshop located in their house as well. Thanks to this activity, she is able to pay for family expenses and to make good money, as she has many customers in the area who daily shop at her store. She says she would like to keep on expanding and improving her activity, in order to be able to attract more customers.
The loan she is requesting will be used to buy products to stock up her pantry, such as drinks, groceries, dairy products and baked goods. She is hopeful that the loan will be of great help to her.

loans.use: To buy groceries, drinks, baked goods and dairy products to stock up her pantry.

loans.name: C13004 Abadahemuka Group

texts.en:
Solange is 37 years old and is married with 15 children. Her business is well-organized and is well known in this business of selling charcoal. Solange is the team leader of this group which is called "ABADAHEMUKA" in the local language. In the picture, Solange is the second person on the left. Her business hours are from 6am until 8pm every day except on the weekend. 

Solange and her team have requested a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company in order to increase their businesses by buying more sacks of charcoal for sale. With any profits, they will reinvest in their businesses and save for their future.

loans.use: To purchase more sacks of charcoal for sale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase sacks of tomatoes, potatoes, onions and green vegetables.

loans.name: Pili

texts.en:
Pili is a divorced woman with two children who attend school. She owns a house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees.

For the past ten years, she has operated a tailoring business, selling in a shop to her neighbors and passersby.  She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. She dreams of expanding her business to meet her customers' demand. 

With the Kshs 20,000 she wants to purchase cloth materials, zips and thread. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase cloth materials, zips and thread.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is a 25-year-old married father of two children. He sells clothes in Mariakani, and his business has been in operation for the last five years. He has been loaned KES 40,000 and this is his third loan from KADET to finance his business. With this loan amount, he plans to expand his business by purchasing more clothes for re-sale.

 The anticipated profits will be used to repay the loan and to gradually expand his business. His dream is to become a successful businessman.

loans.use: to expand his business by purchasing more clothes for re-sale.

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en:
Daniel is 47 years old and he is married with five children. He sells shoes for elders and children. He has seven years of experience in this business. He works from 7am until 8pm every day except on the weekend.

Daniel has requested a loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company to expand his business by purchasing various shoes such as: adults' and children's shoes for sale. Once his business is expanded, he hopes to reinvest in this business and to save for the future.

loans.use: To purchase various shoes such as: adults' and children's shoes  to sell.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a 65-year-old single mother of one son aged thirty-one. She runs a restaurant in Kilifi and her business has been in operation for one and a half years. 

This is her fourth loan to finance her business. She has been loaned 55,000 Kenyan Shillings (KES). With this loan she plans to expand her business by purchasing more seats and tables for her restaurant and iron sheets and a small tent in her restaurant to increase the seating capacity. 

The anticipated profits from her business will be used to repay the loan and to start building rental houses. 

Her dream is to become a successful businesslady and to start an outside catering business.

loans.use: to purchase seats, tables, iron sheets, and a small tent for her restaurant

loans.name: Ita

texts.en:
Ita has been an animal trader for the past fifteen years. He is married and supports six people in his family. He was introduced to KADET by a KADET staff member. He has been loaned KES 70,000. This is  his second loan which he plans  to purchase more animals.

With the anticipated profit he plans to  reinvest in the business. In the near future he hopes to be a successful businessman.

loans.use: to purchase more animals.

loans.name: Kibibi

texts.en:
Kibibi is a married woman with five children who all attend school. She owns a house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees.

For the past two years, she has operated a tailoring business, selling from home to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. She dreams of opening another business in the future.

With the Kshs 10,000 she wants to purchase cloth, thread and an additional sewing machine. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase cloth, thread and an additional sewing machine.

loans.name: Miriam

texts.en:
Miriam is a married woman with two children; one attends school while the other is still too young for school. She owns a house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and electricity bills.

For the past ten years, she has operated a retail shop business, selling to her neighbors and passersby. She sells household consumption items like wheat flour, maize flour and sugar. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. She dreams of establishing another retail shop in the future.

With the Kshs 50,000 she wants to purchase sacks of beans, rice and sugar. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost the business.

loans.use: To purchase sacks of beans, rice and sugar.

loans.name: Abishyizehamwe C5657 Group

texts.en:
Jeanne is 58 years old and is married with one child who is 25 years old. She takes care of two dependents aged 2 and 5 years old. Her business is well-organized and she is well known in this business of selling rice at the market. Jeanne is the team leader of this group which is called "Abishyizehamwe" in the local language which means in English "Being together". 

In the picture, Jeanne is the first person on the left side and she has a black bag in her hand. Her business hours are from 7am until 6pm every day and she currently employs one person to help her.

Jeanne and her team have requested a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company in order to expand their businesses by buying more products (rice, Irish potatoes, beans and so on) for sale. With any profit, they will reinvest in their businesses and save for their future. Jeanne will also be able to renovate her house.

loans.use: To purchase a large quantities of rice for sale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to expand his butchery.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cows for slaughter for sale  in his butchery business.

loans.name: Fraternidad Group

texts.es:
El comité Fraternidad se formó con la unión de varias vecinas y amigas de la ciudad de Mariano Roque Alonso. Todas las integrantes formaron un grupo muy unido y capaz de realizar conjuntamente actividades que fortalecen su compañerismo. Ellas formaron el grupo con el objetivo de poder crecer, no solo económicamente, sino también a nivel personal.
La Señora Domitila es una de las integrantes del comité, es madre soltera y sus hijos la ayudan en todos los quehaceres de la casa. Ella se dedica  a la  venta de joyas de plata desde hace ya un tiempo, comenta que siempre recibe pedidos de sus clientes ya que es muy conocida. Uno de sus sueños es poder abrir su propia joyería y de esa forma poder atraer a más clientes. Se encuentra muy satisfecha con su actividad y las capacitaciones que recibe el grupo.
La señora Domitila solicita el crédito para comprar más variedad de joyas y de esa forma abastecerse para cumplir con sus clientes.
texts.en:
The communal bank "Fraternidad" (Fraternity) was formed by uniting various friends and neighbors in the city of Mariano Roque Alonso. All the members formed a group that is very united and capable of carrying out activities together that strengthen their comradeship. They formed a group whose objective is to be able to grow, not just economically, but also at a personal level.

Señora Domitila is one of the members of the group. She is a single mother, and her children help her with all the household tasks. She has been selling  silver jewelry for some time, and she comments that she always receives orders from her customers, since she is very well known. One of her dreams is to be able to open her own jewelry shop and in this way be able to attract more customers. She is very satisfied with her business and the training that the group receives.

Señora Domitila is applying for the loan to buy a greater variety of jewelry and in this way have stock to satisfy her customers.

loans.use: to buy jewelry to sell.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes is a married woman with four children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past 14 years, she has operated a retail shop business, selling household goods like wheat flour and maize flour. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. She dreams of incorporating a restaurant business in the future.

With the KSHS 100,000, she wants to purchase sacks of rice, beans and sugar. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase sacks of rice, beans and sugar.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase cloth materials to sell during the festive season.

loans.name: Shida

texts.en:
Shida is a married man with five children, all of whom graduated from school. He lives in a rental house that has neither electricity nor piped water. His greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past 10 years, he has operated a retail shop business, selling in a shop to his neighbors and passersby. He faces a major challenge of seasonality in his business. He dreams of expanding his business in the future.

With the KSHS 20,000, he wants to purchase sacks of tomatoes, onions and coconuts for resale. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business.

loans.use: To purchase sacks of tomatoes, onions and coconuts for resale.

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce lives in Uganda. She is married and has eight children, all of whom are in school. She also takes care of an additional family member (a sister).  

Joyce has a restaurant.  She has been in this business for seven years, and she works six days out of every week. Joyce sells her products in a shop, by means of retail.  

Joyce has requested a loan of 200,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bunches of bananas, beef, and sweet and Irish potatoes. The main business challenges for Joyce include seasonality and the increasing price of food. Her goals and aspirations for her business are to own a fully stocked restaurant. 

Joyce lives in a home that she owns; she has access to electricity and has access to piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include utility bills, school fees and medication.

loans.use: To buy more bunches of bananas, beef, and sweet and Irish potatoes

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase bales of bags for resale.

loans.name: Nyabiherere Bakyara Tutungukye Group

texts.en:
Nine years of unwavering resolve and efficacy have brought dividends to 37-year-old Benon's produce sales business in Ibanda. The sturdy father of five speaks glowingly of how he has been able to bring a new lease of life to his family. Benon is invariably firm in purpose. Notwithstanding the hardships he has faced, he has not wavered.

Benon plies his trade in one of the biggest food markets in Ibanda. What has helped his cause is the fact that he is a farmer. On his farms, he grows and harvests crops such as maize, rice, bananas and yams. At length, these are the crops he sells. Weekly his business's gross sales income is to the tune of Uganda shillings 80,000.

He says he intends to use this Kiva loan to purchase more maize and bean seeds to grow.

loans.use: to purchase more maize and beans seeds to grow.

loans.name: Edward

texts.en:
Edward is 24 years old and has operated a retail shop for the past six years. He has been loaned KES 80,000. He plans to use the loan to purchase more goods like bales of sugar, rice, flour, cooking fat, etc.  He plans to use the anticipated profit to build a permanent house and educate his children.


His dream is to improve the living standard of his family.

loans.use: to purchase more goods like bales of sugar, rice, flour, cooking fat, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more goats for sale.

loans.name: Raul Eligio

texts.es:
El Señor Raul tiene 37 años de edad, se encuentra acompañado con la Señora Carolina de 29 años de edad, ellos tiene dos hijos. Don Raul se dedica a la mecánica hace más de 13 años, aproximadamente desde el año 1.998; comenzó siendo secretario de otra persona, con quien se hizo de conocimientos en la profesión, en la actualidad tiene todo su equipamiento y su local estratégicamente ubicado para que los clientes lleguen fácilmente.
Comenta que tiene una buena cantidad de clientes que siempre acuden a él, ya que les proporciona una buena atención y simpatía. Uno de sus proyectos es seguir ampliando su negocio y de esta forma seguir creciendo y atraer a más clientes. Comenta que todo el esfuerzo que hace es por su esposa y sus hijos, ya que ellos son las personas más importantes para él.
Solicita el crédito para la compra de pinturas, masillas, base y demás, para la utilización en el taller mecánico. Está con mucha esperanza en el crédito, ya que de obtenerlo le será de mucha ayuda.
texts.en:
Sr. Raul is 37 years old and accompanied by Sra. Carolina, age 29. They have two children. Don Raul has been a mechanic for more than 13 years, since 1998. He started out as an assistant for another person and gained knowledge about this profession. Raul currently has all of his equipment and a strategic location that his customers can find easily.

He says that he has a large number of customers who always come to him since he provides good service and sympathy. One of his projects is to continue expanding his business so that he can achieve more growth and attract more customers. All of his efforts are geared to providing for his wife and children, the people who are most important to him.

Raul is requesting a loan to buy paints, putty, base coat, and other products that he uses in his auto repair shop. He is extremely hopeful that this loan will be of great help.

loans.use: to buy paints, putty, base coat, and other products.

loans.name: Abdul Karim

texts.en:
This is 40-year-old Abdul.  He is married and has four children aged 10, 8, 4 and 4 months. He has one additional dependent, who lives with him because she is his niece.  

In 2002, Abdul established his clothing business. He began his business because he wanted to be self-employed and be able to support his family. Working 6 days a week and 9 hours a day, he earns about Le 1,300,000 every month from this business. He would like a loan in the amount of Le 4,500,000. 

Abdul has already received and successfully repaid one loan and now requires a new loan in order to buy additional jeans and shirts for men. He hopes that this loan will enable him to increase his monthly profits by approximately Le 300,000. 

In the future, Abdul plans to educate his children through university. Abdul used the proceeds of his previous loan to build a kiosk as he was under a tree and he hopes that this loan will enable him to buy a plot of land. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to pay for jeans and shirts for his business.

loans.name: Aramat

texts.en:
Aramat has been a farmer for the last ten years. He is 42 years old and is married. They are blessed with four children.

He learned about KADET from the marketing done by the KADET staff in his area. This is his second loan. He has been loaned KES 50,000, and he plans to purchase farm supplies like seeds and fertilizer. 

With the anticipated profit made he wants to re-invest in farming and buy a bigger farm. His dream is  to be the best and best-known farmer in the area.

loans.use: to purchase farm supplies.

loans.name: Joweria

texts.en: Joweria lives in Uganda. She is married and has two children, both of whom are in school. She also takes care of additional family members (a sister). Joweria has a food stall business. She has been in this business for two years and she works six days out of every week.  Joweria sells her products at the market by means of retail. Joweria has requested a loan of 200,000 Ugandan shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bunches of bananas, cassava, sweet and Irish potatoes. The main business challenge(s) for Joweria include seasonality and the increasing price of foodstuffs. Her goals and aspirations for her business are to own a fully stocked food stall. Joweria lives in a home that she rents. She doesn't have access to electricity or piped water. Her major monthly expenses include rent, school fees and medication.

loans.use: To buy more bunches of bananas, cassava, sweet and Irish potatoes

loans.name: Everine

texts.en:
Everine is 46 years old and married. She sells used clothes in Gongoni Market in Malindi. She has been in this business for the past four years. She earns a monthly income of about KES 35,000, which she uses to look after herself as well as to run her business.

She has been loaned KES 30,000 from Kadet Limited. This is her first loan. She intends to use her loan to purchase additional stock of used clothes for her business with the aim of expanding it due to the rise in her clients in the region. 

With the anticipated profit, she plans to continue running her business as well as continue to save a portion of it so that she can clear the loan and apply for another.

loans.use: TO ADD MORE USED CLOTHES TO HER BUSINESS STOCK

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase cows to slaughter and sell in his butchery, and he also wants to expand his butchery

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy tomatoes

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more sheep for sale

loans.name: Jane Rose

texts.en:
Jane Rose lives in Uganda. She is married and has two children, one of whom is in school. She also takes care of an additional family member (a sister). 

Jane Rose has a beauty salon. She has been in this business for three years, and she works six days out of every week. Jane Rose sells her products in a shop, by means of retail. She has requested a loan of 200,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more boxes of cream relaxers and braids. 

The main business challenges for Jane Rose include seasonality and the increasing prices of braids and cream relaxers. Her goals and aspirations for her business are to own a bridal salon. 

Jane Rose lives in a home that she rents; she has access to electricity and piped water. Her major monthly expenses include rent, school fees, and medication.

loans.use: To buy more boxes of cream relaxers and Braids

loans.name: Jackson

texts.en:
Jackson is 45 years old and married with six children. He does mixed farming, i.e., rearing sheep, goats and also he is a wheat farmer which he has been doing for the past ten years.

He learned about Kadet through a KADET staff member. He has applied for his third loan of KES 60,000 which he plans to spend part on farming and the remainder to purchase more animals.

With  the anticipated profit made he plans to educate his children. He dreams of expanding both his businesses.

loans.use: to spend part on farming and the remainder to purchase more animals.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is a hard-working 38-year-old business woman. She is married and blessed with a 4-year-old child. For  the last five years, she has been selling gas cylinders so as to make a living. She wants in the next five years to expand her business into wholesale. 

Her dream is to buy a plot in the city centre. She is requesting a loan of 20,000 Kenya shillings to buy gas cylinders. Thanks to Faulu Kenya, she has been able to embrace the culture of saving.

loans.use: To buy gas cylinders.

loans.name: Hanifa

texts.en:
Hanifa  lives in Uganda.  She is married and has  three children, two of whom are in school. Hanifa  has a retail shop. She has been in this business for three years, and she works 6 days out of every week.  Hanifa sells her products in the shop, retail. 

Hanifa  has requested a loan of 200,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more boxes of  soap and cartons of salt. The main business challenges for   Hanifa  include  seasonality and  increasing prices of  commodities.  Her goals and aspirations for her business are to own a wholesale shop. 

Hanifa  lives in a home that she owns; she has access to electricity and piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include feeding the family, school fees and medication.

loans.use: To buy more boxes of soap and cartons of salt.

loans.name: Maria Amelia

texts.es:
La Señora Maria tiene 27 años de edad, está casada con el Señor Bernardo de 26 años, ellos tienen 1 hijo pequeño de 2 años 7 meses.
La señora Maria se dedica a la venta de teléfonos celulares, como así también de accesorios para los mismos. Empezó este negocio aproximadamente hace un año y medio, anteriormente trabajaba en una importante entidad financiera; al salir de la empresa con la ayuda de su marido logró montar un negocio que fue creciendo de a poco y que hoy cuenta con una clientela importante.
Comenta que la venta de celulares y accesorios le trae muy buena ganancia, ya que los mismos son muy solicitados, además de eso dice también que es un mercado muy competitivo. Su meta es poder seguir creciendo y ampliando su local, o de ser posible abrir otras tiendas más.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de accesorios para teléfonos, como ser estuches, colgantes carcazas, teclados y otros, para la posterior venta. Ella agradece por la oportunidad que la Fundación le está dando.
texts.en:
Maria is 27 years old, is married to Bernardo who is 26 years old, and they have a little 2 year 7 month old child. 

Maria sells cell phones and also accessories for them. She began this business approximately 1-1/2 years ago. Before that she worked at a major financial institution. Upon leaving the company, with the help of her husband, she was able to start a business that grew little by little and which today has an important clientele. She says that the sale of cell phones and accessories provides a good income, because they are always in high demand, but she also says the market is very competitive. 

Her goal is to be able to continue growing and expanding locally, or if possible to open more stores. She is asking for a loan in order to buy telephone accessories such as cases, hanging holders and keyboards for resale. She is grateful for the opportunity that the Foundation is giving her.

loans.use: to purchase telephone accessories for resale

loans.name: Collins

texts.en:
Collins is a hard-working 29-year-old businessman. He is married and blessed with three children aged 4, 3 and 2. 

For the last four years, he has been operating a mobile-phone repair shop so as to make a living. He wants in the next five years to have a mobile phone shop. He is requesting a loan of 30,000 Kenya shillings to buy mobile phone spare parts and accessories. Thanks to Faulu Kenya, he has been able to access credit easily.

loans.use: To buy mobile phone spare parts and accessories.

loans.name: Ressa

texts.en:
Ressa is a hard-working 35-year-old business lady. She is married and blessed with four children. For the last three years, she has been offering tailoring services so as to make ends meet. She wants in the next five years to be engaging in the export and import business. 

She is requesting a loan of 20,030 Kenya shillings to buy shares at the Nairobi Stock Exchange, install electricity and renovate her business premises. Thanks to Faulu Kenya, she is now able to keep records for her business.

loans.use: To buy shares at the Nairobi Stock Exchange, install electricity and renovate business premises.

loans.name: Banco Comunal Luz De Campo Group

texts.es: El Banco Comunal Luz De Campo es conformado por Mayra  Del Rosario, Érica Del Carmen, Luz Mila, Nicolasa Danelia, Leyla Victoria, Nubia, Antonio, Anastacia Basilia, Julia Yamileth, Tomasa Del Socorro y Érica Del Carmen. Todas ellas son mujeres emprendedoras. Actualmente cuenta con 11 mujeres, con el programa y que les gustaría poder seguir con este gran proyecto. Mayra se dedica a la venta y elaboración de artesanía, desde hace más de 25 años,  Ella tiene el sueño de algún día poder construir su vivienda y así ofrecerle a sus hijos algo para el futuro. Los demás integrantes tienen diferentes actividades económicas y juntos se han asociado para obtener financiamiento en sus negocios.  Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de pinturas, pinceles jarrones entre otros.
texts.en:
The communal bank Luz de Campo is made up of Mayra  Del Rosario, Érica Del Carmen, Luz Mila, Nicolasa Danelia, Leyla Victoria, Nubia, Antonio, Anastacia Basilia, Julia Yamileth, Tomasa Del Socorro y Érica Del Carmen. They are all enterprising women. Currently there are 11 women with the program and they would like to be able to continue working with this great project. 

Mayra devotes herself to making and selling handicraft which she has done for over 25 years. She has the dream of some day being able to build her own home and thus offer her children something for the future. The other members have various businesses and have joined together to obtain financing in their ventures. She is requesting the loan to purchase paints, brushes, and vases among other items.

loans.use: to purchase paint, brushes, and vases among other items.

loans.name: Annet

texts.en:
Annet lives in Uganda. She is married and has four children, three of whom attend school. She also takes care of an additional family member (a sister).

Annet has a food stall. She has been in this business for six years, and she works seven days out of every week. Annet sells her products from home, by means of retail. 

She has requested a loan of 200,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy bunches of bananas, sweet potatoes, and Irish potatoes. She also generates additional income through selling charcoal. The main business challenges for Annet include seasonality and the increasing prices of foodstuffs. 

Her goals and aspirations for her business are to be a wholesaler. Annet lives in a home that she owns; she has access to electricity and piped water. Her major monthly expenses include feeding the family, school fees, and medication.

loans.use: To buy more bananas, sweet potatoes, and Irish potatoes

loans.name: Alex

texts.en:
Alex is a hard-working and honest 30-year-old businessman. He is married and blessed with two children who are school-going. For the last five years, he has been operating an agency dealing with the sale of properties and rent collection. He makes an extra shilling by selling household goods. Previously, he used to run a bar. 

In the next five years he wants to have increased his turnover by 50%. His dream is to be a prosperous businessman. He is requesting for a loan of 20,030 Kenya shillings to buy a computer for his business. Thanks to Faulu Kenya he has been able to grow financially.

loans.use: To buy a computer for his business.

loans.name: Jared

texts.en:
Jared is a hard-working businessman aged 34. He is single. For the last four years, he has been operating a retail shop so as to make a living.  He supplements his income from the earnings he makes from his cyber cafe. 

In the next five years, he wants to have  opened up  a mini-supermarket. He is requesting a loan of 50,000 Kenya shillings to buy a printer and a computer. Thanks to Faulu Kenya he has become business-oriented.

loans.use: To buy a printer and a computer.

loans.name: Tunu

texts.en:
Tunu is a married woman with two children, both of whom attend school. She owns a house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past ten years, she has operated a food vending business, selling retail and at the market to her neighbours. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. She dreams of establishing a beauty salon business in the future.

With the Kshs 60,000 she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, beans, cooking fat and charcoal. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase bundles of wheat flour, beans, cooking fat, and charcoal.

loans.name: Benard

texts.en:
Benard is an honest and straight-forward 36-year-old businessman. He is married and blessed with three children of whom one is in school. To make a living, he has been selling newspapers so as to meet the needs of his family. He supplements his income from the earnings that he gets from his barber shop. 

He wants in the next 5 years to have improved his businesses and become self-reliant. His dream is to own his own house. He is requesting a loan of 40,000 Kenya shillings to buy a sewing machine so as to be able to start a new business of tailoring. Thanks to Faulu Kenya, he has become enlightened in financial matters.

loans.use: To buy a sewing machine.

loans.name: Laura Elizabeth

texts.es:
La Señorita Laura tiene 30 años de edad, es peluquera y está viviendo con sus padres y hermanos. Tiene una peluquería en el centro de la ciudad de Itá en la cual trabaja con la ayuda de sus hermanos.
Laura empezó trabajando en esta profesión con su madre hace como 10 años en su propia casa, y con mucho esfuerzo y gracias a los ahorros que tenía consiguió capacitarse en el exterior y de esa forma ser una profesional especializada. Actualmente posee una buena experiencia en dicha profesión lo cual le ayuda  para sacar adelante a toda su familia.
Comenta que tiene muchas clientas y clientes, los cuales siempre acuden a ella por el buen servicio que esta presta a sus clientes. Dice que todo el esfuerzo que realiza es por darle a su familia lo mejor, y que de esa forma tengan un mejor estilo de vida.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de tintes, gel, tijeras, cera y otros insumos necesarios para la peluquería. Agradece por la oportunidad que la Fundación le da, ya que de tener el crédito le será de gran ayuda.
texts.en:
Laura is 30 years old, a beautician, and lives with her parents and brothers. She has a beauty shop in the center of Ita city in which she works, with the help of her brothers. Laura began working in this profession with her mother some 10 years ago in her house, and with much effort, and thanks to savings she had, Laura managed to prepare herself to become a professional specialist. At present, she has good experience in this profession, which helps her to advance all of her family.

Laura comments that she has many clients, female and male. She says all her efforts are to provide her family with the best, so that in this form, she can have a better lifestyle.

Laura is requesting a loan to buy coloring, gel, scissors, wax, and other necessary supplies for her beauty shop. She is grateful for the opportunity the Foundation provides, because having credit will be a  great help for her.

loans.use: buy coloring, gel, scissors, wax, and other necessary supplies for her beauty parlor.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase bundles of Kikoi's and Khanga's (kinds of African print cloth) and shoes for resale.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en: Agnes is an honest businesswoman, aged 25 years. She is married and blessed with two children, aged 10 and 2 years. For the last 10 years, she has been operating a retail shop to make a living. In the next five years, she wants to have another shop. Her dream is to own a wholesale business. She is requesting a loan of 20,030 Kenyan shillings to buy sweets, sodas, salt and cooking oil.

loans.use: To buy sweets, sodas, salt and cooking oil.

loans.name: Pascal

texts.en: Pascal is a hard-working 27-year-old businessman. He is married and blessed with seven children who are school-going. To make a living, he has been engaging in the carpentry business. He supplements his income from the earnings he makes from his shop. He wants in the next five years to have expanded his business. His dream is to be an expert in woodwork. He is requesting a loan of 20,030 Kenya shillings to buy timber, nails, and paint.

loans.use: To buy timber, nails, and paint.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, sugar and paraffin.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a hard-working business woman aged 40. She is married and blessed with four children who are school-going. For the last 18 years, she has been operating a retail shop to make a living. She makes an extra shilling from the rent she collects from her rental houses. Previously, she used to run a "posho" (cornmeal) mill. 

In the next five years, she wants to have expanded her business. She is requesting a loan of 20,030 Kenya shillings to renovate her business premises and to install electricity.

loans.use: To renovate her business premises and to install electricity.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay for additional electrical and home appliances.

loans.name: Flor Margarita

texts.es: La Sra. Flor es casada, tiene 2 hijos de 12 y 8 años de edad; se dedica a la venta de abarrotes ya que cuenta con su propia tienda, empezó este negocio por medio de su cuñado, ya que él le dejo su casa para que vivan en ella; ya cuenta con 4 años en el negocio. El crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de un lote urbano para construir su propia casa; su sueño es ver crecer su negocio y tener su casa propia. La Sra. Flor está muy agradecida por el crédito otorgado.
texts.en:
Flor is married and has two children, ages 12 and 8.  Flor has her own store, and she sells groceries.  She started in this business due to her brother-in law.  He left her his house so that she could live in it.  She has had the business for four years.

The loan is to buy an urban lot in order to build her house.  

Her dreams are to see her business grow and to have her own house.

Flor is very grateful for the loan.

loans.use: to buy an urban lot in order to build her house.

loans.name: Aminata

texts.en:
This is 25-year-old Aminata.  She is married and has no children.   

 In 2006; Aminata established her ready-made clothing business. She began her business because she had gained experience from her mother and she wanted to be independant. Working 7 days a week and 10 hours a day, she earns about Le 950,000 every month from this business. She would like a loan in the amount of Le 5,000,000. 

Aminata has already received and successfully repaid two loans and now requires a new loan in order to buy additional bedspreads and baby pants, etc. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately Le 200,000. 

In the future, Aminata plans to complete her building and to develop her business.   She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To pay for additional ready-made clothing for her business.

loans.name: Petronila

texts.en:
Petronila is a married woman with four children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past four years, she has operated a clothes selling business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. In addition she also sells fried potatoes which contributes to her other source of income. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. She dreams of becoming a wholesale supplier of clothes in the future.

With the Kshs 25,000 she wants to purchase bundles of clothes to sell during festive season. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase bundles of clothes to sell during the festive season.

loans.name: Hadija

texts.en:
Hadija is a married woman with three children, two boys and one girl, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past ten years, she has owned real estate houses. Her potential customers are tenants. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. She dreams of establishing more real estate houses in the future.

With the Kshs 60,000 she wants to renovate the houses and start a vegetable stall business. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To renovate the houses and start a vegetable stall business.

loans.name: Futuro Dos Punto Cero Group

texts.es:
Éste Banco comunal se llama “Futuro Dos Punto Cero” está conformado por 20 emprendedores que se dedican a diferentes rubros, entre los cuales se encuentran negocios, venta de ropa y venta de abarrotes, entre otros. Todos ellos pertenecientes a la comuna de San Bernardo, ciudad de Santiago. 
Nelly presidenta del Banco comunal, quien en la foto aparece sentada en primera fila, ocupando el segundo lugar de derecha a izquierda, viste una chaqueta color negro y su cabello es corto y de color rubio. 
Ella se dedica a la venta de ropa usada desde hace 15 años, en un puesto que ubica en ferias libres. Su horario laboral es durante las mañanas, dos veces a la semana y también los fines de semana. Cuenta con una gran cantidad de clientes, algunos de ellos los conserva desde sus inicios.
En la actualidad quiere incursionar en la venta de ropa nueva.
Con el crédito comprará ropa nueva. 
Sus metas son tener un local establecido en el persa, de ésta manera prosperar en su negocio. 
Nelly vive junto a su esposo y sus cuatro hijos de 30, 29, 17 y 13 años de edad, más una nieta de 7 años de edad. Sus sueños son brindarles educación de calidad a sus hijos y nieta, para que tengan una mejor calidad de vida. 
Sus motivaciones de continuar con el negocio, se deben a que ella a través de su trabajo es un aporte económico para su hogar.
Nelly está muy contenta y agradecida de los créditos y servicios otorgados por Fondo Esperanza, además se siente muy cómoda con el grupo del Banco comunal, ya que se conocen desde hace años, puesto que son vecinos entre ellos. Estas reuniones le han permitido realizarse personalmente.
Respecto a las capacitaciones le han servido para especializarse y  administrar su negocio de mejor manera.
