The loan she is requesting will be used to buy merchandise such as rice, sugar, noodles, and other things.
The community bank "Virgen de Chapi" meets in the city of Cusco (Peru). Cusco is known as an area for tourists and business, for its traditional fiesta called Inti Raymi, and for being the home of Machupicchu, one of the 7 Wonders of the World.

loans.use: to buy merchandise such as sugar, noodles, and other things.

loans.name: San Ramon Group

texts.es:
12 vecinas y amigas de la ciudad de San Lorenzo se unieron con el objetivo de generar mayores ingresos para sus familias. Ellas se definen como mujeres luchadoras trabajadoras y por sobre todo muy responsables. Su mayor deseo es brindar a sus hijos y familiares todo aquello que ella no tuvieron acceso.
La Señora Claudia se dedica a la venta de ropas, dice que es su fuerte ya que lo de la venta es lo suyo, posee una clientela bien definida, pues se dedica ya hace mucho tiempo a esto. Desea, en un futuro no muy lejano, poder tener un local propio en su domicilio donde pueda vender todas las prendas que tiene. Comenta que tiene mucha demanda de prendas de invierno puesto que estamos en la época fría del año.
Por ello solicita el crédito, para la compra de prendas de invierno como ser camperas, bufandas, guantes, medias buzos y demás, para que de esa forma pueda cumplir con los pedidos de su cliente. Agradece a la Fundación por la oportunidad que esta le da.
texts.en:
Twelve friends and neighbors from the city of San Lorenzo came together with the goal of generating more income for their families. The women describe themselves as hardworking, fighters and, above all, very responsible. Their greatest desire is to provide their children and their families with everything that they were not able to access.

Señora Claudia makes her living in clothing sales. She says that this is her specialty because sales are her thing and she has a well-defined clientele as she has been in this business for some time. In the not-so-distant future, she would like to have her own store in her home where she could sell all of the garments she has. 

She comments that she has a great demand for winter clothing because it is the cold season. She is requesting this loan so that she will be able to purchase winter garments like jackets, scarves, gloves, socks, sweat shirts and the like to satisfy her clients' demand. She thanks the Fundación for the opportunity it has given her.

loans.use: to purchase winter clothing for resale.

loans.name: Adrian

texts.es: Adrián tiene 30 años, vive en compañía de su esposa Elizabet de 29 años, y sus 2 hijos, en su casa que es propia, ubicada en el distrito de LLochegua. Adrián, es una persona que se caracteriza por ser muy idealistas y con muchos proyectos, pero para llegar a cumplirlas debe ser muy precavido. Es así que cultiva cacao, que junto a su esposa, injertan las plantas para lograr obtener un mejor producción, siendo cada fruto un mayor volumen y eso le da mucha ventaja frente a los demás frutos tradicionales. Pero sabe que la falta mucho trabajo por hacer, se sacrifica dia y noche con la finalidad de sacar provecho a sus tierras que todavía aún no cuentan con plantación alguna. Generalmente recibe la ayuda de su familia, para que e faciliten en la extracción de sus productos. Este es su primer con MFP, por el que se compromete en cancelar puntualmente el pago de sus cuotas. Con los 1.500 que solicita, desea comprar más plantas de cacao.
texts.en: 30 year old Adrián lives with his wife, 29 year old Elizabet, and their 2 children in their own house, which is in the district of Llochegua. Adrián is a very idealistic person who has many projects on the go, but, to be able to complete the projects, he needs to be very prudent. For instance, he and his wife grow cocoa trees and they graft the plants so that they will have improved production and so that each fruit will be a good size, and this gives them a great advantage over the traditional fruits. But he knows that he has a lot of work to do, he works day and night with the goal of getting the best yield from the land that he has not yet planted. He generally gets help from his family, who help him to harvest his crops. This is his first loan from MFP and he promises to make his repayments punctually. He will use the $550 he is requesting to buy more cocoa plants.

loans.use: to buy more cocoa trees.

loans.name: Luis Antonio

texts.es:
El Profesor Luis Antonio trabaja como docente de secundaria y por la noche docente de educación superior, el crédito anterior fu utilizado para estudiar una maestría, a cual no ha finalizado y así reforzar sus conocimientos y poder brindar una mejor educación a sus alumnos, este mes es su promoción.

Su mayor sueño en la vida es lograr mejorar las condiciones de vida de us familia y eso lo hará a través del esfuerzo por mejorar su situación profesiona, por lo que el crédito será usado para la compra de una laptop y así poder reforzar sus estudios que cursa actualmente.
texts.en:
Professor Luis Antonio works as a secondary school teacher and in the evening as a college professor.  He used his previous loan to study for a Master’s Degree, which he still has not completed and so he wants to reinforce his knowledge to be able to provide his students with a better education.  He will graduate this month.

His greatest dream in life is to manage to improve his family’s living conditions and he intends to do so through his efforts to improve his professional situation.  Because of this, he’ll use the loan to buy a laptop and thus strengthen his current studies.

loans.use: to buy materials for his master's degree.

loans.name: Zoila

texts.es:
Zoila integrante del Banco comunal “La Santiago”, perteneciente a la comuna de Estación Central, ciudad de Santiago. Se dedica al corte y confección de ropa, desde hace 30 años. Se dedicó a éste rubro por muchos años de manera dependiente y en la actualidad lo realiza de manera independiente en su casa, debido a que tiene bajo su cuidado a su madre quien se encuentra enferma, por lo que su horario es flexible. Las temporadas de más alta demanda del año son las festividades, sobre todo ahora que se acerca la fecha de Fiestas Patrias. Zoila también realiza arreglos de ropas y tiene bastantes clientes. Ella trabaja desde su casa y en una galería en la cual se dedica a coser, ahí cuenta con una máquina de coser overlock y una máquina de coser con puntada recta. 
Sus materiales los compra en dos sectores en el centro de la ciudad de Santiago, ya que los precios son más convenientes.
Con el crédito comprará repuestos para una de sus máquinas, telas y más materiales.
Sus metas en su negocio son tener un taller que cuente con dos maquinarias semi industriales, que le permitiría agilizar su trabajo y de ésta manera acrecentar el número de clientes. 
Zoila vive junto a su madre, uno de sus sueños es brindarle todas las comodidades a su madre.
Las motivaciones de continuar con el negocio, se deben a que disfruta mucho lo que realiza. 
Zoila se encuentra muy contenta y agradecida de los créditos y servicios brindados por Fondo Esperanza, ya que le han permitido seguir adelante con sus proyectos. Comenta que se siente muy cómoda con el grupo del Banco comunal y que las capacitaciones le han servido para organizar su negocio. 
Estación Central es una comuna emplazada en el área céntrica de Santiago (capital de Chile), que debe su nombre a la Estación Central de Ferrocarriles, que data del año 1887, declarada Monumento Nacional en 1983. En sus inicios esta estación, junto con la estación Mapocho, fueron la entrada a la capital en el tramo Valparaíso -  Santiago y también desde la zona sur del país.
texts.en:
Zoila is a member of the “La Santiago” communal bank belonging to the Estación Central commune in the city of Santiago.  She has designed and made clothing for the last 30 years.  She worked as an employee in this line of work for many years but now works independently at home because she has to care for her mother who is ill.  Her work schedule, therefore, is flexible.  

The time of the year when demand is highest is during the festivals, especially now that the national holidays are approaching.  Zoila also does clothing repairs and has quite a few customers.  She works from home and in a shop where she sews.  She has an overlock machine and a straight stitch sewing machine there.  She buys her supplies in two places in downtown Santiago where prices are more affordable.  She will use the loan to buy replacement parts for one of her machines, fabric and other materials.  

Her business goals are to have a shop with two semi-industrial sewing machines that will make it possible for her to do her work more quickly and increase the number of her customers.  Zoila lives with her mother and one of her dreams is to provide her mother with all the comforts.  Her motivation to stay in business is that she enjoys the work she does very much.

Zoila is very happy and grateful for the loans and services she’s gotten from Fondo Esperanza that have allowed her to continue forward with her projects.  She comments that she feels very comfortable in the communal bank’s group and that the training she’s gotten has helped her organize her business.

Estación Central is a commune in the central part of Santiago (capital of Chile) that owes its name to the Central Railroad Station that dates back to 1887 and was declared a National Monument in 1983.  At its beginning, this station and Mapocho Station were the city’s gateways along the Valparaíso-Santiago route as well as from the south of the country.

loans.use: to buy a replacement part for one of her machines, fabric and other materials.

loans.name: Mariela Elizabeth

texts.es: Mariela está solicitando el crédito para pagar un curso de inglés conversacional. Junto a su esposo trabaja y el le apoyará en los costo del curso. El curso tendrá una duración de 3 años. Tiene la responsabilidad de hijos, es por eso que pone mucho emppeño en sacar este curso porque esto le ayudará a aspirar a un mejor puesto de trabajo y así salir adelante junto a su familia, y poder brindarle una vida digna a sus hijos
texts.en: Mariela is requesting a loan to pay for a course in conversational English.  She works with her husband, and he is helping her with the costs of the course.  The course will take three months.  She is responsible for her children, and this is why she is very determined to move ahead with this course, as it will help her to attain a better job.  In this way she will move forward in life with her family and provide her children with a worthy life.

loans.use: to pay for an English course.

loans.name: Mujeres Trabajadoras Group

texts.es:
Las mujeres del presente comité son de la cuidad de Caacupé, todas ellas se unieron con el objetivo de generar mejores ingresos para cada una de ellas. Desean ir creciendo no solo en el ámbito económico, sino también personal. Ellas se definen como mujeres luchadoras, trabajadoras, solidarias y muy responsables.
La presidenta del comité es la señora Eliodora, ella vive con su marido e hijos, se dedica a la venta de  comestibles desde hace ya un buen tiempo. Gracias a todo el tiempo que lleva en este trabajo ella ha logrado formar una clientela bien definida. Ella se considera una mujer muy responsable en todo sentido, dice que todo el sacrificio que pasa es por darle a su hijo y al resto de su familia lo mejor. Está muy contenta con lo que hace, pues gracias a este trabajo ella puede contribuir para paliar los gastos de la casa.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de los insumos necesarios para la elaboracion de los alimentos que realiza, como ser carne, pollo, condimentos, pan y otros. Espera poder tener el crédito pues le será de gran ayuda.
texts.en:
The ladies in this group are from the city of Caacupé.  All of them got together in order to generate more income for each one individually.  They want to grow not only economically but also personally.  They consider themselves to be hard-working, supportive and very responsible.

The president of the group is Mrs. Eliodora who lives wtih her husband and children.  She has been in the business of selling food for quite some time.  Because she has been in this activity for such a long time she has been able to set up a well-defined customer base.  She feels she is a very responsible woman in all senses of the word.  All the hardship she must go through is to give her son and the rest of her family the best she can.  She enjoys what she does and, thanks to her work, can help out with the household expenses.

She is requesting a loan to buy food ingredients such as meat, chicken, condiments, bread and other items.  She hopes she receives the loan because it will be of great help to her.

loans.use: To buy bread, chicken, meat, condiments and other food ingredients.

loans.name: Letrece

texts.en:
Letrece S. vowed “never, never ever” to come back to New Orleans post-Katrina. She describes waking up one morning with a loud inner voice urging her to return home. The first person she met upon her return happened to be the co-founder of The New Orleans Healing Center, a place created to promote spiritual, holistic, physical, mental, and economic healing to New Orleans post-Katrina. With encouragement from the team at The New Orleans Healing Center, Letrece, a former pharmacist, started her company to promote holistic healing, connecting clients' spheres of life to help clients take care of their bodies. Using her pharmaceutical skills, she provides consultations and suggestions for herbal treatment to clients who often cannot afford traditional medical care. Letrece explains frustration at some traditional pharmaceutical treatments, which might “treat one symptom, but produce 20 side effects.” Letrece loves The Healing Center’s mission of inclusion and hopes to add her talents to promote community healing.  

A native of New Orleans’s Seventh Ward, Letrece’s long-term dream is to one day open her own community center in Treme, a lower-income New Orleans neighborhood, to help preserve the foundation and culture that makes the city special. Letrece describes feeling a deep spiritual connection with the city and people of New Orleans post-Katrina, and a sense of camaraderie and shared purpose. She felt the tragedy opened her heart and inspired her to raise herself to a position where she could reach out to help others. “Great cities are only great because of great people,” says Letrece, “we have to uplift people” to rebuild this city.

Letrece will use the proceeds of her Kiva loan for working capital and equipment, including a client consultation table and chairs for clients to use. She describes the process of obtaining a Kiva loan through ASI and technical assistance through Good Work Network as “more personal and less standoffish” than the traditional loan application process. “These are real people” she said, “trying to help real people do good things.”

loans.use: to purchase new equipment and to provide working capital, such as including a client consultation table and chairs for clients to use.

loans.name: Ximena

texts.es:
Ximena integrante y tesorera del Banco comunal “La Santiago” perteneciente a la comuna de Estación Centr4al, ciudad de Santiago. Se dedica al rubro del comercio desde hace 15 años, específicamente venta de confites, estas las realiza en un carro en las afueras de un colegio. Trabaja de lunes a viernes durante algunas horas en la mañana y durante la tarde. Los fines de semana, vende sus productos en una feria libre. Comenta que la temporada de más alta demanda son durante los meses de marzo y abril, el resto de los meses las ventas se mantienen y durante el mes de octubre tienden a disminuir. 
Su mercadería la compra en la vega (lugar de abundante comercio de productos del campo y distribuidoras que surten a comerciantes).
Con el crédito comprará confites y también invertirá en pequeñas banderas chilenas para adornar los autos en fiestas patrias. Su marido es quien confecciona y vende banderas chilenas para la temporada de Fiestas patrias. 
Sus metas en su negocio son contar con un carro más grande, que le permita abastecer su negocio de más mercadería.
Ximena vive junto a su marido y sus cuatro hijos de 20, 15, 12 y 3 años de edad. Sus sueños a nivel personal son obtener su casa propia, para esto ya se encuentra gestionando la documentación, ya que quiere comprar la vivienda en la cual vive junto a su familia. Otro de sus sueños es costear los estudios superiores de sus hijos, para que sean profesionales. 
Ximena está muy contenta y agradecida de los créditos de Fondo Esperanza, ya que le han permitido invertir en su negocio. Respecto a las capacitaciones realizadas en las reuniones del Banco comunal, estas le han permitido implementarlas en su negocio. Además paralelamente se encuentra participando de unos talleres de micro emprendimiento.
Estación Central es una comuna emplazada en el área céntrica de Santiago (capital de Chile), que debe su nombre a la Estación Central de Ferrocarriles, que data del año 1887, declarada Monumento Nacional en 1983. En sus inicios esta estación, junto con la estación Mapocho, fueron la entrada a la capital en el tramo Valparaíso -  Santiago y también desde la zona sur del país.
texts.en:
Ximena is a member of the Communal Bank "La Santiago", and is the Bank's treasurer.  The bank is in the community of "Estación Central", in the city of Santiago.  She has been working in business for the last 15 years, specifically selling candy, which she does from a cart outside a school.  She works Monday through Friday, for several hours in the morning and afternoon.  On weekends, she sells her products at the open market.  She comments that her high demand season is during March and April; in the other months sales stay steady, and during the month of October they tend to decrease.

She purchases her merchandise in the "meadow" (a place with many agricultural products and distributors who supply the traders).  With her loan, she will buy candy and also invest in small Chilean flags for decorating cars during patriotic holidays.  Her husband makes and sells Chilean flags for the patriotic holiday season.

Her goals for her business are to have a larger cart which would allow her to stock more merchandise for her business.

Ximena lives with her husband and her three sons aged 20, 15, 12, and 3.  Her dream on a personal level is to buy her own home.  She is already putting together the documentation, as she wants to buy the house in which she and her family are currently living.  Another of her dreams is to pay for higher education for her children, so that they may become professionals.

Ximena is very happy and grateful for the loans from Fondo Esperanze, as they have allowed her to invest in her business.  In regards to the trainings held at the Communal Bank meetings, she has been able to put these into place in her business.  Additionally, she also participates in several workshops for micro-entrepreneurship.

Estación Central is a community located in a central area of Santiage (the capital of Chile).  The community takes its name from the Central Railway Station, which dates back to 1887 and was declared a National Monument in 1983.  In its early days, this station, together with the Mapocho station, was the entrance to the capital for the Valparaíso -  Santiago route, and also routes from the southern part of the country.

loans.use: to buy candy, and also invest in small Chilean flags for decorating cars during the patriotic holidays.

loans.name: Angelica

texts.en:
Husband and wife entrepreneurs Angelica and Roman started Colmex Construction, LLC in June 2008. Originally from Florida, the couple came to New Orleans after Hurricane Katrina to aid in the rebuilding process. Although the couple has 15 years of combined experience in all phases of construction, the business started solely as a framing company but has expanded its scope to provide general construction services. Colmex’s current projects include new construction and modification of existing homes to ensure that as many homes as possible are 100 per cent energy efficient. Angelica and Roman are glad they are able to create new housing and job opportunities for the residents of New Orleans. 

Angelica and Roman will use their Kiva loan for operating expenses, such as payroll.

loans.use: to pay operating expenses, such as payroll.

loans.name: Cristo Rey Ii-El Tambo Group

texts.es: LA SRA RENEE ULDA  D.  42 AÑOS D. EDAD ,CONVIVIENTE CON 02 HIJOS   D. 17 Y 15 AÑOS D. EDAD  ,ES SOCIA D. LA ALCANCIA COMUNAL CRISTO REY II   ,JUNTAMENTE CON SUS SIETE  COMPAÑEROS QUE CONFORMAN ESTA ALCANCIA  COMUNAL  PROMETEN SEGUIR TRABAJANDO HONESTAMENTE  Y SER  PUNTUALES  COMO LO HAN ESTADO TRABAJANDO EN LOS ANTERIORES CICLOS .LA SRA  RENNE SE DEDICA  A LA VENTA D. COMIDA  QUE SE ENCUENTRA UBICADA    EN LA ESQUINA DEL PARQUE JUSTICIA ,PAZ Y VIDA  .LA  SRA RENNE SOLICITA ESTE PRESTAMO PARA PODER  COMPRAR  UNA REFRIGERADORA , ASI PODER TENER EN BUEN ESTADO LOS INSUMOS. LA SRA RENNE QUISIERA PARA EL FUTURO  PODER TENER UN LOCAL MAS  EN EL CENTRO D. HUANCAYO  PARA ASI POD. OBTENER MAS INGRESOS .LA SRA RENEE SE ENCUENTRA UBICADA  AL CENTRO ,A LADO IZQUIERDO D. LA SRA QUE VISTE UN POLO COLOR MORADO Y UN CHALECO  COLOR CREMA,LLEVA EN BRAZOS A SU NIÑO  .LA SRA RENNE VISTE UNA CASACA COLOR BLANCO,UN POLO COLOR CELESTE Y BUZO COLOR NEGRO
texts.en: 42 year old Renee lives with her 2 children, who are 17 and 15 years old. She is a member of the community bank "Cristo Rey II", along with her 7 companions. They all promise to keep working honestly and to be punctual, which is the way they have worked in previous loan cycles. Renee works selling food, and she has a stall in the corner of the park called "Justicia, Paz, y Vida". Renee is requesting this loan to be able to buy a refrigerator so that she can keep her supplies in good condition. In the future, Renee would like to have a stall more in the center of Huancayo so that she could have better profits. Renee is in the center of the photo, on the left siD. of the woman who is wearing a purple shirt and a cream colored vest, with a baby in her arms. Renee is wearing a white jacket, a sky blue shirt, and black pants.

loans.use: to buy a refrigerator.

loans.name: Sheree

texts.en:
Sheree is a 43-year-old married mother of two children. She has learned that sometimes blessings can come as the result of hardships. Last year Sheree was laid off from being a long-time executive assistant for a community bank, but it allowed her the time to be a full-time caregiver for her ill mother who later passed away in April 2011. It was during this time of reflection that she sought divine revelation for the next steps of her life and as a result the idea for Virtuous Executive Services, LLC (VES) was born. 

Sheree's experiences as a legislative assistant to over 32 state representatives in the Louisiana Legislative Black Caucus, Tulane University Medical School and College, and formerly Dryades Savings Bank, now First NBC Bank provided a firm foundation for her new business venture. Now, Sheree is using her 26 years of executive-level administrative skills to win contracts to provide other executives with high quality administrative and back office support services. 

Sheree will use the Kiva loan to pay for marketing expenses and operational expenses, such as office supplies and equipment and payroll. As a working mother, Sheree ultimately wants to demonstrate to her two young daughters that they, too, can succeed as business owners. She wants this business to be a launching point to reach her ultimate goal of creating a Re-Entry Program for Women that trains them to establish their own businesses.

loans.use: to fund operating and marketing expenses.

loans.name: Damas Unidas Group

texts.es:
El comité de Mujeres Damas Unidas es de la ciudad de San Ignacio. Actualmente cuenta con 11 integrantes, donde todas trabajan dentro de un ambiente de de respeto y ayuda mutua. El objetivo de cada de una de ella es seguir dentro del programa Comité de Mujeres y de esa forma poder desarrollarse plenamente.
La Señora Alejandra es la presidenta del grupo, ella se dedica a la peluquería hace varios años. Gracias a su trabajo ella ha podido salir adelante y brindar a su familia todo lo que ellos necesitan para tener una vida digna y decorosa. Uno de sus sueños es poder seguir creciendo profesionalmente y de esa forma generar un poco más de ingresos para su familia.
Ella solicita el crédito para habilitar un salón de belleza en su domicilio, para que de esa forma pueda trabajar de forma más cómoda y relajada en su casa. Agradece a la Fundación Paraguaya por la oportunidad que esta le da pues de obtener el crédito le será de mucha ayuda.
texts.en:
The communal bank Mujeres Damas Unidas is from the city of San Ignacio.  Currently there are 11 members in the group and all of them work in an atmosphere of respect and mutual help.  The goal of each one of them is to continue in the group so they can fully develop.

Mrs. Alejandra is the president of the group and she has run a beauty salon for several years.  Through her work she has been able to get ahead and give her family everthing they need to lead a dignified, proper life.  One of her dreams is to continue growing professionally in order to generate more income for her family.

She is requesting a loan to install a beauty salon in her home so she can work more comfortably and relaxed.  She is grateful to the Fundación Paraguaya for the opportunity to obtain a loan that will be very helpful to her.

loans.use: To install a beauty salon.

loans.name: Troy

texts.en:
Despite his years of experience as an electrician for a larger company, Troy was repeatedly passed over for promotions. In 2005, he decided to start his own company to better serve the needs of his community and build a legacy to pass on to his wife and three sons.  

In Troy’s previous position, he had never had the opportunity to utilize his training to create a cleaner and healthier environment. Seeing the opportunity to provide low-income New Orleans families with greener, more efficient homes he wanted to expand the capacity and service offerings of his electrical business and is now a licensed Solar Energy Equipment contractor in the State of Louisiana. His company, Sunergy Solar Solutions, has done work with the Make It Right Foundation, a non-profit organization that is rebuilding the Katrina-devastated Lower Ninth Ward of New Orleans with affordable, energy-efficient homes. 

Troy will use his Kiva loan to mobilize contracts that will come through the New Orleans Energy Smart Program pipeline, for which he was recently certified. Troy uses his “spare time” growing an organic garden in his backyard and promoting urban farming among other families in his area. He also works with his neighborhood community center and serves as a mentor to youth.

loans.use: to purchase energy efficient construction equipment.

loans.name: Erick Josué

texts.es: "Dentro de 5 años me imagino como director o coordinador de un área de Formulación y Planificación de Proyectos, me inspira poder apoyar a mi madre quién siempre me ha apoyado a mí cuando más lo he necesitado. estoy interesado en la pedagogía, éstos conocimientos son parte de un ciclo de retroalimentación entre profesor y alumno. Al iniciar la universidad tuve problemas de integrarme con mis compañeros, pues sentía que no formaba parte de ningún grupo y sólo con el tiempo lo pude superar."
texts.en: "Within five years, I imagine myself to be a director or coordinator in the area of Development and Project Planning.  I am inspired to help my mother, who has always helped me when I've needed it.  I am interested in education, and knowledge is part of a feedback loop between teacher and student.  When I started at university, I had problems getting on with my classmates as I felt I wasn't part of any group, and only with time was I able to overcome this."

loans.use: to pay for a Masters degree in Project Management.

loans.name: Danise

texts.en:
As a mother of three, Danise knows first-hand about the struggle for New Orleans families to find affordable, quality childcare. After ten years of being in the childcare industry, she pursued her dream and opened Creative Hands Daycare & Preschool Center, a home-based family childcare center. Danise has operated a successful business for the past two years as she has been committed to her mission to provide quality care to children at an affordable price. Because of Louisiana state regulations, Danise was only able to provide care to six children in her home, but she knew the New Orleans community has a much greater need for her services. “I want to provide more children the opportunity to receive quality care. There are more than six children and families who need and deserve it,” says Danise when asked why she wanted a larger space. 

Danise recently signed a lease for an 8,000 sq. ft. space in a great location to position her center for growth. Kiva funds will enable her to purchase all of the equipment she needs for her new classrooms and allow her to accommodate the new families who are on the center’s waiting list.

loans.use: to purchase tables, chairs and toys for the center.

loans.name: Donovan

texts.en:
Donovan is a native New Orleanian who has always aspired to be an entrepreneur. In 2004, he started Infinity D&T Trucking, LLC, which transports freight and building supplies to several businesses in the Gulf Coast region. Donovan’s trucking business was flourishing until August 29, 2005, when Hurricane Katrina devastated the city of New Orleans. Donovan's business lost employees and customers and was forced to evacuate to Texas and later Virginia before returning to New Orleans.  
Although it was a difficult process to come back home, this unimaginable event only fueled Donovan’s desire to be a successful entrepreneur. Today, Infinity D&T Trucking has acquired subcontractor projects with well-known construction companies and Donovan is currently expanding his business to transport patients to doctor’s appointments. With the Kiva loan, Donovan will have maintenance done on two passenger vans to ensure safe and reliable transportation services are accessible to fixed-income residents.

loans.use: to pay for the maintenance of two passenger vans.

loans.name: Sharonda

texts.en:
Sharonda is a true advocate for the New Orleans community. Always having a passion for self-sufficiency, empowerment, and transformation, Sharonda opened First Stages Incorporated in 1998. First Stages Inc. is a case management agency that caters to children and elderly people with disabilities. Sharonda, setting herself apart, works with the children in their homes and promotes money management and home modification with the elderly. 

The devastation of Hurricane Katrina caused Sharonda to lose all of her clients. Since 2006 she has been working vigorously to regain her clientele. With the Kiva loan, Sharonda will purchase and update computers and equipment, increase staff, and invest in advertising. This will allow her to execute her mission to deliver valuable services which create educational and growth opportunities for the client population. Sharonda loves her job and her city; she is committed to making a difference in her community.

loans.use: to purchase new computers and equipment, increase staff and invest in advertising.

loans.name: Xiomara Teresa

texts.es: "Estudio Licenciatura en Administración de Empresas, en 5 o 10 años me veo en mi negocio o empresa. Con mi título se me abrirán más oportunidades de trabajo y ganaré más experiencia en mi área. Mis padres son mi inspiración y motivación para seguir adelante por todos mis esfuerzos y scarificios para que mis hermanos y yo siempre tuviéramos estudios. Yo además de estudiar, trabajo en la universidad, para mí es importante recibir este préstamo estudiantil para poder obtener mi título ya que tengo experiencia en distintas áreas pero por no poder obtener título no he podido optar por un mejor puesto o salario."
texts.en: "I am studying for my Bachelor of Business Administration" degree. In 5 or 10 years time, I see myself in my own business or company. My parents are my inspiration and motivation to keep moving forward in all my efforts and sacrifices because my siblings and I always studied. In addition to studying, I work at the university. For me, it is important to receive this student loan so I can get my degree because, although I have experience in various areas, because I haven't had a degree I've not been able to get a better position or salary."

loans.use: to pay for her degree course.

loans.name: Nuevo Horizonte Group

texts.es:
Este grupo denominado Nuevo Horizonte surgió por contacto de una de las señoras con la Fundación, el grupo se encuentra en el ciclo numero trece, opera con la Fundación desde el año 2007. Actualmente cuenta con 18 miembros, donde todas ellas trabajan dentro de un ambiente de respeto, solidaridad y mutua ayuda. Desean seguir dentro del programa, es por eso que día a día se proponen superar sus propios limites.  
Una de las integrantes del grupo es la Señora Iris se dedica a la costura, ella gracias a esta labor ha podido ayudar en los gastos de la familia. Desea que sus parientes vivan una vida digna y decorosa, sin las limitaciones por las que ellas tuvo que pasar. Comenta que desea tener un local donde pueda ofrecer a sus clientes las prendas que ella vende.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de prendas de estación para la posterior venta, ya que tiene muchos pedidos de sus clientes con los que le gustaría cumplir. Está muy esperanzada en el crédito, pues de obtenerlo le será de mucha ayuda.
texts.en:
This group is called “Nuevo Horizonte” (New Horizon).  It emerged as a result of contact with the women with the Fundación.  The group is in its 13th cycle.  It has been working with the Fundacón since 2007.  It currently has 18 members.  They all work in an atmosphere of respect, solidarity, and mutual help.  They want to continue in the program.  That is why their day to day purpose is to overcome their own limitations.

Iris, a seamstress, is one of the members of the group.  Thanks to this work she has been able to help with the family expenses.  She wants her family to live a decent and proper life without experiencing the limitations that she endured.  She says that she wants a place where she can sell garments to her customers.

She is requesting the loan to buy seasonal clothing for later sale.  She now has a lot of customer orders that she would like to fill.  She is very hopeful about the loan because receiving it will be a big help.

loans.use: to buy seasonal clothes to later sell.

loans.name: Nathaniel

texts.en:
Nathaniel started a construction company called Handy Manz, LLC in July 2010, which has several projects throughout the city of New Orleans.  Nathaniel’s interest in construction work was sparked many years ago when he worked with his father, a construction worker, on various projects.  

Nathaniel’s determination to succeed and his strength to endure hardships is what makes him a successful business owner. This determination and strength were tested during Hurricane Katrina when Nathaniel and his mother did not evacuate in time and had to be rescued from their home by a stranger in a swamp boat. Although this experience may have been mentally devastating to most, Nathaniel saw the aftermath of Katrina as an extraordinary opportunity to start his own construction business; thus he started Handy Manz. After returning to the city, Nathaniel noticed the demand for construction companies and wanted to personally aid in the rebuilding efforts by utilizing the talents and skills passed down to him by his father. 

With this Kiva loan, Nathaniel will purchase supplies for an upcoming subcontractor project for the Goodwork Network.

loans.use: to purchase supplies for an upcoming subcontractor project for the Goodwork Network.

loans.name: Héctor

texts.es:
Hector integrante y presidente del Banco comunal “La Santiago”, perteneciente a la comuna de Estación Central, ciudad de Santiago.
Se dedica al rubro del comercio, específicamente venta de artículos de bazar y paquetería en un puesto que ubica en un persa (feria libre). Se dedica a éste rubro desde hace 20 años. Su horario de trabajo es durante los días jueves, sábados, domingos y festivos. 
Su mercadería usualmente la compra en importadoras en el centro de la ciudad de Santiago.
Con el crédito comprará lentes de sol, anteojos para leer, ropa delgada, encendedores para regalo, entre otros.
Las metas para su negocio son abastecer su negocio con mercadería, para ofrecer variedad a sus clientes, de ésta manera trabajar más y así obtener mayores ingresos. 
Hector vive junto a su esposa y su hija de 17 años de edad, los planes para ella son estudiar licenciatura en literatura, por lo tanto uno de los sueños de Hector es concretar éste proyecto para que su hija logre ser una profesional. Además al obtener mejores ingresos en su negocio, pretende terminar de pagar el crédito automotriz que solicitó hace poco tiempo atrás.  Otro de sus sueños es brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida y más confortable.
Sus motivaciones de continuar con el negocio se deben específicamente por que quiere concretar todos sus proyectos y además que disfruta mucho lo que realiza.  
Hector está muy contento y agradecido del crédito y servicio brindado por Fondo Esperanza. Además comenta que con las reuniones ha aprendido a conocer personas muy especiales y las capacitaciones impartidas en las reuniones le han permitido administrar el dinero de su negocio.
Estación Central es una comuna emplazada en el área céntrica de Santiago (capital de Chile), que debe su nombre a la Estación Central de Ferrocarriles, que data del año 1887, declarada Monumento Nacional en 1983. En sus inicios esta estación, junto con la estación Mapocho, fueron la entrada a la capital en el tramo Valparaíso -  Santiago y también desde la zona sur del país.
texts.en:
Héctor is a member of the Communal Bank "La Santiago", and is the Bank's president.  The bank is located in the community of Estación Central, in the city of Santiago.

He works in business, specifically selling stationery and packaging items at a stall located in a bazaar (open market).  He has been working in this business for the last 20 years.  His schedule is to work during Thursdays, Saturdays, Sundays, and holidays.  He usually buys his merchandise from importers in the center of the city of Santiago.

With the loan, he will buy sunglasses, reading glasses, thin clothing, gift cigarette lighters, and other things.  His goals for his business are to stock up his business with merchandise to as to offer variety to his customers.  In this way he will have more work, and and thus be able to earn better income.

Héctor lives with his wife and 17-year-old daughter.  The plans are for her to study for a degree in literature, so one of Hector's dreams is to achieve this project so that his daughter can become a professional.  In addition to earning more from his business, he intends to finish paying off his auto loan, which he took out a short while back.  One of his dreams is to provide his family with a better quality of life, and a more comfortable life.

His motivation for continuing with his business is specifically due to the fact that he wants to achieve all his projects, and additionally he very much enjoys what he does.

Héctor is very happy and grateful for the loan and for the service provided by Fondo Esperanza.  He also comments that through the meetings he has got to know many special people, and the trainings that take place at the meetings have allowed him to manage his business' money.

Estación Central is a community located in the center of Santiago (capital of Chile).  It owes its names to the Central Railway Station, which dates back to 1887 and was declared a National Monument in 1983.  In its early days, this station, together with the Mapocho station, was the entrance to the capital for the Valparaíso - Santiago route, and also for routes from the southern part of the country.

loans.use: to buy sunglasses, reading glasses, thin clothing, gift cigarette lighters, and other items

loans.name: Marilynn

texts.en:
Marilynn has always had a talent for creating unique crafts and for years sold holiday gift baskets from her home.  In November 2010 she acquired a commerical building and opened Raellez, LLC, a gift shop that sells party supplies, greeting cards and gift baskets. Raellez is located in New Orleans East, which is an area that was heavily impacted by Hurricane Katrina and where few businesses have chosen to return. 

Marilynn loves being her own boss and encourages her young son to dream big; he has already told his mom that he wants to open a toy store when he grows up. 

Marilynn will use her Kiva loan to increase inventory, and create marketing and advertising materials for her business.

loans.use: to purchase inventory, create marketing, and invest in advertising materials.

loans.name: Ermi

texts.es: Don Ermi trabaja como docente de secundaria, está solicitando su crédito para invertirlo en su monografía en Ciencias de la Educación, por diferentes razones no ha podido culminar sus estudios universitarios. Trabaja desde hace 13 años, su mayor sueño en la vida es poder culminar su carrera para apoyar a su familia ya que son personas muy humildes.
texts.en: Mr. Ermi works as a secondary school teacher.  He is requesting this loan to invest it in his dissertation in Education Sciences.  For various reasons, he has not been able to finish his university studies.  He has been working since he was 13 years old, and his big dream for his life is to be able to finish his degree, so as to support his family as they are very poor.

loans.use: to pay for tutoring for his degree.

loans.name: Lucia

texts.es:
Lucia es socia del  Banco Comunal “Mujeres al Progreso de Juli”, ubicado en el distrito de Juli, provincia Chucuito, departamento de Puno, tiene 31 años de edad, está casada y tiene 2 hijos.  Estudió hasta  3ro de secundaria.
Lucia trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace dos ciclos, su primer préstamo fue por la suma de   S/. 500.00 nuevo soles, dinero que invirtió en su negocio venta de emoliente (bebida caliente a base de cebada).
Con éste nuevo préstamo de S/. 700.00 nuevo soles, comprará tres sacos de azúcar, plástico y gas, etc.,  para su negocio.  Ella trabaja sola en el negocia, su esposo trabaja en construcción civil.
Su sueño es comprarse un terreno en Puno para sus hijos y tener una tienda de abarrotes.	
Lo que le gusta del Banco Comunal es  el ahorro, la puntualidad y el préstamo de la cuenta interna
texts.en:
Lucia is a member of the "Mujeres al Progreso de Juli" communal bank, located in the Juli district, Chucuito province, Puno department. She is 31, married, and has 2 children. She was in school until the third grade of secondary school.
Lucia has worked with the Movimiento Manuela Ramos for two cycles. Her first loan was for the sum of 500 Nuevo Soles, money that she invested in her business selling emoliente (a hot barley-based drink).
With this new loan of 700 Nuevos Soles, she will purchase three bags of sugar, plastic, pop, etc. for her business. She works alone in this business. Her husband works as a construction engineer.
Her dream is to buy a plot of land in Puno for her children, and to have a grocery store.
What she likes about the communal bank is the savings, the punctuality and the loans from the internal savings account.

loans.use: to purchase three bags of sugar; plastic; pop; etc.

loans.name: Vilma

texts.es:
Vilma es socia del  Banco Comunal “Las Estrellitas Unidas del Titicaca”, ubicado en el distrito de Pilcuyo, provincia El Collao, departamento de Puno, tiene 28 años de edad, es conviviente y tiene 2 hijos.  Estudió hasta 1ro de secundaria-
La señora se dedica a la compra y venta de frutas como piña, manzanas, plátanos, sandillas, etc, trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace tres  años,  su primer préstamo fue por la suma de S/ 300.00 nuevo soles, dinero que invirtió en su negocio de compra y venta de frutas.
Con su nuevo préstamo  de  S/ 2,000.00 nuevo soles, comprará treinta cajas de manzanas, mil  plátanos, mandarinas, naranjas y piñas.  Nos cuenta que compra su mercadería en Tacna y la vende en la localidad de Ilave.  Su esposo le ayuda en el negocio y también trabaja de operario en construcción.
Su sueño es tener una buena casa para mejorar su estilo de vida.
Lo que le gusta del Banco Comunal  la facilidad del préstamo y las charlas.
texts.en:
Vilma is a member of “Las Estrellitas Unidas del Titicaca” (The United Little Stars of Titicaca) Communal Bank, located in the district of Pilcuyo, province of El Collao, department of Puno.  She is 28 years old, lives with her partner, and has two children.  She studied up to her first year of high school.  

She buys and sells fruits such as pineapples, apples, bananas, and watermelon.  She has worked with Movimiento Manuela Ramos for three years.  Her first loan was for S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, which she invested in her business of buying and selling fruits.  With her new loan of S/.  2,000.00 nuevos soles, she will purchase thirty boxes of apples, and 1000 bananas, mandarins, oranges, and pineapples.  She tells us that she buys her merchandise in Tacna and sells it in the town of Illave.  Her husband helps her with the business and he is also a construction worker.  Her dream is to have a good home in order to improve her lifestyle. She is pleased with the ease of the communal bank’s loan process and enjoys the conversations.

loans.use: to purchase boxes of apples, and 1000 bananas, madarins, oranges, and pinapples.

loans.name: Santa Catalina Group

texts.es:
Santa Catalina es denominado el comité integrado por 15 mujeres de Ciudad del Este, todas ellas se unieron con el objetivo de procurar mayores ingresos y de esa forma poder salir adelante. Ellas son mujeres jefas de familia, cargadas de muchas ansias de progreso y desarrollo.
La señora Rosa tiene una despensa bien surtida. Gracias a este negocio ella ha podido salir adelante y generar los ingresos necesaR. para la manutención de su familia. Uno de sus sueños es poder tener un minisuper con lo que podrá tener mayores ingresos y atraer a más clientes, no solo de su barrio, sino también de zonas aledañas. Comenta que todo lo que hace es por el bien de su familia, pues desea darles todo lo bueno.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de comestibles, bebidas, hortalizas, y demás productos de primera necesidad, para que de esa forma pueda estar bien surtida ante cualquier demanda de sus clientes. Está muy agradecida con la Fundación por la oportunidad que esta le da, ya que de obtener el crédito le será de mucha utilidad.
texts.en:
The Santa Catalina Communal Bank is comprised of 15 women from Ciudad de Este.  They all got together with the objective of getting greater income.  That way they will be able to get ahead.  The women are the heads of their households.  They shoulder a lot of anxiety about making progress and growing.

Rosa has a well-stocked grocery store.  Thanks to this business she has been able to get ahead and generate the needed income to support her family.  One of her dreams is to be able to have a “minisuper” (a small supermarket).  Then she would be able to have greater income and attract more customers, not just from her neighborhood, but also from outlying areas.  She says that everything she does is for the good of her family.  She wants to give them everything that is good. 

She is requesting the loan to buy food, drinks, vegetables, and other basic needs items.  She will do this so that she can be well-stocked for any customer demand.  She is very grateful to the foundation for opportunity it is giving her.  Receiving the loan will be very useful.

loans.use: to buy food, drinks, and other products to stock her store.

loans.name: Cristo Rey - El Tambo Group

texts.es: LA SRA ROCIO D.  33 AÑOS D. EDAD, CONVIVIENTE CON DOS HIJOS MENORES D. EDAD ,ES SOCIA D. LA ALCANCIA COMUNAL  CRISTO REY, SE LE CONSIDERO ESTE TERCER CICLO YA QUE LA SRA ANTERIORMENTE EN LOS ANTERIORES CICLOS  DEMOSTRO SER  RESPONSABLE Y PUNTUAL  AL IGUAL QUE SUS DEMAS COMPAÑEROS QUE CONFORMAN ESTA ALCANCIA COMUNAL .LA SRA EN LA ACTUALIDAD TIENE SU PROPIA PANADERIA,SOLICITO ESTE CREDITO PARA PODER  COMPRAR MAS  EQUIPOS  PARA SU PANADERIA  Y ASI PODER OBTENER MAS INGRESOS . LA SRA ROCIO QUISIERA PARA EL FUTURO TENER UN  HORNO MAS Y TAMBIEN QUISIERA  SACAR PROFESIONALES A SUS HIJOS. LA SRA ROCIO SE ENCUENTRA UBICADA  A LADO IZQUIERDO D. LA  SRA  QUE VISTE UNA CHOMPA COLOR FUCSIA Y PANTALON COLOR NEGRO, LA SRA  ROCIO VISTE UNA CHOMPA COLOR PLOMO Y PANTALON JEANS
texts.en: Rocio is 33 years old, and lives with her partner and two young children.  She is a member of the Cristo Rey (Christ the King) Community Bank and is being considered for her third loan cycle as she has previously proven herself to be responsible and punctual.  Along with the other members of this group, she has her own bakery.  She asked for this loan to be able to buy more equipment for her bakery in order to increase earnings.  In the future, Rocio would like to have another oven and for her children to be professionals.  Rocio can be found to the right of the woman wearing a pink sweater and black pants.  Rocio is wearing a gray sweater and jeans.

loans.use: buy more equipment

loans.name: Aurelia

texts.es:
Aurelia  es socia del  Banco Comunal “Las Estrellitas Unidas del Titicaca”, ubicado en el distrito de Pilcuyo, provincia El Collao, departamento de Puno, tiene 73 años de edad, está casada y tiene 6 hijos, todos independientes.  Aurelia no cuenta con educación.
Desde hace tres años  trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos,  su primer préstamo  fue por la suma de  S/ 300.00 nuevo soles, dinero que invirtió en su negocio de compra y venta de animales caseros como ovinos y vacunos.
Con éste nuevo préstamo de S/ 400.00 nuevo soles, comprará tres ovejas  para su respectivo engorde por tres meses.  Nos cuenta que trabaja junto con su esposo, también cuenta que se dedica a la chacra, a la producción de papa, avena, habas, etc.
Su sueño es seguir y mejorar con los ganados así podrá obtener más ganancias.
Lo que le gusta del Banco Comunal es la facilidad del préstamo.
texts.en:
Aurelia is a member of the Communal Bank "Las Estrellitas Unidas del Titicaca (The United Starlets of Titicaca)", located in the Pilcuyo District, El Collao Province, Puno Department.  Aurelia is 73 years old and married with 6 children, all of whom are independent. Aurelia does not have an education.

For three years Aurelia has worked with the Movimiento Manuela Ramos.  Her first loan was for the sum of 300 nuevo soles.  She invested the money in her business of buying and selling animals such as sheep and cattle.

With this new loan of 400 nuevo soles, Aurelia will buy three sheep which she will fatten over three months.  She tells us that she works with her husband, and that she also works on the farm producing potatoes, oats, beans, etc.

Aurelia's dream is to continue and improve the livestock so that she can make more profit.  What she likes about the communal bank is the ease of getting loans.

loans.use: to buy three sheep.

loans.name: Jaqueline Del Carmen

texts.es: La señora  Jacqueline, es habitante del municipio de Ninidiri, junto a su esposo e hijos, él labora en una empresa privada, para apoyarle con los gastos del hogar, doña Jacqueline desde hace varios años se dedica al comercio (pulpería) ya que con mucho esfuerzos  y empeño su pequeño negocio crece gracias al financiamiento obtenido que le brinda Afodenic atrávez de fondo Kiva, el cual le permite incrementar su inventario y a la vez mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Jacqueline is an inhabitant of the municipality of Ninidiri with her husband and children.  Her husband works in a private company.  To support him with the household expenses, for several years Jacqueline has worked in business (grocery store).   

With much effort and commitment, her small business is growing thanks to funding obtained from Afodenic through Kiva.  This funding allows Jacqueline to increase her inventory while improving their quality of life.

loans.use: to buy groceries.

loans.name: Torrie

texts.en:
Torrie never thought one day she would be a business owner. As a Vanderbilt University School of Law graduate she began her career practising law. However, Torrie had spent years surrounded by a family who lived and breathed the skincare and beauty industry. Thus, as time went on she felt an intense pull towards the aesthetics industry. By 2008 she accepted her inner calling and opened J. Aesthetics, LLC. 

J. Aesthetics, LLC is a full-service modern spa offering services such as chemical peels, vascular repair, laser facials, waxing and much more. Torrie’s goal is to help every woman capture the true essence of beauty inside and out. With this Kiva loan Torrie plans to transform her office with updated equipment and materials to create an unforgettable experience for her clients.

loans.use: to buy operating equipment for her spa.

loans.name: Lidia Librada

texts.es:
La Señora Lidia está casada con el Señor Carlos son padres de 2 hijos menores de edad, están domiciliado en Ciudad del Este, tienen casa propia.
Ella realiza el servicio de transporte alternativo de Ciudad del Este a la Ciudad vecina de Foz do Yguazu, Brasil. Gracias a este trabajo ella puede obtener los ingresos necesarios para la manutención de la casa y de sus hijos. Cuenta que este trabajo es muy sacrificado, puesto que es un oficio que necesita mucho esfuerzo físico y mental. Ella comenta que todo lo que hace es por sus hijos y también por su marido, pues quiere ayudarlo, aligerando un poco la carga de los gastos.
Ella solicita el crédito para el mantenimiento de los vehículos que utiliza como medios de transporte. Esta muy agradecida con la Fundación, puesto que esta no es la primera vez que solicitan un crédito.
texts.en:
Lidia is married to Carlos, and they are the parents of 2 minor children.  They live in Ciudad del Este in their own home.  She has a business providing private transportation services from Ciudad del Este to the nearby city of Foz do Yguazu, Brazil.  Thanks to this work, she can obtain the income she needs to support her household.  She states that this job involves a lot of sacrifice, since it is a line of work that requires a lot of physical and mental effort.  She comments that everything she does is for her children, and also for her husband, since she wants to help them and lighten the burden of the household expenses.

She requests a loan to maintain the vehicles that she uses to provide transportation services.  She is very grateful to the Fundación, since this is not the first time that she has requested a loan.

loans.use: to maintain vehicles used to provide transportation services

loans.name: Andrea

texts.es:
Andrea es socia del  Banco Comunal “Las Estrellitas Unidas del Titicaca”, ubicado en el distrito D. Pilcuyo, provincia El Collao, departamento D. Puno, tiene 55 años D. edad, está casada y tiene 6 hijos, 5 D. ellos independientes.  Cuenta con educación primaria.
Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desD. hace tres años,  su primer préstamo fue por la suma D. S/ 100.00 nuevo soles, dinero que incrementó a su negocio D. compra y venta D. frutas.  Paralelamente venD. granos, azúcar y harina.
Con éste nuevo préstamo D.  S/  2,000.00 nuevo soles, comprará cuarenta sacos D. maíz, para venderlos en la ciudad D. Tacna y comprará frutas como manzana, uva, pera, higos para  venderlos en la localidad D. Ilave.
La señora viaja sola a Tacna a comprar sus productos y su esposo le ayuda a repartir la mercadería en Ilave. 
Su sueño es tener su carro para su traslado D. la mercadería y así reducir sus costos.
Lo que le gusta del Banco Comunal es la facilidad del préstamo, la puntualidad y la responsabilidad.
texts.en:
Andrea is a member of the "Las Estrellitas Unidas del Titicaca" communal bank, located in the Pilcuyo district, El Collao province, Puno department. She is 55, married, and has 6 children, 5 of whom are independent. She has an elementary education.
She has worked with Movimiento Manuela Ramos for three years. Her first loan was for the sum of 100 Nuevos Soles, money that expanded her business selling fruits and vegetables. She also sells grains, sugar and flour.
With this new loan of 2,000 Nuevos Soles, she will purchase fourty bags of corn to sell in Tacna city. She will also buy fruits such as apples, grapes, pears and figs to sell in the Llave locality.
She travels alone to Tacna to buy her products and her husband helps her to distribute the merchandise in Llave.
Her dream is to have a car for transportation to and from the market, thus reducing her costs.
What she likes about the Communal Bank is the ease of getting a loan, the punctuality, and the responsibility.

loans.use: to purchase fourty bags of corn and fruit such as apples, grapes, pears, and figs.

loans.name: Sandra

texts.es:
La señora Sandra es socia del banco comunal D. Las Colinas del Distrito Yarinacocha, Departamento D. Ucayali. Tiene 29 años D. edad, està casada y no tiene hijos.
Lleva tres años con la organización Manuela Ramos y se dedica a la venta D. mercaderìa: zapatos, carteras, ropas para damas y caballeros. Lo bueno D. su negocio es que trabaja solo con pedidos, D. esa manera está invirtiendo mes a mes su dinero.
El nuevo préstamo D. S/ 1,000.00 lo piensa invertir en màs mercaderìa para ampliar su negocio, quiere comprar carteras, zapatos, pantalones y polos.
Los prestamos D. Manuela Ramos apoyan a Sandra en establecer una situación económica estable, la mejor condición para pensar en formar una familia màs adelante.
texts.en:
Sra. Sandra is a member of the Communal Bank “Las Colinas” (The Hills) which is located in the District of Yarinacocha, Department of Ucayali. She is 29 years old, married, and has no children.

Sandra has been with the Manuela Ramos organization for three years. She sells merchandise such as shoes, wallets, and clothing for women and men. The best part of her business is that her work is only done from orders. This allows her to invest her money from month to month.

This new loan of 1000 PEN will be invested in more merchandise to expand her business. She wants to buy wallets, shoes, trousers, and polo shirts.

The loans from Manuela Ramos have helped Sandra establish a stable financial situation so that she will be in the best condition because she plans to start a family sometime later.

loans.use: to buy wallets, shoes, trousers, and polo shirts.

loans.name: Juan

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “SIEMPRE UNIDOS” el banco se encuentra ubicado en el Distrito de Huanchac en el  mercado Virgen Asunta en la Provincia de Cusco y Departamento de Cusco.

El socio Juan tiene 59 años de edad,  el socio es conviviente; el socio tiene 2 hijos; el socio es comerciante minorista, el socio lleva productos secos a la ciudad de Arequipa, el socio también apoya a su conyugue con el restaurante familiar que ellos tienen y apoya atendiendo alas mezas y en lo que pueda dar la mano. El socio en esta ocasión requiere le préstamo para invertir en la compra de productos secos al por mayor. El socio solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de productos secos para llevar a vender a la ciudad de Arequipa, tales como maíz de diferentes variedades, habas, menestras,  cereales y otros.

El socio agradece el apoyo que se le otorgara y así mismo se compromete a cumplir de manera disciplinada con los pagos de las cuotas.
texts.en:
Juan is a member of the Communal Bank “Siempre Unidos” (Always United) which is located in the Virgen Asunta Market in the District of Huanchac, Province and Department of Cusco.

He is 59 years old, in a common-law relationship, and has two children. Juan carries dry goods to the city of Arequipa. He also helps his partner in the family restaurant that they own, waiting on tables and giving a hand when it is needed. On this occasion, he needs a loan to invest in the purchase of dry goods in bulk. The loan he is requesting will be invested in the purchase of these dried products so that he can sell them in the city of Arequipa. These products include corn of different varieties, beans, dried vegetables, grain, and other items.

Juan is grateful for the support that has been provided and promises to complete his payments in a disciplined manner.

loans.use: to purchase dry goods such as corn of different varieties, beans, dried vegetables, grain, and other items.

loans.name: Valentina

texts.es:
Valentina  es socia del  Banco Comunal “Las Estrellitas Unidas del Titicaca”, ubicado en el distrito de Pilcuyp, provincia El Collao, departamento de Puno, tiene 50 años de edad, es viuda y tiene 1 hijo ya independiente.  No pudo concluir la primaria.
Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace dos años,  su primer préstamo  fue por la suma de  S/ 300.00 nuevo soles, préstamo que invirtió en su negocio de compra y venta de ganados como ovinos y vacunos, compró dos ovejas.
Con éste nuevo préstamo de S/ 2000.00 nuevo soles, comprará una yunta (ganado) para su respectivo engorde por tres meses, para venderlo a buen precio.  La señora trabaja sola.  Nos cuenta que también cuenta que  vende quinua, papa, cebada en la localidad de Ilave y Pilcuyo.
Su sueño  es seguir y mejorar  los ganados para incrementar sus ganancias.
Lo que le gusta del Banco Comunal es la facilidad del préstamo  y la ganancia del ahorro.
texts.en:
Valentina is a member of the Communal Bank “Las Estrellitas Unidas de Titicaca” (The United Little Stars of Titicaca) which is located in the District of Pilcuyo, El Collao Province, Department of Puno. She is 50 years old, widowed, and has a son who is already independent. Valentina was not able to finish her elementary school education.

She has worked with Manuela Ramos for two years. Her first loan was in the amount of 300 PEN and the money was invested in her business of buying and selling livestock, such as sheep and cattle. She bought two sheep.

With this new loan of 2000 PEN, Valentina will buy a pair of oxen that she will fatten over the next three months and then sell for a good price. She works alone. Valentina says that she also sells quinoa, potatoes, and barley in the towns of Ilave and Pilcuyo.

Her dream is to continue improving her livestock business so that she can increase her earnings. What she enjoys most about the Communal Bank are the convenience of the loan and the interest from her savings.

loans.use: to buy a pair of oxen for fattening.

loans.name: Nicomedes

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “SIEMPRE UNIDOS” el banco se encuentra ubicado en el Distrito de Huanchac en el  mercado Virgen Asunta en la Provincia de Cusco y Departamento de Cusco.

El socio Nicomedes tiene 69 años de edad,  el socio es casado; el socio tiene 2 hijos; el socio trabaja en su principal actividad él es zapatero de profesión y tiene una zapatería ubicada en su domicilio, el socio es miembro integrante del banco comunal desde hace 10 años y el socio disfruta mucho de reunirse con su grupo cada mes y compartir algunos potajes que preparan para esta ocasión, el socio también alquila sus tienda en la planta baja y las alquila como tiendas comerciales, es solo que estos últimos meses han estado asfaltando las calles que dan a su vivienda y motivo por el cual las tiendas no han sido alquiladas por la accesibilidad. El socio por este motivo requiere el préstamo para poder implementar su zapatería y poder comprar materiales como cuero, hebillas, agujetas,  armazón, tintes, betún entre otros e implementar su zapatería. El socio solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de mercadería para implementar su zapatería.

El socio agradece el apoyo que se le otorgara y así mismo se compromete a cumplir de manera disciplinada con los pagos de las cuotas.
texts.en:
Nicomedes is a member of the Communal Bank “Siempre Unidos” (Always United) which is located in the Virgen Asunta Market in the District of Huanchac, Province and Department of Cusco.

He is 69 years old, married, and has two children. Nicomedes works mainly as a shoemaker and has his own shoe shop in his home. He has been an active member of his Communal Bank for the past 10 years and enjoys meeting with his group every month and sharing a few meals that have been prepared for these occasions. Nicomedes also rents out his shop on the lower floor so that other merchants can conduct business. In recent months, the streets leading up to his house have been in the process of being paved, so his space has not been rented out due to the lack of accessibility.

Nicomedes is requesting a loan so that he can keep his shoe shop in operation. He wants to buy materials such as leather, buckles, shoelaces, frames, dyes, shoe polish, and other supplies. Therefore, he is requesting a loan to use for this purpose.

Nicomedes is grateful for the support that has been provided and promises to complete his payments in a disciplined manner.

loans.use: to purchase materials and supplies for his shoe shop.

loans.name: Otis

texts.en:
Otis is a true example of an entrepreneur, starting his first janitorial business when he was only 19. Otis has always dreamed of being his own boss and has never given up on that dream. Otis started O.J.’s Janitorial & Sweeping Service, LLC in 1994. Having experienced his share of ups and downs as a business owner, Otis was still not quite prepared for the devastation to his business that Hurricane Katrina caused. He lost over 30 of his service sites, and endured the theft of one of his company vehicles. 

Steadfast in his endeavors as always, Otis is still moving forward and taking steps to reinvigorate his business. In 2009 Otis took a major step in obtaining his SBA (Small Business Administration) 8A certification to help ensure his ability to receive opportunities at government projects and subsequent contracts. 

Otis will use his Kiva funds to take on his first federal government contract, as he continues to grow as a businessman and pave the way for others to follow.

loans.use: to purchase operating equipment such as heavy duty cleaning supplies and to cover 2 months of payroll.

loans.name: Roberto Junior

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “SIEMPRE UNIDOS” el banco se encuentra ubicado en el Distrito de Huanchac en el  mercado Virgen Asunta en la Provincia de Cusco y Departamento de Cusco.

El socio Roberto tiene 29 años de edad,  el socio es soltero; el socio trabaja prestando el servicio de taxi, el socio tiene una unidad vehicular la cual la ha puesto desde hace 6 años a trabajar como taxi, el socio en esta ocasión desea invertir el crédito en la compra de repuestos para su auto como llantas, el socio desea comprar llantas nuevas para el auto. El socio solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de llantas.

El socio agradece el apoyo que se le otorgara y así mismo se compromete a cumplir de manera disciplinada con los pagos de las cuotas.
texts.en:
Roberto is a member of the Communal Bank “Siempre Unidos” (Always United) which is located in the Virgen Asunta Market in the District of Huanchac, Province and Department of Cusco.

He is 29 years old and single. Roberto provides taxi services and has his own vehicle that he has used for work for the past six years. On this occasion, he wants to invest this loan in the purchase of parts for his automobile, such as tires. Roberto would like to buy new tires, so he is requesting a loan for this purpose.

Roberto is grateful for the support that has been provided and promises to complete his payments in a disciplined manner.

loans.use: to buy tires for his vehicle.

loans.name: Pascuala

texts.es:
Pascuala  es socia del  Banco Comunal “Las Estrellitas Unidas del Titicaca”, ubicado en el distrito de Pilcuyo, provincia El Collao, departamento de Puno, tiene 57 años de edad, es viuda y tiene 6 hijos, todos independientes.  No cuenta con estudios.
Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace un ciclo,  su primer préstamo  fue por la suma de  S/ 300.00 nuevo soles, dinero que incrementó a su negocio de compra y venta de vacas y chanchos.
Con éste nuevo préstamo de  S/ 500.00 nuevo soles, incrementará al capital que tiene y  comprará una vaca para su engorde por un mes.  En el negocio a veces sus hijos le ayudan, también dice que trabaja en la chacra.
Su sueño es seguir  con el negocio de venta de ganado.
Lo que le gusta del Banco Comunal es la ganancia del ahorro.
texts.en:
Pascuala is a member of the Communal Bank “Las Estrellitas Unidas de Titicaca” (The United Little Stars of Titicaca) which is located in the District of Pilcuyo, El Collao Province, Department of Puno. She is 57 years old, widowed, and has six children, all of whom are independent. Pascuala did not receive an education.

She has worked with Manuela Ramos for one loan cycle. Her first loan was in the amount of 300 PEN and the money helped to increase her business of buying and selling cows and pigs.

This new loan of 500 PEN will increase her capital so that she can buy a cow that she will fatten for one month. Her children occasionally help her with her business. Pascuala says she also works on a farm.

Her dream is to continue working in her business of selling livestock. What she likes most about the Communal Bank is the interest from her savings.

loans.use: to buy a cow for fattening.

loans.name: Esailama

texts.en:
Proudly a New Orleans original, Bissap Breeze is a non-alcoholic beverage, with a smooth blend of brewed hibiscus flowers, organic blue agave nectar, natural extracts and spices. 

Husband and wife team Esailama and Tyrone were first introduced by Abdoulaye “Papa” Camara, a native from Senegal and one of the founders of the Sengalese National Dance Company. Esailama explains that their mom and pop company is a perfect marriage of her business administration background and her husband’s entrepreneurial skill (he has had a successful line of oils, incense, and shampoos as an herbalist for over a decade). Camara introduced Esailama, a dancer, and Tyrone, a drummer, and was a mainstay in their lives and the New Orleans cultural community for many years. Camara was stranded for many days after Katrina and died from complications caused by cancer not long after being evacuated and returning to his native Senegal. The couple sees their company as part of a cultural and vocational heritage he bequeathed to them. Six years after Katrina, some of Tyrone’s family are still displaced. Esailama explains that the company melds together family traditions and culture, and their product includes spices that have been passed down in the family for many generations.  

“Bissap” is a West African word for “hibiscus.” In many cultures globally, the hibiscus is valued for its medicinal properties. High in antioxidants and vitamin C, the Bissap Breeze product can be used as a tea, in cooking, or as a cocktail mix. The company launched its first product sales of Bissap Breeze at the French Market during Jazz Fest weekend earlier this year, and the company has rapidly expanded. A portion of the proceeds from the sale of each bottle are used to support the performing arts and ensure that the cultural legacy of dance and music live on in New Orleans.  

This Kiva loan will be used to purchase organic agave, the most expensive ingredient in the product, as well as for marketing expenses and working capital.  “We’re not just out to make a product,” says Esailama, “but to us this is about creating something that is life-giving."

loans.use: to purchase the ingredient organic agave, and for marketing and other working capital expenses.

loans.name: Janny Arely

texts.es:
La señora Janny es socia del banco comunal Las Colinas del Distrito Yarinacocha, Departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 28 años de edad, està casada y tiene tres hijos. Su esposo se desempeña como supervisor en una empresa.
En sus seis años trabajando con Manuela Ramos, acondicionó una parte de su casa para poner una pequeña bodega de productos comestibles que ofrece a sus clientes lo que necesitan.
Con su nuevo préstamo de S/ 2,800.00 comprará nuevos artículos: 1 caja de lava vajilla, 1 caja de lejía, 1 docena de enjuague en sache, 1 tira de presto barba, 1 caja de mayonesa, 1 caja de mermelada en sache, 1 caja de mantequilla, 1 paquete de salchicha, 1 caja de frugo.
Con su bodega Janny contribuye al bienestar de su familia y también se da tiempo para atender a sus pequeños hijos.
Tiene mucho que agradecer Manuela Ramos por la ayuda económica que presta a las mujeres que quieren trabajar y sacar adelante a su familia.
texts.en:
Sra. Janny is a member of the Communal Bank “Las Colinas” (The Hills) which is located in the District of Yarinacocha, Department of Ucayali. She is 28 years old, married, and has three children. Her husband works as a supervisor for a company.

Janny has been working with Manuela Ramos for six years. She remodeled part of her house so that she could establish a small food store where she offers her customers what they need.

With her new loan of 2800 PEN, Janny will buy new products such as one box of dish soap, one case of bleach, one case of mouthwash, one strip of disposable razor blades, one case of mayonnaise, one case of marmalade, one case of butter, one package of sausages, and one case of fruit drinks.

Through her store, Janny is able to contribute to the welfare of her family and also have time to take care of her small children. She is extremely grateful to Manuela Ramos for the financial support they give to women who want to work and succeed on behalf of their families.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of products for her store.

loans.name: Hebert

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “SIEMPRE UNIDOS” el banco se encuentra ubicado en el Distrito de Huanchac en el  mercado Virgen Asunta en la Provincia de Cusco y Departamento de Cusco.

El socio Hebert tiene 27 años de edad,  el socio es soltero; el socio trabaja en turismo como guía y está terminando sus estudios de turismo en el instituto, él va comprando poco a poco con el crédito que obtiene mediante este medio su equipo de turismo, el socio está deseando poder comprarse sleeping, y una carpa, por ahora. El socio solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de equipo de turismo.

El socio agradece el apoyo que se le otorgara y así mismo se compromete a cumplir de manera disciplinada con los pagos de las cuotas.
texts.en:
Hebert is a member of the Communal Bank “Siempre Unidos” (Always United) which is located in the Virgen Asunta Market in the District of Huanchac, Province and Department of Cusco.

He is 27 years old and single. Hebert works as a tour guide and is finishing his studies in tourism at an institute. He buys merchandise a little bit at a time, so he will use this loan to obtain equipment for tourists. Hebert wants to buy sleeping bags and a tent for now. Therefore, he is requesting a loan to invest in the purchase of camping equipment for tourists.

Hebert is grateful for the support that has been provided and promises to complete his payments in a disciplined manner.

loans.use: to buy camping equipment for tourists.

loans.name: Renee

texts.en:
Renee does not mind being one of the few young women in a very aggressive line of business – construction. In 2005 she started a construction company named Dorsey Bryant Gen Contractors, LLC with jobs ranging from installations to total home renovations, and also including major commercial projects. 

Although it has been a challenge for Renee to overcome the fact that she is young, and female, which is sometimes frowned upon in her line of work, she has not been discouraged. Renee has recently secured her first major commercial contract for the City of New Orleans, an impressive feat for most small businesses. The Kiva funds will allow Renee to have the working capital she needs to truly claim her place as one of the best contractors in New Orleans.

loans.use: to invest in commercial contract expenses.

loans.name: Edgar Reynaldo

texts.es:
Edgar, de 31 años de edad, habita en la ciudad de León, su nivel de estudios es básico solo termino el cuarto grado de primaria, es soltero, de oficio comerciante vende chinelas para damas, tiene 20 años con este negocio. Cuando el inicio fue con ayuda de un tío de el que le presto capital para que comprara mercadería y empezara a vender. Así lo hizo y fue haciendo su clientela poco a poco fue levantando su pequeño negocio, el cual lo tiene ubicado en el mercado de la estación de buses de León.    
Requiere el préstamo para comprar chinelas para damas. Pues necesita invertir su inventario presentar estilos diferentes de chinelas para damas que son las de mayor demanda y el necesita cumplir con los pedidos que le hacen, para no perder clientes, así mejorar sus ventas. El no solo desea vender chinelas sino también quiere vender zapatos de mejor calidad, estilos y tener una línea para zapatos de niños.
texts.en:
Edgar, age 31, lives in the city of León. He only has a basic education, having finished school only through the fourth grade. Edgar is single and earns his livelihood by selling women’s slippers. He has been in this business for 20 years. His uncle helped him start this business by lending him capital to buy merchandise so that he could start selling. Edgar carried out his plans and gradually built up his customer base so that he could establish his small business. His business is located at the market in the bus station in León.

He is requesting this loan to buy women’s slippers. Edgar needs to invest in his inventory so that he can offer different styles of women’s slippers that are in high demand and fulfill his orders. This will prevent him from losing customers and help him improve his sales. Edgar does not want to sell only slippers, so he plans to sell shoes of high quality and of various styles. He also wants to offer a line of children’s shoes.

loans.use: to buy women's slippers.

loans.name: Erica

texts.en:
Tired of ill-fitting, unattractive shoes, Erica D. took matters into her own hands … make that fit. After several years of research on shoe design, Erica launched Phat Pheet to offer stylish, trendy footwear options to fit a wider range of feet.  “All women want to look good,” says Erica, whose “Saints Slippers” are currently the hottest selling item through her website (www.PhatPheet.com).  

Since her business’s launch eight months ago, Phat Pheet has been booking special events and shoe shows left and right and the products have picked up a loyal following in Atlanta and parts of Texas. Phat Pheet emphasizes community involvement, and the company has taken part in philanthropic events such as New Orleans’s Breast Cancer Walk and the New Orleans Aids Walk.  

Erica considers herself lucky to have evacuated before Katrina.
