Unfortunately, her home was not so lucky: she became a homeowner just one year prior to the storm and her home in the Lower Ninth Ward did not survive the flood waters.  “I was born and raised in New Orleans,” says Erica.  “I love the culture and diversity of this city; I felt obligated to rebuild.” Erica’s dream is to one day launch an entire Phat Pheet line of shoes for store brands to carry and her upbeat attitude carries over to her company’s marketing slogan:  “At Phat Pheet, we have some big shoes to fill!”  

Erica will use her Kiva loan to purchase more inventory for her store.

loans.use: to purchase new shoe inventory.

loans.name: Ketty

texts.es:
La  socia pertenece al banco comunal “SEÑOR PASION ” el banco se encuentra ubicado en el Distrito de Yucay, en la Provincia de Urubamba y Departamento de Cusco.

La  socia Ketty; tiene 48 años de edad,  la socia es soltera; la socia trabaja en transporte, ella tiene sus buses interprovinciales, la socia también alquila sus buses para prestar servicio turístico, la socia  cubre la ruta de Cusco- Urubamba- Ollantaytambo y viceversa; la socia desea invertir el crédito en la compra de neumáticos para su bus; la socia requiere invertir en la compra de neumáticos para mejorar su unidad vehicular. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de neumáticos.

La  socia agradece el apoyo que se le otorgara y así mismo se compromete a cumplir de manera disciplinada con los pagos de las cuotas.
texts.en:
Ketty is a member of the Communal Bank “Señor Pasion” which is located in the District of Yucay, Urubamba Province, Department of Cusco.

She is 48 years old and single. Ketty works in transportation and has buses that travel through different provinces. She also rents out her buses for tours. The route that she covers goes from Cusco to Urubamba to Ollantaytambo and then in reverse order on the return trip. Ketty wants to invest this loan in the purchase of tires for her bus. She needs to purchase the tires to equip her vehicle, so she is requesting a loan for this purpose.

Ketty appreciates the support that has been provided and promises to complete her payments in a disciplined manner.

loans.use: to purchase tires for her bus.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.es:
La  socia pertenece al banco comunal “SEÑOR PASION ” el banco se encuentra ubicado en el Distrito de Yucay, en la Provincia de Urubamba y Departamento de Cusco.

La  socia Elizabeth; tiene 39 años de edad,  la socia es casada; la socia tiene 3 hijos de 17, 10, 7 años de edad, la socia trabaja en la compra y venta de maíz blanco, la socia se dedica también a la agricultura, la socia ahora desea el crédito para invertir en la compra de semillas, de maíz blanco para la siembra y también desea remover el terreno de cultivo y luego de la siembra abonar. La socia desea el crédito para poder comprar semillas de maíz blanco, pagar el tractor y comprar abono para la nueva siembra.

La  socia agradece el apoyo que se le otorgara y así mismo se compromete a cumplir de manera disciplinada con los pagos de las cuotas.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the “SEÑOR PASION ” communal bank, located in the Yucay district, in the Urubamba province, Cusco department.

Elizabeth: She is 39, married, and has 3 children ages 17, 10 and 7. She works buying and selling white corn. She also works in agriculture. She now wants this loan to invest in the purchase of white corn seeds for sowing, and she also wants to till her land for cultivation and, after sowing, to fertilize. She wants this loan in order to be able to buy white corn seeds, pay for the tractor, and purchase fertilizer for the new crops.

The member is grateful for the support that we are offering and she promises to repay the quotas in a disciplined manner.

loans.use: to buy white corn seeds, pay for a tractor and purchase fertilizer for the new crops.

loans.name: Marisa Jesus

texts.es:
La  socia pertenece al banco comunal “SEÑOR PASION ” el banco se encuentra ubicado en el Distrito de Yucay, en la Provincia de Urubamba y Departamento de Cusco.

La  socia Marisa; tiene 42 años de edad,  la socia es casada; la socia tiene 3 hijos de 16, 13, 10 años de edad; la socia es docente de profesión, ella es docente de nivel inicial, la socia también se dedica  a la agricultura ella tiene sus terrenos agrícolas y en esta ocasión la socia desea invertir en la siembra de maíz blanco, la socia solicita el préstamo para comprar semillas de maíz blanco, también requiere pagar el tractor para remover el terreno y comprar abono.

La  socia agradece el apoyo que se le otorgara y así mismo se compromete a cumplir de manera disciplinada con los pagos de las cuotas.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the “SEÑOR PASION ” communal bank, located in the Yucay district, Urubamba province, Cusco department.

Marisa: She is 42 and married. She has 3 children ages 16, 13 and 10. She is a teacher by profession, she is a first-level teacher. She also works in agriculture. She has agricultural lands, and she now wants to invest in sowing white corn. She is requesting this loan to purchase white corn seeds. She also needs to buy fertilizer and pay for a tractor to till the land.

She is grateful for the support that we are offering and promises to repay her quotas in a disciplined manner.

loans.use: to purchase white corn seeds. She also needs to pay for a tractor to till the land, and she needs to buy fertilizer.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
María es socia del  Banco Comunal “Las Estrellitas Unidas del Titicaca”, ubicado en el distrito de Pilcuyo, provincia El Collao, departamento de Puno, tiene 45 años de edad, es viuda y tiene 2 hijos ya independientes.  Estudió hasta 4to de educación primaria.
Desde hace tres años trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos,  su préstamo inicial fue de S/ 300.00 nuevo soles, préstamo que incrementó en su negocio de compra y venta de ganados  ovinos, vacunos y porcinos.
Con éste nuevo préstamo de S/ 2000.00 nuevo soles, comprará una vaca y chancho, para venderlo al instante aunque a veces lo engorda por tres meses y así consigue venderlos a un mejor precio.  La señora trabaja sola en el negocio.  Su sueño es mejorar los animales y mejorar sobre todo sus ganancias.
Lo que le gusta del Banco Comunal son  los ahorros y su ganancia.
texts.en:
María is a member of the “Las Estrellitas Unidas del Titicaca” communal bank, located in the Pilcuyo district, El Collao province, Puno department. She is a 45-year-old widow and has 2 independent children. She studied until the fourth grade of elementary school.
For three years she has worked with the Movimiento Manuela Ramos. Her first loan was 300 Nuevo Soles, a loan that expanded her business buying and selling bovine and ovine livestock and pigs.
With this new loan of 2000 Nuevos Soles, she will purchase a cow and a pig to sell immediately, even though she sometimes fattens animals for three months in order to sell them at a better price. She works alone in her business. Her dream is to improve the animals and, above all, to improve her income.
What she likes about her communal bank is the savings and her earnings.

loans.use: to purchase a cow and a pig.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to plant banana trees

loans.name: Gladis Maria

texts.es:
La señora Gladis Maria es socia del banco comunal las Colinas del distrito Yarinacocha, Departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 51 años de edad, està casada y tiene dos hijos, el mayor ya se independizó.
Desde hace cinco años Gladis Maria trabaja con Manuela Ramos, después de haber invertido en otro negocio ahora se dedica junto con su esposo en un negocio más rentable que es venta de muebles para salas y artefactos.
Con su nuevo préstamo de S/ 2,000.00 comprarà un juego de sala y seis mesas de centro.
El trabajo en la tienda ella comparte con su esposo, él trabaja por la mañana y Gladis Maria por las tardes, como en horas de la mañana tiene que atender su hogar.
Espera que este negocio siga para adelante y pueda seguir creciendo. Està agradecida por la oportunidad que Manuela Ramos le ha dado para realizar sus propios negocios y mejorar la situación económica de su familia.
texts.en:
Mrs. Gladis Maria is a member of the Las Colinas communal bank in the Yarinacocha district, Ucayali department. She is 51, married, and has two children, the eldest of whom is already independent.
For five years, Gladis Maria has worked with Manuela Ramos. After having invested in another business, she now works with her husband in a more profitable business: selling furniture for living rooms, and household appliances.
With her new loan of S/2,000, she will purchase a living room set and six center tables.
She and her husband share the work in the store. He works in the morning and Gladis Maria works in the afternoon, as during the morning hours she tends to their home.
She hopes that this business keeps moving forward and that it can continue growing. She is grateful for the opportunity given to her by Manuela Ramos to do business and improve her family's economic situation.

loans.use: to purchase furniture.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
La  socia pertenece al banco comunal “SEÑOR PASION” el banco se encuentra ubicado en el Distrito de Yucay, en la Provincia de Urubamba y Departamento de Cusco.

La  socia Rosa; tiene 48 años de edad,  la socia es casada; la socia tiene 4 hijos de 26, 24, 19, 9 años de edad; la socia es docente de profesión de nivel primaria, la socia se dedica también al negocio minorista ella tiene una tienda pequeña de venta de cerveza, la socia también los días de feria lleva a la estación y lo que no se venda ella lo venderá en su local. La socia desea invertir el crédito en la compra de cerveza, la socia comprara cajas de cerveza para venderlas en la feria. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de cerveza para llevar  a la feria a vender 

La  socia agradece el apoyo que se le otorgara y así mismo se compromete a cumplir de manera disciplinada con los pagos de las cuotas.
texts.en:
This borrower belongs to the “SEÑOR PASION” communal bank. The bank is located in the Yucay district, in Urubamba province, in the Department of Cusco.

Her name is Rosa and she is 48 years old. She is married and has 4 children, aged 26, 24, 19, and 9. She is a primary school teacher by profession, and she also has a retail business. She has a small shop where she sells beer. On market days, she also takes her products to that location, and what she does not sell there she will sell in her shop. She would like to invest the loan in buying beer. She will buy cases of beer to sell at the market. The borrower is requesting the loan to invest in buying beer to take to the market to sell. 

The borrower is grateful for the support provided to her, and she is committed to making her payments in a disciplined manner.

loans.use: to invest in buying beer to sell at the market.

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es:
Margarita  es socia del  Banco Comunal “Las Estrellitas Unidas del Titicaca”, ubicado en el distrito de Pilcuyo, provincia El Collao, departamento de Puno, tiene 51 años de edad, es madre soltera y tiene 2 hijos.  Cuenta con educación secundaria.
Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace dos años,  su préstamo inicial fue de S/ 300.00 nuevo soles, dinero que invirtió en su negocio de compra y venta de ganados como ovinos y vacunos.
Con su nuevo préstamo de S/  1,500.00 nuevo soles, comprará una vaca o cinco ovejas para su respectivo engorde por dos meses, en el negocio le ayudan sus hijos.
Su sueño es tener un negocio de prendas de vestir (ropa) y poder vender en diferentes lugares.
Lo que le gusta del Banco Comunal son las reuniones porque intercambian experiencias y están alegres.
texts.en:
Margarita is a member of the Las Estrellitas Unidas del Titicaca Communal Bank, which is located in the Pilcuyo District of the Collao Province in the Puno Region.  She is a 51 year-old single mother with two children.  She has a secondary education.  

She has worked with the Movimiento Manuela Ramos for years now.  Her first loan was for 300 nuevo soles, which she invested in her business buying and selling livestock such as sheep and cattle.  With her new loan of 1,500 nuevos soles, she will buy one cow or five sheep for two months of fattening.  They will help her children through helping her business.   

Her dream is to have a clothing business and to be able to sell in different places.

What she likes most about the communal bank are its meetings because they share their experiences and have a good time.

loans.use: to buy one cow or five sheep

loans.name: Marvin

texts.es:
El Joven Marvin, de 28 años de edad, originario de Las Delicias una comunidad localizada en Yali municipio de Jinotega, de oficio agricultor, siembra café, tiene dos hijos, desde muy joven se ha dedicado a trabajar la tierra, por tal motivo no continuo sus estudios, solo  termino el cuarto grado de primaria. El empezó a sembrar por su propia cuenten unos terrenos que su papa le heredo, el comenzó a sembrar café a los 15 años de edad, y desde entonces se ha convertido en su principal rubro y negocio del cual depende su familia, el tiene 3 manzanas de tierra en las cuales solo tiene siembras de café.  
Solicito el préstamo para comprar una motobomba de riego para acelerar su trabajo.  Pues le será de gran ayuda, ya que ahorrara pago de mano de obra, podrá hacer mas compacto el sistema de riego atravez de la maquina, podrá rosear de forma mas directa y paralela los insumos que necesita su siembras de café.     
Sus metas son mejorar sus siembras de café, terminar de construir un hogar para sus hijos.
texts.en:
The young man Marvin, aged 28, is originally from Las Delicias, which is a community located in the Yali municipality of Jinotega.  He is a coffee farmer, and has two children.  He has worked the land since he was very young, and for that reason did not continue with his education but only completed the fourth grade of primary school.  

He began to farm on his own account on several fields that he inherited from his dad.  He started growing coffee when he was 15 years old, and since then he has made farming into his main field of work and the business on which his family depends.  He has three manzanas (a land measurement term) of land, on which he grows only coffee.  

He is asking for the loan to buy an irrigation pump to speed up his work.  It will be a big help to him, as it will save him from paying for labor.  He will be able to make the irrigation system more compact with the machine, and he will be able to spray the nourishment that the coffee plants need more directly and simultaneously. 

His goals are to grow his coffee plants, and to finish building a house for his children.

loans.use: to buy an irrigation pump to speed up his work.

loans.name: Julia

texts.es:
Julia  es socia del  Banco Comunal “Las Estrellitas Unidas del Titicaca”, ubicado en el Centro Poblado D. Chipana, distrito Pilcuyo, provincia El Collao, departamento D. Puno, tiene 48 años D. edad, está casada y tiene 2 hijos, uno D. ellos independiente.  Cuenta con educación primaria incompleta.
Ella se dedica a la compra y venta D. animales como vacunos y ovinos, trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desD. hace cuatro años,  su préstamo anterior fue por la suma D.  S/ 500.00 nuevo soles, dinero que invirtió en la compra D. algunos animales.
Con este nuevo préstamo D.  S/ 3000.00 nuevo soles, comprará dos vacas para engordarlas por seis meses, para luego venderlas en la localidad D. Ilave y Pilcuyo, D. esa manera genera más ganancias.  Nos cuenta que  trabaja junto con su esposo.
Su sueño es mejorar los animales para venderlos a buen precio y tener buenos ingresos económicos.
Lo que le gusta del Banco Comunal son las reuniones y lo que gana el ahorro
texts.en:
Julia is a member of the “Las Estrellitas Unidas del Titicaca” (The United Little Stars of Titicaca) Communal Bank.  It is located in the central village of Chipana, Pilcuyo district, El Collao province, Puno department.  

She is 48 years old, married, and has two children.  One of them is independent.  She did not complete elementary school.  She buys and sells animals like cows and pigs.  

She has been working with the Movimiento Manuela Ramos for four years.  She used her previous loan for 500 soles to buy some animals.  With this new loan for 3,000 soles she will buy two cows to fatten for six months.  Then she will sell them in Ilave and Pilcuyo.  This way she will generate more earnings.  She tells us that she works together with her husband.

Her dream is to improve the animals in order to sell them for a good price and to have better income.

What she likes about her communal bank are the meetings and what she gains from savings.

loans.use: to buy to cows to fatten.

loans.name: Rosa Mercedes

texts.es:
La Sra. Rosa pertenece al Banco Comunal “María Auxiliadora”, Distrito D. Tarapoto, Provincia y Departamento D. San Martín. Es Viuda, tiene 72 años y 05 hijos; que ya cuentan con familia propia. Ante la necesidad D. generar sus propios ingresos se  inicia  como costurera confeccionando prendas D. vestir, actividad  que  deja por motivos D. salud ya que su edad no le permitía estar esforzándose mucho, deciD. entonces implementar su negocio D. venta D. artículos D. primera necesidad, iniciando así con un capital inicial D. S/.300.00 nuevos soles.
Actualmente incrementó su negocio y se siente muy satisfecha y más tranquila, cuenta con muy buena clientela por su carisma y buena atención.
Con este préstamo D. S/. 1,000.00 comprará sacos D. arroz, azúcar, aceite en docenas, leche en tarro, leche en caja , fideos en kilos, conservas D. pescado y en variedad D. marcas, verduras, frutas y artículos D. higiene personal para continuar dando una mejor atención a sus clientes.Rosa, es una mujer emprendedora,  su sueño es contar con una tienda mayorista y está muy agradecida con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos por ayudar a mujeres como ella a realizar sus sueños.
texts.en:
Señora Rosa belongs to the Communal Bank “María Auxiliadora”, which is in the District of Tarapoto, in the Province and Department of San Martín.  She is a widow, is 72 years old, and has five children who have their own families.

Because she needed to earn her own income, she began working as a tailor, making clothes.  She had to leave this activity for health reasons and as her age did not allow her to take on anything too arduous, she decided to start a business selling everyday items.  She started this with initial capital of 300 New Soles.

Currently, she has grown her business and feels very satisfied and more calm.  She has many good customers because of her charisma and good service.

With this loan of 1,000 Soles, she will buy bags of rice, sugar, oil by the dozen, bottle so milk, cartons of milk, noodles by the kilo, canned fish and a variety of brands, vegetables, fruit, and personal hygiene products, so as to continue to proviD. good service for her customers.

Rosa is an enterprising woman.  Her dream is to have a wholesale store, and she is very grateful to the Movimiento Manuela Ramos for helping women like her to achieve their dreams.

loans.use: to buy groceries: rice, oil, milk

loans.name: Petrona De Jesús

texts.es:
Petrona de Jesús es una mujer trabajadora quien se dedica a la microindustria de alimentos de soya. Este negocio lo inicio hace 10 años vendiendo alimentos de soya en su casa y desde hace tres años inicio con la pequeña industria y tiene su puesto en el mercado de San Judas.
El préstamo lo invertirá en soya, canela y azúcar.
texts.en:
Petrona de Jesús is a hard-working woman who works in the micro-industry of soy-based food.  She has been working in this business for the last 10 years, selling soy-based foods from her home, and three years ago she started a small level of trading, with a stand at the market in San Judas.

She will invest the loan in buying soy, cinnamon and sugar.

loans.use: to buy soy, cinnamon, sugar, etc.

loans.name: Dalmith

texts.es:
La Sra. Dalmith pertenece al Banco Comunal “Mujeres de Victoria II”, Distrito de Tarapoto, Provincia y Departamento de San Martín. Es conviviente, tiene 28 años y dos  hijas de 4 años y ocho meses de edad.
Se caracteriza por su entusiasmo y alegría, siempre con las ganas de salir adelante, esto le valió para iniciar su propio negocio con una inicial de S/. 300.00  Nuevos soles.  Se dedica a la venta de comidas  en un puesto del mercado cerca a su casa, cuenta con el apoyo de su pareja quien la traslada en su motocarro. Poco a poco fue haciéndose muy conocida entre sus clientes que son vecinos, familiares y transeúntes, por  su amabilidad y el buen trato que les brinda a sus clientes.Con este préstamo de S/ 2,000.00 nuevos soles, comprará insumos para sus preparados como: sacos de arroz y azúcar, carnes, pescados, plátanos en racimos, fideos, aceites en docenas, verduras y frutas regionales, asimismo implementar su mobiliario como mesas y sillas plásticas.
Dalmith es una mujer luchadora,  su sueño es contar con un Restaurant con comidas típicas de la Selva del Perú.  Está muy agradecida con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos por ayudar a mujeres como ella a tener oportunidades de poder hacer realidad sus sueños.
texts.en:
Dalmith belongs to the Mujeres de Victoria II Communal Bank in the Tarapoto District of the province and department of San Martín.  She is 28 years old and lives with her partner and two daughters, one who is four and the other eight months old.

She is known for her enthusiasm and cheerfulness.  She has always had the drive to get ahead, which enabled her to start her own business with a down payment of 300 nuevos soles.  She sells food in a stall at the market near her house, and she has the support of her partner, who drives her around in his three-wheeled delivery van.  Little by little, her friendliness and good customer service have brought her very close to her customers, who are made up of neighbors, family members, and passers-by.  With this loan of 2,000 nuevos soles, she will buy ingredients for her prepared meals, such as bags of rice and sugar, fish, bunches of bananas, noodles, dozens of oils, and local fruits and vegetables.  She will also install furniture, such as plastic tables and chairs.

Dalmith is a fighter; her dream is to have a restaurant that serves dishes typical of the Peruvian jungle.  She is very appreciative of the Movimiento Manuela Ramos for helping women like herself get the opportunity to make their dreams a reality.

loans.use: to buy ingredients such as bags of rice and sugar, meats, fish, bunches of bananas, etc.

loans.name: Luis Alberto

texts.es:
Luis Alberto, de 28 años de edad, habita en Pueblo Nuevo, municipio de Estelí, soltero, de oficio agricultor, se dedica a la siembra de hortalizas.  Este es su segundo préstamo en Kiva, fue muy positivo para el, ya que  con el primer crédito el pudo mantener la siembra de tomates, compro insumos, fertilizantes, pago mano de obra además tuvo un buen rendimiento que era uno de sus objetivos al empezar la siembra pero tuvo pequeños problemas por la baja de precio en le mercado de las hortalizas. Pero ahora que ya hay mas estabilidad en el área de las hortalizas las posibilidades de ventas son mas positivas y el no quiere perder la oportunidad de sembrar y vender su producción de tomates los cuales el considera son de muy buena calidad, pues son frutos de su arduo trabajo y la ayuda de su familia.
Solicita el crédito para sembrar tomates, pagar mano de obra. Con esta inversión tiene la visión de sacar una excelente producción vender toda la cosecha,pagar los créditos, ampliar sus aéreas de siembra.
texts.en:
Luis Alberto, aged 28, lives in Pueblo Nuevo in the mucipality of Estelí. He is single, and is a farmer who grows vegetables.

This is his second loan through Kiva.  He was very positive about his first loan, as with it he was able to keep up his planting of tomatoes, buy supplies and fertilizers, and pay for labor.  Additionally, he had a good yield, which was one of his goals in beginning the planting.  However, he had some small problems because of the low price of vegetables in the market.  But now that he has become more established for his vegetables, his sales possibilities are stronger and he does not want to lose the opportunity to grow and sell his tomato production.  He considers them to be of excellent qualitiy, and they are the fruits of his hard work and the assistance of his family.

He is requesting the loan to plant tomatoes and pay for labor.  With this investment, he has a vision of achieving an excellent crop, selling his entire harvest, paying off his loans, and increasing his area for farming.

loans.use: to grow tomatoes and pay for labor.

loans.name: Andrea

texts.es:
La Sra. Andrea pertenece al Banco Comunal “Mujeres de Victoria II” del Distrito de Tarapoto, Provincia y Departamento de San Martín. Es soltera, tiene 58 años y 2 hijos, uno a su cargo de 40 años (se encuentra enfermo).
Empezó a trabajar como cosmetóloga desde los quince años en la ciudad de Lima, regresó a Tarapoto por motivos familiares y se dedicó a la venta de asados y parrillas (comida típica) en las afueras de su casa, dejó esta actividad por cansancio y se dedicó a vender comida en un puesto del mercado, inició con un préstamo inicial de S/. 300. 00 nuevos soles.  Actualmente vende sus comidas al público en general, sus clientes la prefieren por su sazón y buen trato que les brinda. 
Con este nuevo préstamo de S/. 1,000.00 comprará productos al por mayor e ingredientes para la preparación de su comida como arroz y azúcar por sacos, aceites en docenas, verduras y frutas en sacos, menestras en Kilos, de esa manera atender a sus clientes como ellos se merecen.
Andrea es una mujer trabajadora y creativa,  su sueño es ampliar su casa y contar con un servicio de alquiler de habitaciones que le permita crecer económicamente.
Está muy agradecida con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos por brindarle la oportunidad de mantener su negocio.
texts.en:
Mrs. Andrea belongs to the “Mujeres de Victoria II” communal bank of the Tarapoto district, in the province and department of San Martín. She is single, 58, and a mother of two children. One of her children, age 40, is under her care (he is sick).
She started working as a cosmetologist fifteen years ago in Lima. She returned to Tarapoto for family reasons and started selling roasts and parillas (traditional food) outside of her house. She left this business because she was worn out, and she decided to sell food in a market stall. She started off with an initial loan of 300 Nuevos Soles. Now, she sells her food to the general public. Her customers prefer her food for its flavour and for her good service.
With this new loan of S/. 1,000, she will buy products and ingredients wholesale for preparing her food: for example, rice; bags of sugar; oil by the dozen; bagged fruits and vegetables; and kilos of mixed vegetables. This way she will be able to tend to her customers as they deserve.
Andrea is a hard-working and creative woman. Her dream is to expand her home and to rent out rooms to allow her to grow economically.
She is very grateful to the Movimiento Manuela Ramos for offering her the opportunity to maintain her business.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients such as rice and bags of sugar, oil by the dozen, vegetables and bagged fruits, etc.

loans.name: Cresencia

texts.es:
La señora Cresencia Isabel  es una mujer trabajadora y emprendedora de 70 años quien se dedica al comercio de cosméticos desde hace 8 años inicio con unos cuantos productos en la Avon ahora vende más y de distintas casa comerciales Zermat, Boguet, Arabella…etc. 
Ella con el crédito comprará productos en especial perfumes y cremas; ya que tiene pedidos en esto.
texts.en:
Mrs, Cresencia Isabel is a hard-working and enterprising woman of 70 years who has sold cosmetics for 8 years. She started off with some Avon products and now sells more, from various lines: Zermat, Boguet, Arabella...etc.
With this loan she will purchase products, especially perfumes and creams, since she already has orders for these.

loans.use: to purchase cosmetics.

loans.name: William

texts.es:
William, originario de Las Delicias una comunidad localizada en Yali municipio de Jinotega, tiene 32 años de edad, es casado, padre de dos hijos, de oficio agricultor, hoy en día se dedica a la siembra de café.  Sus comienzos en la actividad de la siembra y comercialización del café fue en la finca de  su papa, después el heredo3 manzanas de tierra hace 6 años, pero el desde my temprana edad aprendió a sembrar la tierra junto con su papa quien le enseño todo lo que ahora sabe de agricultura, cuando el no esta sembrando café se dedica a sembrar frijoles como su segundo ingreso. 
Requiere el préstamo para comprar una maquina de despulpar café. Con esta inversión el quiere reducir costos, pues se evitaría andar alquilando o prestando esa maquina. 
El tiene grande proyectos que le gustaría realizar en su finca uno de ello es mejorar sus finca de café hacerla mas productiva,  sacar una cosecha con una lata calidad de café orgánico, y convertir una área ecológica en parte de sus terrenos pues el se considera amante a la naturaleza y desea tener un área exclusiva solo ecológica y ambiental.
texts.en:
William is from Las Delicias, a community located in Yali, in the Jinotega municipality. He is 32, married, and the father of two children. He is a farmer. He currently cultivates coffee. He started off sowing and selling coffee on his father's farm. He inherited three manzanas [a land measurement unit equivalent to 1.740 acres] six years ago, but he learned to sow the land at a very young age with his dad who taught him everything he knows about agriculture. When he is not planting coffee he plants beans for a second income.
He needs this loan to purchase a machine to depulp coffee. With this investment he wants to reduce costs, since he won't have to rent or borrow this machine. 
He has big projects that he would like to realize on his farm. One of these is to improve his coffee farm, making it more productive with high quality organic coffee. He wants to convert part of his land into an ecological area because he is a nature lover and wants to have an area that is exclusively ecological and environmental.

loans.use: to buy a machine to depulp coffee.

loans.name: Leticia

texts.es:
La señora Leticia es una mujer trabajadora y emprendedora de 50 años quien tiene una refresquería y carnicería desde hace 4 años. Ella inicio con la venta de refrescos naturales  y con las ganancias empezó a vender carne.
Ella con el préstamo invertirá en pollo y su meta es comprarse un frízer más grande.
texts.en:
Mrs Leticia is a hard-working and enterprising woman, age 50, who has had a drink store and butcher's shop for 4 years. She started off selling natural drinks, and with her income she started to sell meat.
With this loan, she will invest in chicken. Her goal is to buy herself a larger freezer.

loans.use: to buy chickens

loans.name: Marina Guadalupe

texts.es: Marina es Viuda tiene 46 años y trabaja como secretaria en una Notaria, tiene 3 hijos y dos de ellos le ayudan con los gastos del hogar, uno trabaja en una Funeraria, otro es sordomudo y trabaja 10 horas diarias en una maquiladora, su hija menor tiene 16 años y esta estudiando; La señora Marina tiene 18 años viviendo en  una casa interés social que en vida su esposo adquirió, Marina tiene la necesidad de Impermeabilizarla  y colocar piso firme en la parte de atrás de su domicilio y solicita el apoyo para poder  realizar este proyecto.
texts.en: Marina is a 46-year-old widow. She works as a secretary in a notary's office. She has 3 children, 2 of whom help her with the household costs. One works in a funeral home, the other is a deaf-mute and works 10 hours a day in a maquiladora. Her youngest daughter is 16 and in school. For 18 years Marina has lived in a publicly subsidized home that her husband acquired when he was alive. Marina needs to waterproof her home and put in a solid floor in the back part of her home. She is requesting support in order to complete this project.

loans.use: To waterproof and put in a solid floor.

loans.name: Alma Rosa

texts.es: Alma Rosa de 42 años es casada, trabaja en una tienda de conveniencia desde hace 2 años como cajera, ella y su esposo hace 25 años compraron en pagos  un terreno mismo que su esposo de oficio Albañil fue construyendo poco a poco con ahorros propios. Para Alma y José su esposo el ver su casa terminada es ver sus sueños hechos realidad ya que hace 25 años lo que hoy es su casa en ese entonces era solo un cuartito de cartón en el que ellos podían dar abrigo a sus dos hijos; cada pared de esta casa tiene un gran significado para Alma porque las manos que la han construido son las de su esposo con ayuda. Aun costado de la casa ellos tienen un pasillo y cada que llueve este se inunda y se hace mucho lodo; Alma necesita el apoyo para colocar piso firme en este pasillo y evitar que este se inunde y poder tener acceso a el aun y en épocas de lluvia.
texts.en: Alma Rosa is 42 years old, married and has been working in a convenience store as a cashier for 2 years.  She and her husband bought a lot of land on credit 25 years ago.  Her husband, a builder by trade, has been slowly constructing on it using their savings.  For Alma and her husband Jose to see their house finished is to have their dreams turn to reality, for 25 years ago, what is now their house, was then only a cardboard room where they could shelter their two children.  Each wall in this house has great meaning for Alma for each one was built by the hands of her husband, with some help.  On one side of the house they have a corridor that floods every time it rains and turns into mud.  Alma needs backing to be able to put a solid floor for this corridor to avoid the flooding and be able to get to it even during the rainy season.

loans.use: to install a solid floor.

loans.name: Flor

texts.es: Flor tiene 27 años y vive en unión libre; ella trabaja 10 horas diarias de lunes a viernes en una Maquiladora. Ella se vio en la necesidad de buscar un empleo que le permitiera apoyar a su esposo con los gastos del hogar, ellos tienen 2 hijos y con lo que el ganaba no les alcanza para cubrir sus necesidades básicas, su esposo también trabaja 10 horas diarias en una maquiladora; hace tres años la Sra. Flor adquirió una vivienda de interés social misma que es la que ellos están habitando, en épocas calor esta casa es muy caliente y en épocas de frio se siento mucho la humedad que hasta se penetra en sus ropas y en lluvias se trasmina el agua por las paredes, ella necesita ser apoyada para impermeabilizar su vivienda y así poder ofrecer a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Flor is 27 years old, and lives in a civil union.  She works ten hours a day from Monday through Friday in a factory.  She saw the need to look for work to allow her to help her partner with the household expenses.  

Three years ago, Señora Flor acquired a publicly subsidized house, which is where they live.  During the hot season, it is very hot, and during the cold season there is so much humidity that it penetrates their clothes, and when it rains, the water seeps through the walls.  She needs to be helped to weather-proof her home, and so be able to provide her family with a better quality of life..

loans.use: to weather-proof her home.

loans.name: Ubania Del Carmen

texts.es:
Ubania del Carmen es una mujer trabajadora y emprendedora de 34 años quien es propietaria de una barbería la cual inicio hace tres años con una pequeña silla y precarias condiciones. En la actualidad cuenta con un local, con dos trabajadores  y mejores condiciones.
Ella invertirá el crédito en materiales otra silla, tijeras, guillette, gel, espuma para afeitar…etc.
texts.en:
Ubania del Carmen is a hard-working and enterprising woman, who is 34 years old and the proprietor of a barber shop.  She started it three years ago with a small chair and precarious conditions.  Now she has her own premises, with two employees and better conditions.  

She will invest the loan in materials, another barber chair, scissors, Gillette, gel, shaving foam, etc.

loans.use: to buy scissors, a barber chair, gel, etc.

loans.name: Cesar Daniel

texts.es: El señor Cesar Daniel  de 34 años vive en unión libre con Elizabeth y tienen un hijo que inicia su educación Preescolar; Cesar es un esposo y padre que se preocupa por dar lo mejor que el pueda a su Familia. Hace 5 años su principal única fuente de Ingresos era la venta de artículos de segunda mano como los son: ropa, zapatos, juguetes, muebles, artículos electrodomésticos para el hogar.  Con el ingreso que el obtenía del negocio no era suficiente para cubrir las necesidades básicas de su hogar y fue por ello que se vio en la necesidad de buscar un empleo en el cual recibiera un sueldo fijo pero sin tener que descuidar el negocio, el trabaja de Lunes a Viernes en un horario de 6:00 de la mañana a 4:00 de la tarde como operador de costura en una maquiladora desde hace 2 años; pero no pierde la ilusión de que muy pronto podrá dejar ese trabajo y dedicarse únicamente a su negocio, requiere el apoyo para compra de mercancía y tener una gran variedad de productos que le permitan incrementar las ventas de su negocio .
texts.en:
Cesar Daniel is 34 years old and lives in a common-law relationship with Elizabeth.  They have a son who is starting preschool.  Cesar is a husband and father who cares to do the best he can for his family. Five years ago, his main source of income was selling used goods such as clothes, shoes, toys, furniture, and household appliances. 

The income that he obtained from the business was not enough to cover the basic needs of his home and because of that, he needed to find a job where he would receive a fixed salary but without neglecting his business.  For two years, Cesar has been working Monday through Friday from 6:00 am in the morning to 4:00 pm in the afternoon as the sewing operator in a sweatshop.  He does not lose the dream that he'll soon quit that job and devote himself solely to his business.  Cesar requests the support to purchase goods to have a great variety of products to help him increase sales for his business.

loans.use: to buy merchandise to stock his business.

loans.name: Maria De La Luz

texts.es: María De La Luz de 55 años es madre soltera y desde hace 27 años se dedica a la venta de productos de segunda mano, los productos que ella vende son ropa usada de temporada, Zapatos, Juguetes, Artículos para el hogar, Muebles, Bolsas de dama; María es una mujer emprendedora la cual después de haber trabajado 20 años en una empresa decidió emprender su propio negocio y ser ella misma su propio Jefe, durante estos 27 años el negocio ha sido su única fuente de ingresos ella sabe que entre más producto tenga en existencia para su venta mayores serán ventas  y solicita el apoyo para compra de ropa de temporada y poder ampliar el inventario de mercancía.
texts.en: Maria De La Luz is 55 years old, a single mother and has been selling second hand merchandise for 27 years.  The merchandise that she sells is used seasonal clothing, shoes, toys, home goods, furniture and handbags.  Maria is an enterprising woman, who after working for a company for 20 years decided to start her own business and be her own boss.  During theses 27 years, the business has been her only source of income.  She know that the more merchandise that she has available for sale the higher will be her sales.  She is requesting backing to be able to buy seasonal clothing and be able to increase her merchandise inventory.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise for the business.

loans.name: Martha

texts.es:
Martha Patricia es una mujer trabajadora y emprendedora de 37 años  quien tiene una pulpería y vende licor sellado. Este negocio era de su abuelita y desde hace 5 años ella lo administra. Ella con el crédito piensa realizar mejoras en el negocio y en la compra de mercadería.
Ella tiene un pequeño niño de 6 meses y su meta es seguir adelante.
texts.en:
Martha Patricia is a hard-working and enterprising 37 year old woman.  She has a store, and she sells sealed liquor.  This business was her grandmother’s, but she has been managing it for five years.

She plans on using the loan to make improvements to her business and buying merchandise.

She has a small six month old child, and her goal is to get ahead.

loans.use: to make improvements to her place and to buy merchandise (basic grains and liquor).

loans.name: Fausta Teofila

texts.es: La señora Fausta de 40 años es casada y tiene una hija. Al ver ella que con el ingreso que su esposo tenia como taxista no les alcanzaba para cubrir sus necesidades básicas, decidieron iniciar un negocio el cual denominaron “Miscelánea Mary” este negocio existe desde hace 9 años en el cual venden abarrotes, dulces, refrescos, lácteos, papelería, frituras, helados y mas.  Fausta desarrollo un gusto por su tienda y ahora mas que un negocio es un proyecto de vida; para ella y su familia ya que les permite tener una fuente de ingresos mas, al mismo tiempo estar  de ser su propio Jefe y le gusta mucho ofrecer un trato amable a sus clientes y tenerles todo lo que ellos necesiten es por eso que solicita un apoyo para compra de mercancía y surtir su negocio.
texts.en: Mrs. Fausta is 40 years old, married and has one daughter.  Upon seeing that the income that her husband provided as a taxi driver was not enough to cover their basic expenses, they decided to start a business which they called “Miscelánea Mary”(Mary's corner shop).  This business has been in existence for 9 years.  They sell groceries, sweets, refreshments, dairy products, paper products, fried food, ice cream and others.  Fausta has developed a liking for the store and it has become more than a business but her life's project.  It allows them to have a source of income while being their own boss.  She likes to treat her customers kindly and to have everything that they might need.  For this reason she is requesting a loan to be able to buy merchandise and stock her store.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise for the business.

loans.name: Juan Antonio

texts.es: Juan Antonio de 27 años esta casado con Griselda; desde hace 5 años viven en una casa prestada tienen dos hijos, para el lo mas importante es su familia y el poder ofrecerles y patrimonio para toda la vida el anhela algún día poder tener su propia casa y darles un lugar digno donde vivir; el año pasado por medio de su empleo Antonio pudo adquirir un terreno el cual le están rebajando de su sueldo el ya quiere terminarlo de pagar para iniciar la construcción de su casa el y su familia ya se imaginan cada espacio de su casa inclusive ya tienen el color de la casa, Juan sabe que para que esto suceda falta mucho tiempo pero no pierde la esperanza que algún día su esposa y sus hijos tendrán la casa que el les prometió y solicita el apoyo para terminar de pagar el terrero y posteriormente poder iniciar la construcción de su casa.
texts.en: Juan Antonio is 27 and is married to Griselda; they've lived in a borrowed house for five years, they have two children and for him the most important thing is his family and being able to provide for them and give them a patrimony, he dreams to be able to have his own house and give them a dignified place to live; last year through his job Antonio was able to buy a piece of land which he is paying by getting it deducted from his salary, he wants to finish paying for it now so he can begin construction of the house, him and his family are imagining every space in the house, they even have a color picked.  Juan knows that for this to happen it will be a while but he remains hopeful that one day his wife and kids will have the house he promised to them, he requests your support to pay for the lot and begin the construction of the house.

loans.use: to pay for land to build his house

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to build a concrete slab.

loans.name: Antonio

texts.es: Antonio de 50 años es casado y padre de dos hijos que aun dependen económicamente de él y de su esposa Rudith, él trabaja como carnicero desde hace 5 años  y su esposa hace un años que cuenta con un empleo que le permite apoyar los gastos del hogar;  tienen 30 años viviendo en su domicilio y poco a poco le han ido haciendo mejoras a su casa, en Agosto del 2010 Antonio  y su familia llenos de ilusiones iniciaron la construcción de un cuarto grande en la parte de atrás de su vivienda y hasta el día de hoy no lo han podido concluirlo  por falta de los recursos económicos y requieren el apoyo para compra de lámina galvanizada, cemento y pintura para poder hacer su sueño realidad.
texts.en: Antonio is 50 years old, he is married bad has two children who are still economically dependent on him and on his wife Rudith. He has been a butcher for 5 years, and since a few years his wife has got a job with which she helps paying for family expenses. They have been living in their own house for 30 years, making improvements to their house little by little. Full of anticipation, in August 2010 Antonio and his family started the construction of a big room at the back of their house. As to today they have not yet been able to finish it due to lack of money, they are requesting a loan to buy zinc-coated steel sheets, cement and paint to succeed in making their dream come true.

loans.use: To buy construction materials to build a roof on a room at the back of his house.

loans.name: Modesta

texts.es: Modesta del Socorro es una mujer trabajadora y emprendedora quien desde hace 10 años se dedica a la realización de bebidas nacionales pinolillo(maiz y cacao), pinol(maiz), además comercializa ropa, calzado, chiverías…etc. Ella con el crédito comprara mercadería en ropa camisas, pantalones, blusas…etc.
texts.en: Modesta del Socorro is a hardworking and resourceful woman, and for the past 10 years she has been engaged in preparing the national drinks “pinolillo” (maiz and cocoa) and “pozol” (maiz). She also sells clothes, shoes and snacks among other products. The loan she is requesting will be used to buy items of clothing such as shirts, trousers, blouses and so on.

loans.use: To buy items of clothing such as shirts, trousers and blouses.

loans.name: Sengedorj

texts.en:
Sengedorj is 48 years old and lives with his two daughters and wife in a ger, Mongolian yurt  in Hovd province of Mongolia. His eldest daughter is a college student and the other one is a high school student. His wife works as an assistant researcher at the Power Station. 

Sengedorj started to trade livestock, meat, and hay in 2002. Every year, from August 15th to September 10th, he harvests hay. From August 20th to the end of October, he buys livestock, and then sells his goods and livestock in the spring. He stores meat in a rented warehouse. He has collected much business experience in the last years. He is a diligent man who says "I want to build a warehouse for meat in my fence (yard)." He is requesting a 2,500,000 MNT loan to purchase more livestock, and gasoline for his tractor to harvest hay.

loans.use: To purchase more livestock, and gasoline for his tractor

loans.name: Estación De Cumbe (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal Estación de Cumbe está formado por 6 mujeres y 2 hombres, viven por los alrededores de la parroquia Tarqui, esta parroquia es de clima frió, su gente se dedica a la cría de ganado gracias a sus llanuras, también laboran en la agricultura y mucha de su gente sale diariamente a la ciudad para laborar en diferentes actividades. Nuestras socias y socios son personas trabajadoras y luchadoras que día a  día luchan para salir adelante junto con sus familias.

Una de las socias de este grupo es la Señora. María Laura, vive por los alrededores de la parroquia Tarqui, tiene 53 años, es casada y ha concebido 6 hijos de 34, 32, 30, 28  y 18 años, sus hijos de 18  años son gemelos, dos de sus hijos son casados e independientes y sus cuatro hijos solteros trabajan y ayudan económicamente. Su esposo labora en la agricultura, la casa en la que habitan es el resultado del sacrificio conyugal.
 
La Señora. María Laura se dedica a los quehaceres domésticos, a la ganadería y a la cría cuyes y borregos, en su comunidad vende sus animales y la leche que le producen sus vacas. 

Este es el primer crédito que realiza en el banco comunal y lo va a invertir en la compra de alimento para su ganado y pollos.

Su meta es tener un negocio de cría y venta de pollos.
texts.en:
The Estación de Cumbe Communal Bank is composed of 6 women and 2 men who live in the outskirts of the parish of Taqui, characterized by its cold climate. Its inhabitants engage in breeding cattle on the surrounding plains as well as in agriculture, and many of them daily commute to town to work in different activities. Our members are hardworking and tenacious people striving day by day to progress together with their families.

One of the members of this group is María Laura, who lives in the outskirts of the parish of Tarqui. She is 53 years old, she is married and has 6 children aged 34, 32, 30, 28 and a set of twins aged 18. Two of her children are marred and economically independent, the other four have a job and help her economically. Her husband is a farmer. They live in their own home, built thanks to their hard work and sacrifice.

María Laura takes care of the housework and she engages in breeding livestock, “cuyes” (“cuy” is Quechua for Guinea pig) and lambs, selling her animals and the milk of her cows in her community.

This is the first loan she is requesting through the communal bank, and she will use it to buy animal feed for her animals and chickens.

Her goal is to run a chicken breeding and selling activity.

loans.use: To buy animal feed for animals and chickens.

loans.name: Namsraijav

texts.en: Namsraijav is 45 years old and lives with his two children and wife in a ger (a Mongolian yurt) in the Suhbaatar district of Ulaanbaatar, Mongolia. His wife works at the local railway. His oldest son is a college student and his daughter is a high school senior. Namsraijav was born in the Huvsgul province. He started to work as a researcher at the local community hospital in 1986. He moved to Ulaanbaatar in 1996 and started a shoe-making and repair business. He has built his business and has much work experience in his field. He is a hard-working and diligent man who says "I am working hard for life and for my family." He is requesting a 2,000,000 MNT loan to expand his service room and purchase more materials to make shoes for children.

loans.use: to purchase more materials to make shoes.

loans.name: Merah

texts.en:
Merah is married with 2 children. She is 32 years old and lives in Poblacion, Sapang Dalaga.
Merah sells grocery items to earn a living and has had this business for 3 years. Each month, she earns PHP 7500 doing this work. She has requested a loan of PHP 20,000 to purchase housing materials needed to finish her house.
Merah has been a member of PMPC for almost a year.

loans.use: to purchase plywood and pay for carpenters.

loans.name: Ana María

texts.es:
Ana María es una joven trabajadora y emprendedora quien se dedica a la venta de cosméticos, sopa y helados etc. Ella inicio hace 5 años por el incentivo de una amiga y luego siguió con el negocio.
Este préstamo es de autoestima y ella lo utilizara para su salud visual se realizara exámenes y se comprar sus lentes y con lo que quede se cortara el cabello.
texts.en:
Ana María is a hardworking and resourceful young woman who engages in selling cosmetics, soup and ice-creams among other products. She started 5 years ago, motivated by a friend, and she has then continued with this activity.
The loan she is requesting will help her improving her self-esteem, as she will use it to care for her visual heath: she will have her eyes tested and buy contact lenses, and she will use the remaining amount to have her hair cut.

loans.use: To have her eyes tested, to buy contact lenses and to pay for a haircut.

loans.name: Serdamba

texts.en: Serdamba is 44 years old and lives with his wife and four children in the Hovd province of Mongolia. Three of his children are high school students. He moved to Hovd from Erdeneburen in 2000. Since then he has been trading in coal and wood. With his profits, he purchased land. Now he owns two pieces of land, each equal to 0.7 hectare. He has three storage sheds for coal and wood. He is planning to build three more storage sheds. He is a diligent man who says "People who live away from the town center buy a lot of coal and wood. I plan to make some of my land into a coal and wood trading market." He is requesting a 1,000,000 MNT loan to build three storage sheds and buy more wood.

loans.use: to build three storage sheds and buy more wood.

loans.name: Galt

texts.en: Galt is 37 years old and lives with his wife and three daughters in a ger (a Mongolian yurt) in Hovd, Mongolia. His eldest daughter is a high school student. Until 2010, Galt sold coal and wood at the local market. With the profits he earned from this business, he bought a small truck and started to transport goods and vegetables within his town. He is planning to buy vegetables in the countryside and sell them in the town. He is a diligent man who says "I want to build my house in the near future." He is requesting a 500,000 MNT loan to buy vegetables at wholesale prices, and to repair his truck.

loans.use: to buy vegetables at wholesale.

loans.name: Ulziidash

texts.en: Ulziidash is 50 years old and lives with her husband and children in a ger (a Mongolian yurt) in Hovd, Mongolia. Her two children are college students. She moved to Hovd from Chandmani in 2000 and started to trade in meat and livestock. With the profits she has earned over the years, she has purchased 30 cows and 40 goats. In 2009, she added a coal and wood trading business. Now she sells the milk from her 13 cows and 40 goats. She is a diligent woman who says, "I want to buy several dairy cows and expand my business." She is requesting a 2,000,000 MNT loan to purchase more dairy cows and to repair her minivan.

loans.use: to purchase more dairy cows.

loans.name: Ederlina

texts.en:
At 53, Ederlina is a widowed woman. Her husband died three years ago from blood cancer. She keeps striving in her business to support herself and her son. She sold fruits and vegetables for a living until she suffered a stroke a year ago. Her son was forced to stop his education to maintain her medication. 

After recovering from sickness, Ederlina ventured into a new type of business: selling clothing. She now manages "ukay-ukay" that is selling branded used clothes and bags from Canada. Her son helps her in the business so she just stays at home and sometimes looks out for customers to buy her products. 

To further grow her business, she is requesting a loan of 12,000 Philippine Pesos (PHP) to buy new clothes to sell. She wants to attract more customers and make progress towards the increased income she needs to sustain the business for their daily needs.

loans.use: buy new clothes to sell for her "ukay ukay" business

loans.name: Criselda

texts.en:
Hog raising is the business of Criselda. She is 33 years old, managing hog raising for almost three years now. She is a college graduate but due to lack of employment opportunity she got married and chose to live a simple life with her family in their "bario" (a small village). She even shared that through patient hog raising, money is more easily acquired than through working in an office.

She is earning P15,000 every month from the business and is of big help getting medication for her mother-in-law's who had a  stroke due to high blood. She works for her medicine maintenance and her child's future. 	

She is requesting a loan from ASKI amounting to P15,000 to buy hog feed and three pigs to raise. She hopes that she will expand her venture to generate a higher income. Through this she can continue helping her mother-in-law with her medicines and create a stable future for her child.

loans.use: to buy hog feed and three pigs to raise.

loans.name: Bayaraa

texts.en:
Bayaraa lives with her two children and husband in a 'ger', a Mongolian yurt, in Hovd province of Mongolia. Her two children are attending the local kindergarten. Her husband was working in South Korea from 2006 to 2008. She and her husband started to operate a taxi service business in their hometown in 2008. She is planning to expand her business in the future. 

She is a hard-working, diligent and friendly woman who says, "If I take care of my car very well, the car provides me a very good income." She is requesting a 1,500,000 MNT loan to buy spare parts to repair her car.

loans.use: To buy spare parts.

loans.name: Edgar

texts.es: Edgar tiene 48 años, esta casado con Ada de 53 años, y fruto de esta relación tiene 2 hijos con quienes viven en su casa propia ubicada en el distrito de LLochegua. Edgar es una persona muy trabajadora, quien se gano el aprecio de todos sus clientes gracias al buen trato que ofrece hacia ellos. En su bar recreo, negocio que posee, esta apta para todo público, cuenta con una piscina para niños y adultos, juegos mecánicos, y los más exquisitos platos típicos preparados a base de productos de esta región, que son los que le dan un realce a su bar recreo de Don Edgar, que es como le llaman. Todo turista que llegue a este distrito siempre se queda contento con las ganas de poder volver otra vez. Edgar esta feliz con el negocio que tiene y el apoyo que recibe de su adorada esposa e hijos, quienes siempre están al tanto de los clientes. Este es su primer cerdito con MFP, por lo que el se compromete en realizar puntualmente el pago de sus cuotas. Con los 1500 comprara más utensilios de cocina para su bar recreo.
texts.en:
Edgar is 48 and is married to Ada, 53. They live with their two children in their own home located in Llochegua district. Edgar is a very hardworking person who has earned the appreciation of all of his customers thanks to his good relationships with them.

His business, a recreation bar, is suitable for everyone. He has a swimming pool for children and adults, amusement park rides and the most delicious typical dishes, prepared with local products, all of which enhance the appeal of Mr. Edgar’s recreation bar, as people refer to him. The tourists who come to this district are always delighted and want to return in the future.

Edgar is happy with his business and with the support he receives from his beloved wife and children, who are always well informed about the customers. This is his first loan from MFP and he is committed to making all of his payments on time. He will use the 1,500 to buy more cooking utensils for his recreation bar.

loans.use: to buy kitchen utensils for his recreation bar.

loans.name: Mary Rose

texts.en:
Mary Rose is 42 years old, a college graduate but unable to find work due to the employment crisis here in the Philippines. She is a sales agent for farm inputs such fertilizers, herbicides and insecticides. She patiently travels and walks long distances every day to market all her products. She goes house to house to market her products to farmers. She knows that it is difficult to do this every day but through her patience and hard work, she never entertains hardship. She continues to strive for the welfare of her family.

She was blessed with five children and is married to a 'tricycle' driver. With the big family, she usually encounters financial problems due to delayed payments of her customers so she needs to cope every now and then. In this connection, she is asking for the amount of P10,000 to buy fertilizers to sell in order to gain more income.

She hopes that she can maximize her profit so that she can lift her family from poverty.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers to sell.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is 58 years old and lives in Bacolod, Ozamis City. She is married with three children. 

Teresita works in the fish industry and sells fish for a living. She has been doing this for two years. She has requested a loan to purchase materials for her food stall renovation. 

Teresita has been a member of PMPC for three years. In the future, Teresita hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase materials for her food stall renovation.

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen is 43 years old and married with four children, one of whom is in school.

For the past five years Helen has run a general goods stall in the Philippines. She sells a variety of items such as soap, oil, spices, canned goods, etc. She works very hard to provide for her family.

Helen is requesting a 19,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock to sell. In the future Helen would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock to sell.

loans.name: Ester

texts.en:
Ester, 60 years old, manages a "sari-sari" store, a privately owned shop operated inside the shopkeeper's house. A small window is present where the customer's requested commodity is given. Ester sells candies, canned goods and noodles in the store. She wishes to add to her goods through asking  for the loan amount of P5,000 from ASKI (Alalay Sa Kaunlaran Inc.) to buy soft drinks, bread and butter for sale in the store.

Ester is blessed with nine children; among them, five are out of school. She can’t afford to send them all to school because of scarcity of money. She is earning only P6,000 every month and it‘s not enough to cover all their everyday needs since she has a big family. 

Ester, almost crying, stated that, “We once experienced eating rice alone just to fill our empty stomachs.” Obviously, she pitied her children and she was hurt. Despite these obstacles, Ester is full of hope. She is working hard and strives for the best. She knows that God is always there to guide her in achieving her goals.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks, bread and butter for sale in the store.

loans.name: Shirley

texts.en:
Shirley is 32 years old and married with two children.

Shirley has been raising pigs for ten years in the Philippines. She also earns additional income from farming sugarcane.

Shirley is requesting a loan of 20,000 PHP through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs. She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to build and expand her business so as to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Leonilda

texts.es: Leonilda tiene 40 años de edad, está casado con Juan de 49 años y fruto de esa relación tiene 6 hijos. Juntos habitan en su casa propia, ubicada en el distrito de LLochegua. Leonilda, tiene la clave del éxito en la responsabilidad, puntualidad y el de valorar mucho al cliente. A pesar de que leonilda no tuvo estudios superiores, ni tampoco logro terminar el colegio, ella tuvo paciencia y dedicación para tener hoy su tienda de abarrotes. Con este negocio puede salir adelante y ayudar en la econmía de la casa. Generalmente trabaja por cuenta propia, pero hay veces que cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo e hijos, quienes lo animan a seguir logrando más objetivos. Lo único que la aqueja es la competencia, por lo que debe procurar de surtir su tienda y de esa manera captar al cliente. Este es su primer crédito con MFP, por lo que ella se compromete hacer puntual en el pago de sus cuotas. Con los 1.500 nuevos soles que solicita, comprara nuevos productos para el expendio en su bodega.
texts.en:
Leonilda, age 40, is married to 49 year old Juan, and they have six children.  They live together in their own house in the Llochegua district.

Leonilda has found the key to success in responsibility, punctuality, and highly valuing the customer.  Even though Leonilda does not have a higher education nor did she finish school, she had the patience and dedication to now have a grocery store. 

With this store she is able to get ahead and help with the household finances.  She generally works on her own, but at times her husband and children help her.  They motivate her to continue achieving more goals. 

The only thing that troubles her is the competition.  She therefore needs to stock her store in order to attract customers.

This is her first loan with MFP, and she pledges to make her payments punctually.  She will use the requested 1,500 soles to buy new products to sell in her grocery store.

loans.use: to buy basic needs items to sell at her store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy ingredients for making native cakes, chicharon, bihon and other kinds of snacks in her food production business.

loans.name: Lilibeth

texts.en:
Lilibeth is 43 years old. She is married and has eight children.

Lilibeth works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari-sari (variety) store in the Philippines. She requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy items, such as shampoo and groceries, to sell in her sari-sari store.

Lilibeth has borrowed and paid sixteen loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the sari-sari store for 8 years and also earns income from food vending.

Lilibeth aspires to save money to expand her business and to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell in her sari-sari store.

loans.name: Dalila

texts.en: In the fishing/fish vending business for 10 years now, Dalila, who is married and a resident of the Philippines, works hard to support her family. She is requesting a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to buy materials for the repair of her fishing boat, and would like to build and expand her business in the future to secure her family's financial stability.

loans.use: to buy materials for the repair of her fishing boat.

loans.name: Fe

texts.en:
Fe is 42 years old and lives in Tubod Aloran, Misamis Occdental. She is married with four children. 

Fe raises pigs for a living. She has been doing this for three years. She has requested a loan of 5,000 Philippines pesos to purchase pigs for her pig raising business. 

Fe has been a member of PMPC for a year. In the future, Fe hopes to have big sales from her hog fattening to help her family .

loans.use: to purchase pigs for her pig-raising business.

loans.name: Florencia

texts.en: Florencia, a 53-year-old married mother of eight children, has been raising pigs in the Philippines  for 25 years to make a living. She earns additional income from selling ready-to-wear clothes. Now requesting a loan of PHP 10000 through NWTF to buy additional pigs and feed, Florencia  is working tirelessly to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional pigs and feed.

loans.name: Jaime

texts.en:
Jaime works hard to support his family. He is married and has a fishing business in the Philippines.

Jaime requested a 12,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy additional fishing net.  He has been in this business for 35 years now.

In the future, Jaime would like to save money to expand his business.

loans.use: to buy additional fishing net

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy charcoal for the retail business.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es: Rosa tiene 44 años de edad, es madre soltera de un niño, juntos viven en su casa propia, ubicada en el distrito de LLochegua. Rosa, se caracteriza por ser una mujer muy luchadora, recuerda que en su juventud siempre tuvo que trabajar como empleada del hogar, pero a veces recibía malos tratos de sus empleadores. Con el pasar de los años, decidió independizarse y realizar su propio negocio en su casa propia, ya que tenía un lugar amplio y campestre, solo tuvo que amueblarlo y que alguien le provea de bebidas y poder expenderlas. Es así que hoy celebra con much alegría el tener un negocio que le sea rentable. Es así que el bar, negocio que tiene, le rinde buenas ganancias económicas. En un futuro próximo, desea ampliar su negocio dándole más detalles y un centro recreacional. Este es su primer crédito con MFP, por el que se compromete a realizar puntualmente el pago de sus cuotas. Con los 1500 nuevos soles, desea comprar más muebles para su local.
texts.en: Rosa is 44 years old. She is a single mother and lives with her son in her own house in the district of LLochegua. Rosa is a determined woman. She remembers as a young woman having to work as a housekeeper. Sometimes her employers would mistreat her. Over the years, she decided to become independent and open her own business in her own house as it was spacious and quiet. All she had to do was furnish it, find soemone to provide her with drinks and then be able to sell them. She is now extremely delighted to own a profitable business. Her current business, the bar, provides her with ample profits. In the near future, she wants to expand the business, by adding the finer detail and creating a recreational area. This is her first loan with MFP and she agrees to pay her repayments on time. With the 1500 nuevos soles (PEN), she wants to buy more furniture for her bar.

loans.use: to buy furniture to furnish her bar.

loans.name: Martina

texts.en:
Martina is asking for a loan amount of 8,000 Philippines pesos to buy cooking oil, salt and sugar for sale in the store she manages for a living. Martina wishes to live longer to provide a complete education to her youngest child through income from her general store business. Her capital was lacking because her neighbors sometimes were not able to pay their credits, and she had her youngest, whom she is providing allowances to continue his schooling. 

She is 55 years old and married to a simple farmer; they are blessed with five children. Her youngest is the only one who has not finished his studying. 

She loves doing her work in selling, for it is of great help in sending all her children to school. Without it, she would not know her children's future would be secured. She is proud that all her elder children finished college, and now her youngest is about to achieve also what his elder siblings achieved.  

She is just an elementary graduate who dreams to have professional children, and now she made it through the help of her business and loan assistance from ASKI.

loans.use: to buy cooking oil, salt and sugar for sale in the store.

loans.name: Crema

texts.en:
Crema works hard to support her family. She is married and has a shell crafting business in the Philippines.

Crema requested a 25,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy more materials for her shell crafting business. She has been in this business for 16 years.

Crema would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more materials for her shell crafting business

loans.name: Perlita

texts.en:
Perlita is 51 years old and lives in Pob.2, Oroquieta City. She is married with one child.
 
To earn a living, Perlita has a business selling different kinds of viands (dishes), soft drinks, etc. She earns about 2,500 Philippines pesos (PHP) each month doing this type of work. Perlita has requested a loan of 5,000 (PHP) to purchase more raw ingredients for her restaurant.

Perlita has been a member of PMPC for a year. In the future, Perlita would like to have a big restaurant in Pob.2, Oroquieta City.

loans.use: to purchase more raw ingredients for her restaurant.

loans.name: Estrella

texts.en:
Estrella works hard to support her family. She is married and is selling natural medicines in the Philippines.

Estrella requested a 12,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell. She has been in this business for 10 years now and also earns additional income from a general store.

In the future, Estrella would like to build and expand her business to support the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell

loans.name: Timotea

texts.en:
Timotea is married with three children. Timotea is 45 years old and lives in Blancia St. Molave, Zamboanga del Sur.

Timotea is a farmer and grows pigs to earn a living. She has been doing this for almost 10 years. She has requested a loan to buy more pigs.

Timotea has been a member of PMPC for almost three years. In the future, Timotea hopes to improve her living conditions by buying more pigs.

loans.use: to purchase pigs for her pig-raising business.

loans.name: Analyn

texts.en:
Analyn is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a business selling ready-to-wear clothing in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing 25,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase more items to sell to customers.  Analyn has been in this business for 3 years. Analyn earns more income from vegetable vending.

Analyn has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more items to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy raw ingredients needed for making viands

loans.name: Hilary

texts.en:
Hilary is 51 years of age, married, and is blessed with nine children. Most of his children are sent to college. His wife is a teacher and works also as a housekeeper.

Managing a large crop of rice is the main source of income for Hilary. Through profits in farming, he helped his wife provide for their children's school fees. He always dreams that his children will finish their education and find work someday.

Sometimes, Hilary encountered financial shortage and could not fully sustain the farm inputs needed in farming like fertilizers, insecticides and herbicides.  That's why he is asking for a loan of PHP 25,000 to buy fertilizers, insecticides and herbicides for his farm.  His goal is to harvest a better yield each year. With the help of this loan, he can supply the farm inputs needed for farming.

loans.use: buy fertilizer, insecticide and herbicide

loans.name: Michel

texts.en:
As the married parent of one child, Michel works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing/fish vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from farming sugarcane. Michel is borrowing 10,000 PHP through NWTF to buy materials for the repair of her fishing boat for her fishing/fish vending business.

Michel has been sustaining her business activities through her past 2 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy materials for the repair of her fishing boat

loans.name: Donalia

texts.en:
Donalia is 51 years old.  She is engaged in a business buying and selling fruits and vegetables. She has been selling bananas, avocados and ginger around her  village for quite some time. Usually, she goes to the market to sell all her products where she can dispose them all easily. 

Donalia has been doing this for almost 20 years and is now earning an average net income of PHP 5,000 each month. She feels lucky to have a thrifty type of family since sometimes this monthly earning is sufficient, especially now that all her three children are married. 

In the 20 years in this business, she usually experienced delayed payments from her customers, so she needs to ask for loan assistance to maintain her business operation. Donalia is requesting from ASKI the amount of PHP 12,000 to buy sacks of spices, onions, garlic, and monggo or mung bean, as additional products to sell. She is thankful that ASKI, an MFI partner of KIVA, exists to help her in the business.

loans.use: buy fruits and vegetables to sell

loans.name: Merlito

texts.en:
Merlito is a farmer. He is 48 years of age and lives with wife and three children.

He has been farming for 10 years. He grows rice for the family’s consumption. He is thankful because through his hard work in cultivating his rice fields, he is able to expand the area of land he manages. Merlito is still aiming to expand the area of land he cultivates so that he could increase his yield in every cropping.

He is requesting a loan amounting to 15,000 Philippines pesos to buy farming supplies like fertilizers and insecticides to improve his rice fields. In farming, it is very important to supply all the needs of it to produce a better harvest.

He hopes that he could be able to produce abundant crops. Another hope is to expand the land area of his fields in order to improve it for the possibility to generate bigger income.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and insecticide for the rice farming business.

loans.name: Otgonjargal

texts.en: Otgonjargal is 34 years old and lives with her husband and two children in a ger, a Mongolian yurt, in the Huvsgul province of Mongolia. Her husband is self-employed, her eldest son attends high school, and her daughter attends kindergarten. She was first employed as a hair washer at Margad beauty salon in 2009 and worked there for one year. In 2010, she upgraded her skills and became a hairdresser and stylist at Iher Saran beauty salon. She is a diligent and hardworking woman who says, "With this loan, I want to buy supply materials for my work because the number of customers will increase when the new school year starts." She is requesting a 600,000 Mongolian tugriks (MNT) loan to purchase beauty supply materials for work.

loans.use: To purchase beauty supply materials.

loans.name: Archie

texts.en: Archie is 28 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is single. Archie  has a shop that sells snacks, detergents, and beverages. He has had this business for three years. He requested a loan of 15,000 PHP to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages. Archie has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Archie hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages

loans.name: Amihan

texts.en:
Amihan is 41 years old and married with four children, one of whom is in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

For the past twenty years Amihan has had a general store in the Philippines. She is requesting a 11,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy items such as soft drinks and groceries to sell there.

In the future, Amihan would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items such as soft drinks and groceries to sell in her general store.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Conception

texts.en:
Conception is requesting a loan amount of 15,000 PHP to buy a weighing scale, ice, and new Styrofoam that she needs for her business selling fish. With this, she hopes to earn a higher income so that she can send all of her children to school. Regardless of financial hardship, she is not giving up. She strives to provide for all the needs of her children.

She is 41 years old and married. She has three children. One of them stopped attending school due to financial difficulty. Her income from selling fish is not enough. She needs to increase her 6,000 PHP monthly income in order to sufficiently support her family. She is thankful to have a motorcycle that she uses to sell fish around her village and in nearby villages.

loans.use: to buy a weighing scale, ice, and new Styrofoam

loans.name: Hadbaatar

texts.en: Hadbaatar is 34 years old and lives with his wife and three children in a two-room apartment in Govisumber province of Mongolia. His two children attend the local high school.
