His wife helps to manage all the family's finances; she also works. Hadbaatar operates a car repair center. In 2000, he started to repair cars. He also runs the car call-repair services. He expanded his repair shop into a shop that performs both tire and car repair services. He is planning to open a shop that sells spare parts. He received several loans from XacBank. He is a diligent man who says "I want to have a shop in the town center where there are many clients and hopefully increase profits." He is requesting a 3,000,000 MNT loan to expand his business and open a car tire shop.

loans.use: To open a car tire shop

loans.name: Handmaa

texts.en: Handmaa is 41 years old and lives with her two children in an apartment in the Govisumber province of Mongolia. She used to work at the blanket factory in South Korea. She started her business by sending blankets to Mongolia from South Korea. She has successfully expanded her business since her arrival. Now she sells home products and goods at the Naran market. She is planning to increase the number and variety of products. This is her first time cooperating with the bank. She is requesting a loan of 2,500,000 Mongolian tugriks (MNT) to buy more goods and expand her business activity.

loans.use: To buy more goods.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan, 48 years old, has been engaged in farming for almost 25 years. She always wants to get high yields and earn a large income at every crop harvest. Susan runs the rice farming business with the help of her loving husband. She has four children attending high school or college.

Susan’s revenue from farming depends on the climate and the variety of seeds planted. She wants to get a better yield and be able to continue sending her children to school. Susan is requesting a loan of PHP 25,000 to buy hybrid seeds, fertilizers, herbicides and insecticides for farming. Susan believes that the loan will help her obtain her desires. She looks toward the improvement of her farming.

loans.use: to buy hybrid seeds, fertilizers, herbicides and insecticides

loans.name: Wilmer

texts.es: Wilmer tiene 34 años, casado con Erika de 34 años, juntos tiene 3 hijos y viven en su casa propia ubicada en el distrito de LLochegua. Wilmer desde muy niño tuvo que trabajar duro por ganarse la vida, ya que cuando tenia 11 años, incursionó en el negocio de venta de golosinas, y todas las tardes iba ofreciendo sus productos en la calle de su distrito expendiendo sus golosinas para  que pudiese solventar los gastos del colegio, ya que no contaba con el suficiente apoyo de sus padres. Pero cuando cursaba el cuarto año de secundaria, optó por formar su familia y dejar de estudiar y es donde ahora tenia que preocuparse aún más por sacar adelante a su familia. Desde entonces se dedica en la venta de abarrotes, que con un capital mínimo logró instalarlo. Este es su primer crédito con MFP, por lo que se compromete en pagar puntualmente sus cuotas. Con los 1500 soles que solicita, incrementará más mercadería, comprando más´productos de primera necesidad.
texts.en: Wilmer is 34 and married to Erika, age 34. Together they have 3 children and live in their own home in the Llochegua district. From a very young age, Wilmer has had to to work hard for his living. When he was 11, he started selling candies. Every afternoon he would offer his products in the streets of his district, selling candies so that he could cover his school fees, since he couldn't count on sufficient support from his parents. However, once he reached the fourth year of high school, he decided to start his family and left school. Now he has to worry even more about getting his family ahead. He now sells groceries, a business he was able to start up with a small amount of capital. This is his first loan from MFP, and he promises to pay his quotas punctually. With the 1500 soles that he is requesting, he will increase his merchandise, buying more basic staples.

loans.use: to purchase basic staples.

loans.name: Suubileg

texts.en: Suubileg, 28 years old, has been running a taxi service for 5 years. He lives with his 2 daughters and wife. His wife is a shop seller, his older daughter attends secondary school and his younger daughter has an impairment. The family lives in a ger, a nomadic tent, on a small piece of land near the mountain peak. It is a very difficult and dangerous place for them to live, especially in winter. Therefore, Suubileg is planning to replace his land with a better location near downtown so that his family can live in a safe environment. Suubileg plans to use this loan to help pay for the land.

loans.use: To help with his land payment

loans.name: Kerto Sato Group

texts.en:
Ni Ketut lives in Melaya, West Bali.  She is married and has one daughter who is already married. Her husband works as a carpenter. Ni Ketut often helps her husband. In addition, she raises pigs in her yard to supplement her family’s income. She has been raising pigs for eight years.  

Ni Ketut is the head of the Kerto Sato group, which is made up of 10 neighbors from the same village. This is the group’s second loan with MUK. With the Rp 1,500,000 that Ni Ketut receives, she will purchase one sow for pig breeding. She hopes that the sow will have many piglets, which she will then be able to raise and sell.  With her earnings, she plans to purchase more pigs. With the income from her pig raising, she hopes to be able to repair her kitchen.

loans.use: To purchase one sow

loans.name: Lilibeth

texts.en:
Lilibeth is married to a farmer. By operating her general store, she helps her husband earn income to provide for their family. Lilibeth would like to look for a white collar job to better the family's life but unfortunately she cannot because of her low level of education. 

Lilibeth is 38 years of age and blessed with four children, three of whom attend school. Lilibeth wants them to finish their studies through college. With the help of her business, if well-managed, Lilibeth knows that someday she could be able to give her children their needed support. 

Lilibeth is requesting a loan of PHP 8,000 to avoid bankruptcy by buying stocks of commodities such as canned goods and spices to sell in her store. She hopes that her close communal ties will not render her into bankruptcy. On the positive side, she said that it is a great opportunity to learn and understand more about the people around her who are not good customers in paying their accounts.

loans.use: to avoid bankruptcy by buying stock to sell in her store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase different kinds of meat such as chicken, pork and beef

loans.name: Elida

texts.es: Elida tiene 33 años, vive en compañía de su esposo y su hijo en su casa. con mucha constancia y perseverancia supo sacar adelante a su familia, con el emprendimiento de su pequeño negocio que lo tiene desde hace 5 años. En la actualidad su negocio tiene tendencia creciente que es una pequeña bodega en las cuales es la  proveedora de productos de primera necesidad de su zona, el buen trato amable las ofertas que promueve en su tienda es uno de los factores que hacen que su tienda sea una de las más concurridas y de mayor venta en su zona. Fruto de ese esfuerzo su tienda tiene  mercadería en constante renovación y siempre necesita para su negocio un crecimiento de capital de manera constante. Es su crédito número 11 en la cual esta trabajando con MFP  de manera grupal, en cada crédito que ha recibido siempre lo ha invertido en la mejora de su negocio  y hoy ve con orgullo un negocio consolidado. Por lo que seguirá invirtiendo el dinero en la compra de más productos de primera necesidad para abastecer su tienda.
texts.en: Elida is 33. She lives with her husband and child in their home. With great constancy and perseverance she was able to get her family ahead through her small business, which she has had for 5 years. Currently, her business is growing. It is a small grocery store which is the provider of basic staples to the people in the area. Her good, kind service is one of the factors that makes her store one of the most popular in the area, with some of the highest sales. The fruit of her constant hard work is that her stock is constantly turning over and she always needs an increase of capital to remain constant. This is her eleventh group loan with MFP. She has always invested every loan in improving her business, and today she looks upon her consolidated business with pride. She will keep investing this money in the purchase of more basic staples to stock her store.

loans.use: to purchase basic staples to stock her store.

loans.name: Manny

texts.en:
Manny, 31 years old, has been an industrious motorcycle operator in his community for five years. He is married and blessed with two children, one in grade school and a 2-year-old. Manny farms and provides motorcycle transport to earn a living. He attended college but did not finish because of financial problems. He got married at 25 years of age and bought a motorcycle to start a business to support his family.   

Manny is requesting a loan of PHP 10,000 to buy tires and paint for motorcycle maintenance. He will also use the capital for supplies to maintain his farming. Manny works very hard to provide for all of his family's needs with his simple sources of income. He earns PHP 4,000 each month from his motorcycle business; it is minimal but he manages to budget well to avoid food scarcity.
 
Manny says that he will work harder to fully support his children's educational needs so that they will not be like him in the future. He hopes to continue to work for the attainment of his goals.

loans.use: to buy tires and paint for motorcycle maintenance

loans.name: Francisca

texts.es: Francisca tiene 54 años, es viuda y vive con su madre en su casa propia. Se dedica a la venta D. prendas D. vestir, zapatos y lo que teje, actividad que lo hace durante 4 años. Su productos son ofrecidos a sus amistades, y al cabo D. un plazo pactado, realiza el cobro. Por otro lado ella siempre administra y pone orden en sus cuentas, para no olvidar quien le debe o no. Con el tiempo ha juntado un capital considerable para comprar más mercadería, y cumplir con la demanda D. sus clientes. Es la cuarta vez que esta solicitando un crédito con MFP, es una D. las integrantes D. su banco comunal que demuestra ser muy responsable en la devolución D. su préstamo, razón por la que se ha ganado el cariño y confianza D. sus demás compañeros. En la actualidad invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra D. más prendas D. vestir y zapatos.
texts.en: Francisca is 54. She is a widow and lives with her mother in her own home. She sells clothing, shoes, and items that she weaves. She has done this for four years. She gives her products to her friends, and at the end of an agreed upon period she charges them. She is always the one who manages and puts her accounts in order so as to never forget who owes her money. With time, she has amassed considerable capital to purchase more merchandise and cover her customers' demand. This is the fourth time that she has requested a loan from MFP. She is one of the members of her communal bank who has proven herself to be very responsible in repaying her loans. For this reason, she has gained the affection and confidence of her peers. She will invest the requested loan in the purchase of more clothing and shoes.

loans.use: to purchase clothing and shoes.

loans.name: Mildred

texts.en:
Mildred is 30 years old.  She is a high school graduate but has never experienced a college education due to poverty. Because of this, she entered into an early marriage. At 30, Mildred is now a mother of four, two of her children are currently studying, and she supports their daily school allowances with money raised through her hog farming business.  

She put up a hog raising business to have an income source for the family needs. Unfortunately her mother pig got sick and died. She worried about how to sustain the remaining piglets, so she is requesting the support of ASKI and KIVA to provide her with a loan amount of PHP 5,000 to buy feed for the piglets to grow and survive. She also wishes to build a bigger pen for her pigs to avoid any sickness.

Mildred is doing her best to someday provide for the complete education of all her children.

loans.use: buy pig feed

loans.name: Sek

texts.en:
Sek is married and has four children, three of whom are enrolled in school. Her fourth child is working as a potato farmer in their village where he earns little in income. Her husband frequently works in the fields alongside her.

Sek has spent her life cultivating crops. This is a skill she learned from her grandparents when she was young. She has had great success growing her crops. She is able to plant her fields at least twice a year in both the rainy and dry seasons. The coming rainfall will be good for her crops.

However, Sek doesn’t have the money yet to use on her farm, so she is looking for a loan of 600,000 KHR to use towards purchasing fertilizers, insecticides and seed for planting.

Sek is very grateful to all lenders who support her family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers, insecticides and seed for planting.

loans.name: Mahabbat's Group

texts.en:
Mahabbat is the leader of this group. She is 36 and is married to a farmer. Together with her husband, she brings up a daughter and a son. The daughter is starting school this year and the son is still of pre-school age (under seven). 

Mahabbat's family owns a pasture in the village.  They look after the cattle and receive money for that. Mahabbat also sells dairy products, from which she earns additional 1000 soms per month. 

With the money received from this loan, Mahabbat wants to purchase two sheep for breeding, fattening and further reselling. In the future, she plans to expand the family business and give her children a good education. 

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase 2 sheep

loans.name: Lolita Hipolita

texts.en:
Lolita has been managing her rice farming business for 30 years. She is 51 years old and has two school-age children. Lolita’s husband is a security guard in one of the institutions in the Philippines. She wants to uplift their family living.

Lolita is asking for a loan of PHP 25,000 to pay for the labor cost in farming. She will also use the loan to buy fertilizers and herbicides for farming. She hopes that she can earn higher income with each crop to further sustain her children's needs in school. She is doing her best to see that her children become professionals someday.

loans.use: buy fertilizers and herbicides and pay labor costs

loans.name: Hean

texts.en:
Mrs. Hean is 32 years old and a married woman who is the mother of five children. Two of her children are married and live in separate homes while the remaining three are single and still live under her income. One of her married children is working as a food seller in front of a hospital in Phnom Penh where she earns a little in income. 

Presently, Mrs. Hean and her husband has an experience in farming business for a long time ago, is earning a profit an average of $4.5USD each day to attain their family’s needs . Besides crop-planting business, the couple is able to earn more profit by fishing in the river and lake around their community. As some fishing of them are broken down, and they have some issue of financial factor. Mrs. Hean and her husband would like to request some fund from HKL and Kiva to purchase nets for their fishing activity. For the rest, they will use to buy some farming materials, for instance seeds and fertilizers for their crop growing well. 

In her prospect, Mrs. Hean hopes to use with additional income, she will be using to buy more farm fertile in order to enlarge her farming business.
Note: Mrs. Hean and her husband were taken in the photo with their young kids.

loans.use: to purchase nets for their fishing activity and also purchase some farming materials.

loans.name: Tegal Badeng Indah Group

texts.en:
Ni Ketut lives in Melaya, West Bali. She is married and has one child who is an adult and one son who is still in school. Her husband works as a farmer. Though Ni Ketut often helps her husband, she also raises pigs in her yard to supplement her family’s income. She has been raising pigs for 10 years.  

Ni Ketut is the head of the Tegal Badeng Indah group, which is made up of 10 neighbors from the same village. This is the group’s second loan with MUK.  With the Rp 1,500,000 that Ni Ketut receives, she will purchase two piglets and pig feed. She plans to sell the piglets after six months for use as pork. With her earnings, she plans to purchase more pigs. With the income from her pig raising, she hopes to be able to save.

loans.use: To purchase two piglets and pig feed

loans.name: Aida's Group

texts.en:
Aida is the leader of this group. She is 39 and is married to a farmer.  Together with her husband, she brings up a daughter and two sons. The older son studies at university and the other children are attending local school. In order to earn money to meet their daily needs, the family breeds livestock and then resells it at a higher price. In this way, they earn about 5000 soms per month. 

With the money received from this loan, Aida wants to purchase more livestock for breeding, fattening and further reselling. In the future, she wishes to purchase a piece of land in Bishkek to build a house.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: Thuon

texts.en: Mrs. Thuon, age 37, is married with three children who live as her dependents. All three of them are enrolled in school. Thuon has been spending her life cultivating crops. This is a skill she learned from her parents when she was young. To add to her income, her husband would like to purchase a horse to transport goods. So, Thuon and her husband wish to request some funds from Kiva's partner HKL to buy a horse. This is her fourth loan from HKL and her first time borrowing from Kiva. She says that this loan is very useful for her life and family.

loans.use: to buy a horse.

loans.name: Kenjabibi

texts.ru: Кенчабиби жительница города Турсунзаде. Ей 51 год. Она замужем. У нее трое детей. Кенчабиби занимается растениеводством. Она выращивает овощи и сеет пшеницу. Этим видом деятельности она занимается тринадцать лет. Кредит берет для закупа семян и минеральных удобрений.
texts.en: Kenjabibi lives in the town of Tursun-zoda. She is 51 years. She is married. She  has three children. Kenjabibi is a farmer. She grows vegetables and plants wheat. She has been doing this work for 13 years. She is taking out a loan in order to buy seeds and mineral fertilizers.

loans.use: to buy seeds and mineral fertilizers

loans.name: Sari Indah Group

texts.en:
Ni A. is 42 years old and lives in Melaya, West Bali. She is married and has two adult children, both married. Her husband works as a farmer.  Though Ni A. often helps her husband, she also raises pigs in her yard to supplement her family’s income. She has been raising pigs for 10 years.  

Ni A. is the head of the Sari Indah group, which is made up of 10 neighbors from the same village. This is the group’s second loan with MUK.  With the Rp 1,500,000 that Ni A. receives, she will purchase three piglets and pig feed.  She plans to sell the piglets after six months for use as pork.  With her earnings, she plans to purchase more pigs. With the income from her pig raising, she hopes to be able to improve her house.

loans.use: To purchase three piglets and pig feed

loans.name: Aldarmaa

texts.en:
Aldarmaa is a taxi driver.  She is 39 years old.   She lives with her husband and 4 children in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia.  She has requested a loan to help her son Zoljargal, 19,  to start his own wheel repair business. Zoljargal has been interested in auto mechanic since he was a child. 

Aldarmaa and her husband always promote the initiatives of their kids. Starting this new business is absolutely important and beneficial for this family's income. But there is a financial issue of purchasing the necessary service equipment.  Therefore, Aldarmaa is taking a loan to purchase the equipment for a wheel repair service business.

loans.use: buy equipment to start a wheel repair business

loans.name: Batmunkh

texts.en:
Batmunkh is 37 years old.  She is a seller of wallpaper.  She lives with her 3 children and husband in Darkhan, the second largest city in Mongolia. 

Batmunkh has been running her business since 2000 and owns a kiosk in a bazaar called Bolor-Talst.  One of her sons became severely ill almost a year ago, so he always stays at home. She and her husband both want to cure their son’s illness if they could have enough money for medication. Batmunkh has been planning to solve this problem through efforts to increase her business income.  

Batmunkh needs to raise her current business assets and output.  Therefore, she is planning to purchase a large amount of wallpaper from the building materials market to resell.

loans.use: buy wallpaper to resell

loans.name: Nodira

texts.ru: Нодира проживает в городе Турсунзаде. Ей 42 года. Она замужем. У нее четверо детей. Ее муж занимается животноводством. Сама Нодира занимается посевом зерновых культур и овощей для продажи. Этим видом деятельности она занимается 20 лет. Кредит берет для закупа минеральных удобрений.
texts.en: Nodira lives in the town of Tursun-zoda. She is 42 years old. She is married, with four children. Her husband raises farm animals. Nodira  grows grains and vegetables for sale. She has been doing this line of work for 20 years. She is taking out a loan to buy mineral fertilizers.

loans.use: to buy mineral fertilizers

loans.name: Davit

texts.ru:
Давит родился в 1966 г. в городе Каджаран. Жена Давита домохозяйка, сын учится в Капанском политехническом институте, а дочка в Каджаранской средней школе. Сам Давит работает на Зангезурском медно-молибденовом комбинате водителем. 
Параллельно с работой на комбинате, Давит занимается сельским хозяйством в селе Тандзавер. На своей ферме Давит разводит крупный рогатый скот, пчел, а также выращивает овощи и фрукты. Полученную сельхозпродукцию: овощи, фрукты, говядину,  молоко и мед Давит реализует в городах Капан и Каджаран. Давиту очень нравится работать на своей ферме и он получает большое удовольствие от того, что его семья получает натуральные продукты прямо со своей фермы. 
Кредит на сумму 1.000.000 драм необходим Давиту для покупки пяти быков, новых ульев, рамок для меда и сена на зиму, что позволит ему получать больше сельскохозяйственной продукции в будущем.
texts.en: Davit was born in 1966 in the city of Kadjaran.  His wife is a homemaker, son attends the Kapan polytechnical institute, and daughter goes to the Kadjaran secondary school.  Davit works as a driver at the Zangezursk copper-molybdenum factory.  Parallel to his factory work, Davit is involved in agriculture at the Tandzaver village.  Davit breeds cattle, bees, and also grows vegetables and fruits on his farm.  He sells his agricultural products, such as vegetables, fruits, beef, milk and honey, in the cities of Kapan and Kadjaran.  Davit likes to work on his farm very much and receives an enormous satisfaction from the fact that his family gets natural products straight from his farm.  Davit needs a loan in the sum of 1,000,000 dram in order to purchase five bulls, new beehives, frames for honey and hay for the winter, so that he would be able to gather more agricultural products in the future.

loans.use: to purchase five bulls, new beehives, frames for honey and hay for the winter

loans.name: Armie

texts.en:
Armie works hard to support her family. Armie is married and has business selling frozen foods in the Philippines.

Armie requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to buy more frozen foods to sell in her food stall.

Armie has been in this business for two years.

In the future, Armie would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more frozen foods to sell in her food stall

loans.name: Donna

texts.en:
Donna is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a business selling purified drinking water in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 25,000 through NWTF to purchase more stocks to sell for her purified drinking water business.

Donna has been in this business for six years. Donna earns more income from clothing sales.

Donna has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell

loans.name: Jerlyn

texts.en:
Jerlyn is 37 years old and married with two children.

Jerlyn works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari-sari store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell.

Jerlyn has borrowed and paid back three loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the sari-sari store for five years and earns additional income from fishing.

Jerlyn aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.en:
Lourdes is 53 years old and married with five children. Lourdes works very hard to provide for them.

Lourdes runs a variety store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell.

Lourdes has been in this business for 25 years and sells a variety of items such as snack food, soft drinks and other groceries. 

In the future, Lourdes would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell in her stall

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Abdusalim

texts.ru: Абдусалим проживает в городе Турсунзаде. Ему 54 года. Женат. Имеет 4 детей. Абдусалом занимается животноводством. Он разводит крупнорогатый скот для перепродажи. Этим видом деятельности занимается 20 лет. Кредит берет для закупа скота, чтобы увеличить их количество.
texts.en: Abdusalim lives in the city of Tursun-zoda.  He is 54 years old, married and has four children.  Abdusalim is involved in animal husbandry.  He breeds cattle for resale.  He has been involved in this type of business for twenty years.  He is requesting this loan for the purchase of livestock in order to increase its quantity.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: Roxanne

texts.en:
Roxanne is married with five children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Roxanne is 36 years old and has four children who are in school.

Roxanne has a business buying and selling home products in the Philippines. Roxanne requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more home products to sell.

Roxanne has been in this business for 10 years. Roxanne would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more home products to sell

loans.name: Divina

texts.en:
Divina is 47 years old and married with three children.

Divina works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari-sari store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy items like canned foods, groceries etc. to sell in her sari-sari store.

Divina has borrowed and paid back three loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the sari-sari store for 15 years and earns additional income from food vending.

Divina aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items like canned foods, groceries etc. to sell in her sari-sari store

loans.name: Luzviminda

texts.en:
Luzviminda is 40 years old.  She ended in grade four of the elementary school level. She is married and is blessed with three children. Her eldest is already married and lives separately from them. Her two younger children are her hope to lift their life from poverty.  She patiently provides them with what they need so they can complete their studies in college and find good jobs. 

Luzviminda  is requesting a loan amount of PHP 15,000 to buy three pigs and one container of feed for the maintenance of her pig business. She hopes that she can grow all her pigs to gain an income, something she has difficulty doing at the moment. She hopes that she can send her children to school until they finish college so that someday when they build their family, they would not experience what she is experiencing right now.

loans.use: buy pigs and pig feed

loans.name: Presiosa

texts.en:
Presiosa is 56 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is widowed and has 3 children. 

Presiosa has a shop that sells recycled materials like bottles & metallic materials. She has had this business for 2 years. She requested a loan for PHP 6,000 to buy additional recycled materials to sell.

Presiosa has been a member of HSPFI since 2009. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: buy recycled materials to resell

loans.name: Emily

texts.en:
Emily has been practicing farming in Ndunyu Njeru town for the last six years.  She is 38 years old, married to Samuel, and they have two school-going children.  

Emily was introduced to KADET by one of our field officers and this will be her first loan.  She plans to use this loan amount to buy seeds and fertilizer.  In the future, she hopes to become one of the leading farmers in the Ndunyu Njeru area

loans.use: buy seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Emily

texts.en:
Emily  is 42 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is a widow with 4 children. 

Emily  has a shop that sells clothing & beauty products from NATASHA & AVON. She has had this business for 13 years. She requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy clothing & beauty products to sell.

Emily  has been a member of HSPFI since 2009. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy clothing & beauty products for sell

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en: Margaret has practiced farming in Ndunyu Njeru for the last ten years. She is 31 years old, married to Paul and they have four school-going children. Margaret was introduced to KADET by one of our field officers and this will be her first loan, which she plans to use to buy seeds and fertilizer. In the future, Margaret hopes to become one of the leading farmers in the Ndunyu Njeru area.

loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Estrella

texts.en:
As a married mother of three children, Estrella works hard to support her family.

She has a shell craft making business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from the selling of personal products. Estrella is borrowing PHP 14,000 through Kiva partner NWTF in order to buy materials for her shell craft business.

Estrella has been sustaining her business activities through her past six loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy materials for her shell craft making business.

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
Evangeline works hard to support her family. Evangeline is unmarried and has a business selling ready-to-wear clothing in the Philippines.

Evangeline requested a PHP 25,000 loan through Kiva partner NWTF in order to purchase more items to sell.

Evangeline has been in this business for three years now, and also earns additional income from vegetable vending.

Evangeline would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more items to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Samwel

texts.en: Samwel has practiced farming in Ndunyu Njeru for the last six years. He is 32 years old, married to Tabitha and they have three school-going children. Samwel was introduced to KADET by one of our field officers and this will be his first loan, which he plans to use to buy potato seeds, fertilizer and spraying chemicals. In the future, he hopes to become one of the leading farmers in the Ndunyu Njeru area.

loans.use: To buy seeds, fertilizer and chemicals.

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en: Marilou is 48 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 2 children. Marilou has operated a shop selling fish such as sardines and mackerel for 4 years. She has requested a loan of PHP 4,000 to buy fish to sell. Marilou has been a member of HSPFI since 2009. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy fish to sell

loans.name: Elena

texts.en:
Elena is married with eight children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Elena is 45 years-old and has three children who are still in school.

Elena has an abaca making business in the Philippines. Elena requested a PHP 10,000 loan through Kiva partner NWTF in order to buy materials for her abaca making business.

Elena has been in this business for 15 years. Elena would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy materials for her abaca making business.

loans.name: Elda

texts.en:
Elda is 49 years-old and married with four children.

Elda works hard to provide for her family. She runs a buying and selling rice store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 15,000 loan through Kiva partner NWTF in order to buy more stocks of rice to sell.

Elda has borrowed and repaid five loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the buy and sell store for rice for three years and also earns an income from a sari-sari store.

Elda aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more rice stock to sell

loans.name: Jeffrey

texts.en: Jeffrey is 39 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is married and has 4 children. For the past two years, Jeffrey has operated a piggery selling grown and matured pigs. He has requested a loan of PHP 4,000 to buy pig feed. Jeffrey is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Jeffrey hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy pig feed

loans.name: Emilia

texts.en:
Emilia works hard to support her family. Emilia is married and has a business selling firewood in the Philippines.

Emilia requested a PHP 15,000 loan through Kiva partner NWTF in order to buy more firewood to sell to customers.

Emilia has been in this business for three years.

In the future, Emilia would like to save enough money so that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more firewood to sell to customers.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Beverly

texts.en:
Beverly, 36 years old, is a resident of Baseco, Manila, Philippines. She is married to Reynaldo, a stockman, and they have three children. Beverly and her husband manage their own household while operating the business. Beverly works hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Beverly operates a variety store which, in the Philippines, is basically a small convenience store which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, PHP 5 worth of cooking oil or an egg. Beverly earns an income by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her store is located adjacent to her house and her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 300 PHP in daily sales.

To help her continue operating her business, Beverly is requesting a PHP 20,000 loan, which she will use to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Beverly hopes to be able to expand soon, just as she dreams of being able to give her children a good and high quality education through all her hard work in her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members weekly to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Gina

texts.en: Gina is single and has an internet cafe business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for four years now and also earns additional income from a general store. Gina requested a 12,000 Philippine peso loan through NWTF to purchase an additional computer. Gina works hard to support her family. In the future, Gina would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase an additional computer

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn is 33 years old, married to a farmer and blessed with three school-aged children. Marilyn always looks after her family's quality of life. Her priority is to prepare for her children's college level of education. She knows that this is the level where most students fail to continue their studies because it is costly.

Marilyn and her husband manage their large crop of rice. Marilyn aims for a better yield per crop to gain more income. To get a better yield, Marilyn needs to improve her farming practices by using the proper farm inputs such as fertilizers, insecticides and herbicides.

Marilyn is requesting a loan of PHP 25,000 to buy fertilizers, insecticides and herbicides for rice farming. The loan would be a big help for her to start improving her farming practices to gain a higher income.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, insecticides and herbicides for rice farming.

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en: Myrna is 57 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 2 children. For the past 6 years, Myrna has operated a computer shop that provides encoding and photocopying. She has requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy materials needed for her shop. Myrna has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Myrna hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy materials needed for her shop

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen is 48 years old and married with three children. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 28,000 Philippine peso loan through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell. She has been running the general store for 25 years and also earns an income from food vending. Helen works hard to provide for her family. 

Helen has borrowed and repaid 12 loans from NWTF before this loan. She aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell

loans.name: Nenia

texts.en:
Nenia is 32 years old and married with 3 children. Two of her children are in school.  She is a very hard-working entrepreneur.  

Nenia has a fishing business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 23,000 loan through NWTF to purchase a new engine for her fishing boat.

Nenia has been in this business for 8 years. In the future, she would like to save money so that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase a new engine for her fishing boat.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Harun

texts.en: Harun has practiced farming in Ndunyu Njeru for the last nine years. He is 39 years old, married to Pauline and they have three school-going children. Harun was introduced to KADET by one of our field officers and this will be his second loan. He repaid his previous loan, which he used for planting potatoes, well and in good time. Harun plans to use this loan to buy seeds and fertilizer. In the future, he hopes to become one of the leading farmers in the Ndunyu Njeru area.

loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Maribel

texts.en:
Maribel is 40 years old and married with 4 children. Two of her children are in school.  She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. 

Maribel has a dried fish business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 40,000 loan through NWTF to buy more fish to sell.

Maribel has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell.

loans.name: Carolina

texts.en:
Carolina is 52 years old and married with 5 children. She has 1 child in school, and she works very hard to provide for her children.

Carolina runs a grocery store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, soap, groceries, etc., in her grocery store.

She has been in this business for 3 years and sells a variety of items such as milk, noodles, canned goods, etc. 

In the future, Carolina would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy items to sell in her grocery store.

loans.name: Dolores

texts.en: Dolores is 61 years old and married with four children. She runs a sari sari store in the Philippines and requested a 20,000 Philippine peso loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock to sell in her sari-sari store. Dolores has been in this business for 10 years and sells a variety of items such as candies, biscuits, spices, sugar, etc. Dolores works very hard to provide for her family. In the future, Dolores would like to build and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock to sell in her sari-sari store

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow and dairy feed

loans.name: Pacita

texts.en: Pacita is 38 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has 4 children. For the past 5 years, Pacita has operated a retail shop selling clothing and beauty products from Natasha, Avon and Fullerlife. She has requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy clothing and beauty products to sell. Pacita is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy clothing and beauty products to sell

loans.name: Imelda

texts.en:
This is Imelda, 42. She is a resident of Baseco, Manila, Philippines. She is married to Rodelito, a welder, and a mother to their four children. She, together with her husband, manages their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Imelda operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store that retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a 5-pesos worth of cooking oil or an egg. She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her store is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 450 Philippine Pesos (Php) in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php 33,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Imelda hopes to be able to expand soon, just as she dreams to be able to give her children a good and high quality education through all her hard work in her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: purchase flour, margarine, sugar and rice

loans.name: Saturnino

texts.en:
Saturnino is 57 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is married and has 4 children. 

Saturnino provides motorela or habal-habal services. He has had this business for 5 years. He requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to pay for the gasoline spent for the service.

Saturnino is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, he hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: buy gas for his transport service

loans.name: Nicholus

texts.en:
Nicholus is 35 years old.  He is married and blessed with two children, both under the age of eighteen years.  He earns his living from selling household items such as plastic basins, plastic bowls, cups, utensils, etc.  His business has been operational for the past thirteen years.

Nicholus gets a monthly income of about KES 60,000 from his business, which he uses to sustain his family as well as run the business.  He has been loaned KES 50,000.  He plans to use the loan to purchase additional stock for his business such as tea kettles, plastic cups, eating plates, serving trays, etc. 

With the anticipated profit he would get from the business, he will use it to continue looking after his family, educate his children, and try to save some of it for future investments.

loans.use: buy household products to resell

loans.name: Sonia

texts.en:
Sonia is 48 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has 2 children. 

Sonia has a food shop that sells viands like chicken adobo & pancit bihon.  She has had this business for 10 years. She requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy raw ingredients needed for her food shop.

Sonia is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: buy raw ingredients for food shop

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is a 40-year-old married lady with four children. She operates a tailoring business in Watamu town in Malindi. She has been in this business for the past five years and earns a monthly income of KES 15,000, which she uses to take care of her family. 

Elizabeth has been loaned KES 60,000 by Kadet Limited.  This is her third loan. She intends to use the loan to buy more dress materials, since this is the season for weddings in the area. 

Elizabeth wishes to utilize the anticipated profit to continue sustaining her business and help look after her family. In the future, she hopes to own her own tailoring school and a well-stocked boutique.

loans.use: buy dress materials

loans.name: Charles

texts.en:
Charles is 37 years old. He is married and has one child, aged three, whom he and his wife hope to educate to the university level. 

Charles sells clothes to the local people. His business is located in a residential area known as Kiembeni in Mombasa. He has been running this business for five years now. He says that the business is profitable and the major challenge he has is that there are other people in the area doing the same kind of business, so customers are not loyal as they have many choices. He however works hard from early morning to late evening to ensure his business is doing well. 

Charles is using his loan of KES 20,000 to buy more clothes to grow his business to wholesale and meet the demands of his customers. He hopes to open another clothes sales business in the future. He describes himself as hardworking.

loans.use: buy clothes to resell

loans.name: Saro

texts.en:
Saro is a 37-year-old married father of three children.  He is a motorcycle transport operator in Mariakani. His business has been in operation for one year. This is his first loan from KADET to finance his business.

With this loan amount, Saro plans to expand his business by purchasing another motorcycle.  The anticipated profits will be used to repay the loan and to gradually expand his business. His dream is to become a successful businessman.

loans.use: buy a motorcycle

loans.name: Ronnie

texts.en:
Ronnie is 31 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is single. 

Ronnie makes and sells snacks like rice & cassava cakes. He has had this business for 3 years. He requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy additional raw ingredients for making snacks.

Ronnie is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, he hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: buy ingredients to make snacks for sale

loans.name: Leonard

texts.en:
Leonard is 24 years old.  He is married and is a father of one child. He is a farmer and has been doing this for the last three years. 

Leonard learned about KADET through a marketing campaign done by KADET staff in his area. This will be his second loan, which he is planning to use to buy farm supplies like seeds and fertilizer. He hopes to use the anticipated profit  to build a new house and educate his children.   His hope and dream is to buy land and build rental houses.

loans.use: buy seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Roan

texts.en:
Roan is 19 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has 1 child. 

Roan has a food shop that sells roasted pig per kilogram. She has had this business for 1 year. She requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy live pigs to roast and sell.

Roan is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: buy pigs to roast and sell

loans.name: Quennie

texts.en:
Quennie  is 20 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is single and has 1 child. 

Quennie makes and sells snacks like rice & pan cakes. She has had this business for 1 year. She requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy raw ingredients for making snacks.

Quennie  is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: buy raw ingredients for making snacks

loans.name: Mary Cris

texts.en:
Mary Cris is 22 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has 2 children. 

Mary Cris has a retail shop that sells vegetables like squash, cabbages & eggplants. She has had this business for 2 years. She requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy vegetables to sell.

Mary Cris is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: buy vegetables to sell

loans.name: Kerta Jaya Amerta Group

texts.en:
Kerta Jaya Amerta group received a third loan from MUK with a total loan of Rp 15,000,000. Each member receives Rp 1,500,000. Ni Nengah used the loan to buy three superior species of pigs at a price per piglet of Rp 300,000 and pig feed. In the next six months, she hopes her pigs will be sold at a price of Rp 1,000,000 per pig. For that, she will give her pig nutritious meals every day. 

Ni Nengah hopes this effort will go forward and she'll have a lot of pigs. She has a dream of using all the profits to buy a motorbike for her son.

loans.use: To buy three pigs of a superior species and pig feed

loans.name: Mirvat

texts.en:
Mirvat is a 33-year-old married woman.  She has been working as a beauty therapist for 8 years. Mirvat is a hard worker and a loyA. wife, she works hard to help her husband with their living in order to provide their child with the best life.

Mirvat is well-known in the region.  She is recommended by most of her customers because of her good customer service and talent.  Mirvat is requesting a loan from A. Majmoua-Kiva partner for the fifth cycle, in order to buy new beauty cosmetics necessary for her business. 

Mirvat is trying to buy a new bedroom for her child.  She  hopes to provide her child with the best education and with good health.  She hopes to expand her business more and more through adding new and different services for her customers.

loans.use: buy cosmetics for her salon

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en: Joyce is thirty-eight years old and has one child, aged nine, whom she hopes to educate to the university level.  She operates a clothing sales business at Mtamboni in Mombasa. She says that though the business is profitable, there are challenges in competition. She is using her loan of KES 70,000 to buy more clothes to grow her business and meet the demands of her customers. In the future, she hopes to grow her business to wholesale. She describes herself as honest and accountable.

loans.use: buy clothes to resell

loans.name: Andresa

texts.en:
Andresa is 45 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has 3 children. 

Andresa has a retail shop that sells canned goods, snacks, beverages & noodles. She has had this business for 10 years. She requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy more canned goods, snacks & beverages to sell.

Andresa is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: buy canned goods, snacks & beverages

loans.name: Sephora Group

texts.fr: La cliente Kibibi, leader du groupe d’affaire « Sephora », est entrepreneur, âgée de 26 ans, mère de 3 jeunes enfants. Elle est  vendeuse de carburant (petite pétrolière). Son mari est aussi petit pétrolier). Elle s’entraide avec son mari dans les affaires. Elle installe ses marchandises au long de la route, à l’entrée du quartier TMK. Il y a 5 ans révolus qu’elle exerce ces petites activités génératrices de revenus de ce genre. Cependant, elle vient de réaliser  3  cycles avec le crédit de Hekima. Ce nouveau crédit doit lui servir  de s’approvisionner avec  10 bidons de pétroles (d’essences kérosène, Mazout) à marchander. En plus, elle souhaite  voir ses enfants grandir confortablement  et  construire une maison.  La cliente remercie Hekima pour  ses actions en faveur de pauvres femmes exclues de banque classique. Il sied de signaler que le groupe d’affaire « Sephora » est majoritairement féminins.
texts.en: The client, Kibibi, is the leader of the Sephora business group. Kibibi is a 26-year old entrepreneur and the mother of 3 young children. She and her husband are both small retailers and work together selling fuel. She sells her merchandise on the roadside by the entrance to the TMK district. Kibibi has been a small retailer for 5 years. She has already successfully completed 3 loan cycles with Hekima. This new loan would allow her to buy 10 cans of fuel (kerosene, fuel oil) for resale. Kibibi would also like to build a comfortable home for her children to grow up in. The Sephora Group is mainly comprised of women, and Kibibi would like to thank Hekima for helping underprivileged women excluded from regular bank lending channels.

loans.use: to buy 10 cans of fuel (kerosene, fuel oil)

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en:
Catherine is 34 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has 3 children. 

Catherine has a retail shop that sells canned goods, snacks & beverages.  She has had this business for 5 years. She requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy additional canned goods, snacks & beverages to sell.

Catherine is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: buy canned goods, snacks & beverages to sell

loans.name: Taciana

texts.en:
Taciana is 47 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has 4 children. 

Taciana has a retail shop that sells fish like sardines, mackerel & salmon. She has had this business for 3 years. She requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy fish to sell.

Taciana is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy fish to sell

loans.name: Ban

texts.en:
Ban (in the photo) and his wife are vegetable farmers.  He also works for a brick kiln when he is not at the farm.  Ban and his wife live along National Road Number Six, about twenty-five kilometers from Phnom Penh City. They have been married since 2001 and have two young children -- one son and one daughter.  

Ban is asking for a loan of $1,200 to buy a cow to raise and a boat and fishing nets for his brother who is a fisherman.

loans.use: To buy a cow and fishing boat and nets

loans.name: Alma

texts.en:
Alma is 39 years old and lives in Delapaz, Liloy, Zamboanga del Norte. She is married and has 2 children.

Alma works in the fish industry and sells fish for a living. She had been doing this for 3 years. She has requested a loan for PHP 4000 to purchase 1 box of fish to sell.

Alma has been a member of PMPC since this year, 2011. In the future, she hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: buy fish to resell

location.town: Dela Paz, Liloy, Zamboanga del Norte

loans.name: Zilola

texts.ru: Зилола жительница города Турсунзаде. Ей 34 года. Она замужем. Ее муж занимается торговлей на рынке. Он в основном продает мужскую одежду. Сама Зилола занимается посевом злаковых культур. Этим видом деятельности она занимается уже шесть лет. Кредит берет для покупки минеральных удобрений, чтобы получить хороший урожай.
texts.en: Zilola lives in the city of Tursun-zoda.  She is 34 years old, married.  Her husband is involved in sales at a market.  He primarily sells men's clothing.  Zilola is involved in sowing cereal crops.  She has been in this business for six years.  She is requesting this loan for the purchase of mineral fertilizers in order to get a good harvest.

loans.use: to purchase mineral fertilizers

loans.name: Sergia

texts.en:
Sergia is 56 years old, married and has one adult child. She is from Aurora, Zamboanga del Sur, Philippines. 

Sergia runs a retail store at her place to earn a living, though this is not her primary source of income. The store operation started a year ago and Sergia gets a total of PHP 4,000 a month from it.

This year (2011), Sergia joined GDMPC to access financial services. She applied for a loan of PHP 5,000 to purchase additional products to sell. These includes daily use commodities, school and office supplies, etc. With this loan drawn out from the cooperative, Sergia hopes to expand the business and allocate enough revolving funds to sustain business operations.

loans.use: purchase products to sell

loans.name: Apolonia

texts.en:
Apolonia is 57 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is a widow with 1 child. 

Apolonia has a retail shop that sells clothing, beauty products & plasticwares from TUPPERWARE & AVON. She has had this business for 5 years. She requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy clothing, plasticware & beauty products to sell.  

Apolonia is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: buy clothing, plasticware & beauty products

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria is from Aurora, Zamboanga del Sur, Philippines. She is 40 years old, married, and has 7 dependents. Her husband is a fisherman. To make a living, she is engaged in manufacturing lampkanay products.  Lampkanay is a firm aquatic herb that is used to make mats, ropes, baskets and other braided furniture. Her business has existed for over 6 years until the present time and she now earns a total of PHP 5,000 a month.

Maria aims to access financial services, which she has realized since 2010 with Gata Daku MPC.  She applied for a loan of PHP 7,000 to obtain adequate raw materials for weaving.   This is her 2nd loan borrowed from the cooperative.   She hopes to produce the best output from this investment and earn more income for her family. Maria is looking forward to expanding her business and developing attractive and durable products to offer.

loans.use: buy raw materials for weaving

loans.name: Sreivoeun

texts.en:
Sreivoeun is 31 year old and her husband, Sophy, is 32 years old.  They live in a village along National Road Number One, about twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh City. They have been married for two years and have two sons -- one is in school and the other one is still too young.

Sreivoeun is a garment worker. Her husband is a driver for a company. The couple is in the process of building a new house to live in, but it is not finish yet. Hence Sreivoeun decided to ask for a loan to make the finishes.

loans.use: finish building her house

loans.name: Aljon

texts.en:
Aljon is a 19-year-old man living in Aurora, Zamboanga del Sur, Philippines. He is a single man who runs a transport business for a living. He has been driving his two-wheeled vehicle to transport passengers to and from designated destinations.   Aljon gets PHP 3,000 a month from services offered.  In his single status, he enjoys meeting many girls or individuals and befriending them sometimes.   

Earlier this year, Ajon joined Gata Daku MPC to access financial services. He is requesting a loan of PHP 5,000 to repair the tires for his motor vehicle and to buy other accessories. Maintaining the vehicle in good running condition will help him pursue and cover his daily needs. 

Aljon plans to further improve the appearance of his vehicle to attract more passengers to ride on it and expand sitting capacity to earn more income.

loans.use: repair his motorbike and buy accessories

loans.name: C9284 Urunana Group

texts.en:
Charles is 48 years old.  He is married and has three children aged between 5 and 10 years old.   Charles is the president of this group, which is called "URUNANA" in the local language.  His business is well-organized and is well-known in the business of selling bananas. His business hours are from 7 am until 5 pm every day. He has three years of experience and currently employs one person to help him. 

Charles and his group have requested a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company in order to increase their businesses by buying more bananas for sale. With any profits, Charles and his team will reinvest in their businesses and save for their future.

loans.use: To purchase more bananas for sale

loans.name: Than

texts.en:
Than and his wife are rice farmers. In addition, he is also a fisherman. They live along National Road Number One, about 35 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. They have seven children. Unfortunately, one of their children had died.  

Than had asked for a Kiva loan once before. He now asks for another loan in the amount of $1,200 to purchase a motorbike for his son to ride to work. 

In the photo, Than and his wife are at home, not at the farm.

loans.use: buy a motorbike for his son

loans.name: Tavarali

texts.ru: Таварали проживает в городе Куляб. Возраст, 50 лет. Женат. У него четверо детей. Его жена домохозяйка. Сам он зарабатывает путем разведения крупнорогатого скота. Таварали откармливает и продает скот. Этим видом деятельности он занимается шесть лет. Кредит берет для закупа несколько голов бычков.
texts.en: Tavarali lives in the city of Kulob.  He is 50 years old, married and has four children.  His wife is a homemaker.  Tavarali earns his living by breeding cattle.  He fattens up and sells livestock, and has been involved in this type of business for six years.  He is requesting this loan for the purchase of several calves.

loans.use: to purchase several calves

loans.name: Ronald

texts.en:
Ronald is 27 years old and single. He is from Aurora, Zamboanga del Sur, Philippines, where his white corn production is located. He was just 17 years old when he started cultivating this land. That was quite long enough but he never ceases because his passion for doing so urges him to go on working. At the end of the month, Ronald gets PHP 3,000, which he equally divides for his family.  

Ronald joined GDMPC to access financial services offered by the cooperative. He has borrowed PHP 5,000 to pay for land preparation cost to begin the next cycle of business operation. He hopes to plant sooner so as not to waste time. Ronald plans to apply appropriate fertilizers and expand his business array.

loans.use: pay for land preparation

loans.name: Judith

texts.en:
Judith is a 27-year-old single mom of an only child. She is living in Aurora, Zamboanga del Sur, Philippines, where her wide array of corn production is located. She has been cultivating this land since she was 23 years of age until the present time. She doesn't mind the scratches and itches brought by this kind of plant, for as long as she can earn income, Judith goes for it. She normally receives PHP 3,000 a month.

Earlier this year, Judith joined GDMPC.   She is requesting a loan of PHP 5,000 to purchase fertilizers such as manure to increase production. When the crop gets realized, the revenue from which will be allotted to expanding the business area to earn more income and to sustain her daily needs.

loans.use: buy fertilizers

loans.name: Phalla

texts.en:
Phalla (pictured here) is 36 years old and her husband, San, is 50 years old. They live about 10 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. They have one son and three daughters. One is a cashier, two are in school and another one is still young.  

Phalla has full-time employment, while her husband is a motor taxi driver. He hopes to change his business from motor taxi to Tuk Tuk, because it can carry more goods and people than a motor taxi. 

Hence, Phalla decided to ask for a loan of $1,000 to buy a Tuk Tuk for her husband.

loans.use: To buy a Tuk Tuk for her husband.

loans.name: Rolyn

texts.en:
Rolyn is a 22-year-old woman, living together with her partner and two little kids in Aurora, Zamboanga del Sur, Philippines. They are both working on a cultivated area for their corn production to earn a living. Sometimes they take on irregular income sources for additional cash flow. For three years of digging and weeding and planting the area, the family normally receives PHP 3,000 a month.

In order to boost production, Rolyn joined GDMPC to access their financial services. She is applying for a loan of PHP 5,000 from the organization to pay land preparation costs to start a new business operation. Rolyn is planning to buy suitable fertilizers for the plants to grow even more and boost productivity.

loans.use: To pay land preparation costs.

loans.name: Luciana

texts.en:
Luciana is a widow who is 56 years old. She has three adult-aged children. The family is living in Aurora, Zamboanga del Sur, Philippines. She has spent the last four years cultivating the land to make a living. Luciana prefers to plant and/or grow corn because it is the sort of thing she used to do when she was young. At the end of every month, she normally receives PHP 3,000, properly apportioned towards daily needs.

Luciana is a GDMPC member who joined in 2007. She was able to pay back all previous loans taken from the cooperative. Earlier this year, she requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to acquire fertilizers to boost production. Plants applied with adequate growing inputs lead to good productivity. Luciana is hopeful this will happen. She plans to buy tools needed to facilitate good productivity and expand her business area to gain more income for the family.

loans.use: To acquire fertilizers to boost production.

loans.name: Sim

texts.en: Sim (in the photo), 27, is a garment worker. Her husband, 33, is a construction worker. They have two sons. One son is in school and another one is still young. The family is living in a village 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. Sim is applying for a loan of US $1,000 to repair the house where she lives.

loans.use: To repair the house where she lives.

loans.name: Nescil

texts.en:
Nescil is 23 years old, single and has one infant child to care for. She lives in Aurora, Zamboanga del Sur, Philippines. She is running a small piggery at home to make a living. This started five years ago and continues until the present time. She usually raises a cross-breed type of pig and sells them when they have grown enough. While not the only source of income, Nescil gets PHP 10,910 a month. 

Earlier this year, Nescil joined GDMPC. She is requesting a loan of PHP 10,000 to purchase additional piglets to raise and feeding supplies for a good build-up. Firmly bodied animals catch the attention and could be a good sign of increased sales. Nescil hopes to sell them all at a high price and obtain more piglets to raise in the future to improve the general living conditions of the family.

loans.use: To purchase additional piglets and feeding supplies.

loans.name: Akparchon

texts.ru:
Акпарчон женат и любящий отец 2 детей. Он честный и добрый человек. Акпарчон мечтает устроить своих детей в лучшую школу и поэтому усердно работает. Акпарчон занимается купля продажей продуктов питания. Он имеет свой магазин в центре города на населенном пункте. Он продает конфеты, печенье, соки, напитки и т.д. Акпарчон всегда старается, удовлетворят потребности своих клиентов. Он хочет расширить свой бизнес и добавить новых ассортиментов продуктов питания. Акпарчон запрашивает займ на сумму 2000$ США для покупки нового ассортимента продуктов питания. Он заранее благодарит вас всех за вашу помощь и милосердие. 
     
More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj
texts.en: Akparchon is married and is a loving father of two children.  He is an honest and kind person.  Akparchon dreams of placing his children into the best school and works diligently for that.  He is involved in buying and selling food products.  He owns a store in a well-populated location of the city center.  He sells candies, cookies, juices, drinks, etc.  Akparchon always tries to satisfy the demands of his customers.  He wants to expand his business and add a new assortment of food products.  Akparchon is requesting a loan in the sum of $2000 for the purchase of a new assortment of food products.  He thanks all of you in advance for your help and mercy.

loans.use: to purchase a new assortment of products

loans.name: Lourme

texts.en:
Lourme is 34 years old and married with one school-aged dependent. She is a resident of Aurora, Zamboanga del Sur, Philippines. She owns an automobile and rents it to earn a living. Many people have come and rented the car, especially during special occasions and ordinary days like weddings, travel, joyrides for barkadas (groups of friends), etc. Lourme gets a total of PHP 3,350 a month.

To access financial services, Lourme joined GDMPC. She then applied for a loan of PHP 20,000 from the cooperative to fix defective auto parts for better service and business deals. Lourme hopes that this will be done soon to accommodate her customer's demands. She will allocate part of her earnings for maintenance and is planning to improve the service appearance to encourage more customers.

loans.use: To fix defective auto parts for better service.

loans.name: Tinara

texts.ru:
Тинаре 44 года, замужем и имеет семеро детей, младшей из которых 8 лет.  Тинара начала свой бизнес в разведении скота со стартовой суммой в 10,000 сом (KGS) и на сегодняшний день ее хозяйство приносит прибыль около 6,000 сом (KGS) в месяц от продажи молочных продуктов.  Также Тинара занимается рукоделием и славится своими прекрасными изделиями , которые сельчанки покупают для приданого своим дочерям.  Для дальнейшего расширения своего бизнеса в животноводстве, Тинара обратилась в компанию «Бай Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) для покупки дойной коровы.  Доходы от кредита она планирует вложить в постройку забора для своего дома.   
ЗАО МФК "Бай-Тушум и Партнеры" предоставляет кредиты по линии Кива для социально-уязвимых слоев населения. ЗАО МФК "Бай-Тушум и Партнеры" является одной из лидирующих Микрофинансовых организаций Кыргызстана. "Бай-Тушум и Партнеры" – это надежный финансовый партнер, осуществляющий вклад в развитие экономики Кыргызской Республики путем предоставления доступных микрофинансовых услуг в сельской местности и городах, способствующих созданию рабочих мест и отвечающий интересам своих клиентов и инвесторов.
texts.en: Tinara is 44 years old, married and has seven children, the youngest of whom is eight years old.  Tinara started her business of livestock breeding with a sum of 10,000 som (KGS), and currently her business brings in a profit of 6,000 som (KGS) per month from the sales of milk products.  She is also involved in needlework and is famous for her beautiful work that the neighbors buy for their daughters' dowry.  In order to further expand her animal husbandry business, Tinara went to the "Bai Tushum and Partners" company to request a loan in the sum of 100,000 som (KGS) for the purchase of a dairy cow.  She plans to invest the income from the loan into the construction of a fence for her house.

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow

loans.name: Pablina

texts.en:
Pablina is from Aurora, Zamboanga del Sur, Philippines. She is married and has two grown children. She weaves various products out of lampakanay plant, an aquatic herb used in making mats, ropes, baskets, etc. Her husband is working too but is impermanent and this activity primarily helps them to cover everyday needs. She is able to earn an approximate totals of PHP 2,500 a month.

In 2010, Pablina became a GDMPC member. For the second time around, she is applying for a loan of PHP 5,000 to acquire raw materials for weaving. She has orders to work on and be delivered at the agreed time. She hopes to finish them earlier and develop new product designs to distribute in the marketplace or in point of sale areas. Pablina plans to obtain enough of this resource and expand business operations to gain more income for the household.

loans.use: To acquire raw materials for weaving.

loans.name: Phin

texts.en:
Phin is a motor taxi driver and his wife sells sugar cane juice. They live on an island in the Mekong River about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. They have three children: two sons and one daughter. Two have full-time employment and one is in school. 

Phin is asking for a loan of $1,000 to purchase a motorbike for his children to drive to work.

Photo: Phin is standing next to the motorbike that he wants to buy. He can buy it from his neighbor but he did not pay for it yet. So, he asked for the loan to pay for the purchase.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike for his children to drive to work.

loans.name: Angeles

texts.en:
Angeles is from Aurora, Zamboanga del Sur, Philippines. She is a widow and has four dependents who sometimes help her with vending barbecue. Selling this kind of food for over three years is very satisfying. She sells naturally delicious foods such as hot dogs, meats, banana cues (a dessert), camote cue, etc. People of all ages can buy and eat it. She earns 7,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) a month from this work.

Angeles currently joined GDMPC. She is requesting a loan of PHP 5,000 from the cooperative to purchase food supplies for her barbecue vending activity. She aims to increase daily sales, which she thinks may be made possible by this loan. Angeles expects to sell more and manage revolving capital properly to avoid scarcity of resources. She plans to expand the business in the near future and have all her children finish their studies.

loans.use: To purchase food supplies for her barbecue vending activity.

loans.name: Rosie

texts.en:
Rosie is a 23-year-old single mom of an infant. She is living in Aurora, Zamboanga del Sur, Philippines. She has been sewing for four years and continues to do so today. Dresses are designed according to the customer's desired style, or sometimes she creates out of her own will and imagination. Every month, she receives 5,000 Philippines pesos (PHP), which is fair enough to cover day-to-day expenses.

Rosie joined Gata Daku MPC earlier this year. She applied for a loan of PHP 5,000 from the cooperative to buy sewing materials such as textiles, threads, etc. By having all necessary materials, Rosie hopes to create as much output as she can to have more income. She is planning also to expand in her business area and/or buy another set of sewing machines.

loans.use: To buy sewing materials such as textiles, threads, etc.

loans.name: Sopheap

texts.en:
Sopheap (in the photo) is 58 years old. Her husband, Brach, is 60 years old. They live on an island in the Mekong River about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. They been married since 1980 and have two daughters. 

Sopheap is a weaver, while her husband is a farmer. She is asking for a loan of $200 to help with her husband’s farming business by buying seeds, fertilizer and pesticide to maintain his farm.

loans.use: To help with her husband’s farming business by buying seeds, fertilizer and pesticide to maintain his farm.

loans.name: Analyn

texts.en:
