Analyn is 20 years of age. She is single and is rearing her two little kids. She is from Aurora, Zamboanga del Sur, Philippines. Two years ago, she engaged in a retail business venture to make a living. The store caters to the local market's demands for everyday living. She earns 4,500 Philippines pesos (PHP) a month from business operations.

Earlier this year, Analyn joined GDMPC to momentarily finance her business. She borrowed PHP 5,000 from the cooperative to purchase daily-use commodities to sell in local community. She hopes that by offering more products to choose from, she can get a good return of investment and thereby expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase daily-use commodities to sell.

loans.name: Roche Channel

texts.en:
Roche Channel is 41 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with three children. 

Roche Channel has a retail shop that sells canned goods, snacks and beverages. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan for 5,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

Roche Channel is a new member of HSPFI. In the future, Roche Channel hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: David

texts.en: David is a hardworking 50-year-old businessman. He is married and blessed with five children. Four of the children are in school. For the last five years, he has been engaged in the transport business to make a living. He supplements income from this venture with the earnings he makes from dairy farming. He wants in the next five years to own a 'matatu' (a bus). His dream is to be financially stable. He is requesting a loan of 80,000 Kenya shillings to buy a tuk tuk (a rickshaw). Thanks to Faulu Kenya, he is now able to improve his standard of living.

loans.use: to buy a tuk tuk (rickshaw)

loans.name: Miguela

texts.en:
Miguela is 45 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with three children. 

Miguela has a retail shop that sells fish like sardines & mackerel. She has had this business for six years. She requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy canned goods, detergents & snacks.

Miguela is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Miguela hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, detergents & snacks

loans.name: Teofila

texts.en:
Teofila is 26 years old. She is married with two school-aged children. The family is living in Aurora, Zamboanga del Sur, Philippines. She is buying and selling RTW (ready to wear clothing) in her locality and adjacent places to earn a living. She has been working on this for over three years. While not the sole source of income, she gets PHP 5,600 a month from all her income sources.

Earlier this year, Teofila joined GDMPC. She initially applied for a loan of PHP 5,000 to obtain more RTW to sell. She hopes that borrowing this loan is a way to lift her sales rate. The revenue to be generated from this loan will be invested to expand the scope of her business and to improve her living status.

loans.use: To obtain more RTW (ready to wear clothing) to sell

loans.name: Ellen

texts.en:
Ellen is 23 years old and married. She is taking care of an infant child and is a resident of Aurora, Zamboanga del Sur, Philippines. Her husband is earning an income for the family but she is engaged in other means to improve their living conditions. She owns a motorcycle transport business. The  vehicle is capable of carrying 2-4 passengers. By the end of the month, a total of PHP 10,000 is generated - quite sufficient for a small family such as hers.

This current year, Ellen joined GDMPC to access financial services. She is applying for a loan of PHP 5,000 to purchase motorcycle accessories to improve the quality of her service. When this all is done, Ellen is expecting to gain more income. She plans to expand and improve her business range.

loans.use: To purchase motorcycle accessories

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a motorcycle

loans.name: Rahimakhon

texts.ru:
Рахимахон 46 лет, замужем и имеет четверых детей, двое их которых – школьники.  Начав свой бизнес  в сельском хозяйстве  более 10 лет назад практически с нуля,  Рахимахон добилась хороших результатов. На сегодняшний день в ее хозяйстве восемь голов овец и возделанная земля с картошкой, кукурузой и подсолнечником.  Ежемесячный доход от продажи такой продукции составляет в среднем 6,000 сом (KGS), что является хорошей поддержкой для семьи, где муж получает только пенсию по инвалидности. 
Рахимахон обратилась в компанию «Бай Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом  сумме 80,000 сом для покупки скота.  Доходы от деятельности она планирует вложить в расширение и реконструкцию сарая для животных. 
ЗАО МФК "Бай-Тушум и Партнеры" предоставляет кредиты по линии Кива для социально-уязвимых слоев населения. ЗАО МФК "Бай-Тушум и Партнеры" является одной из лидирующих Микрофинансовых организаций Кыргызстана. "Бай-Тушум и Партнеры" – это надежный финансовый партнер, осуществляющий вклад в развитие экономики Кыргызской Республики путем предоставления доступных микрофинансовых услуг в сельской местности и городах, способствующих созданию рабочих мест и отвечающий интересам своих клиентов и инвесторов.
texts.en: Rahimakhon is 46 years old, married and has four children, two of whom are school students.  Having started her agricultural business over ten years ago with practically nothing, Rahimakhon achieved good results.  Today, she has eight heads of sheep and cultivated land with potatoes, corn and sunflowers in her household.  Her monthly income from the sale of these products amounts to an average of 6,000 som (KGS), which provides a good support for the family, where the husband receives only a disability pension.  Rahimakhon went to the "Bai Tushum and Partners" to obtain a loan in the sum of 80,000 som for the purchase of livestock.  She plans to invest the resulting income into business expansion and repairs for the animal shed.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: Amelita

texts.en:
Amelita is 45 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with one child. 

Amelita has a retail shop that sells fish. She has had this business for four years. She requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy materials to fix the fishing net for fishing.

Amelita is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Amelita hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy materials to fix her fishing net

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen is married. She is 43 years old with four dependents. The family lives in Aurora, Zamboanga del Sur, Philippines. Her husband is a driver but also repairs motorcycles. The business has existed for over the last three years. She normally receives PHP 4,500 a month from all income sources.

Helen joined GDMPC earlier this year. She is applying for a loan of PHP 5,000 to acquire the necessary materials to repair motorcycles. In every business transaction, vehicle defects differ and she has to equip the business with tools or devices to fix all desired areas. With this loan, she hopes to gain more income and further expand the range of business.

loans.use: To acquire the necessary materials to repair motorcycles.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy spare parts for his vehicle

loans.name: Rizel

texts.en:
Rizel is 30 years old. She has four school-aged children to love, discipline and scold when needed. They live in Aurora, Zamboanga del Sur, Philippines where her husband is driving for a living. Two years ago, she got into the motor repair line of business to add to their daily income. Every month she gets PHP 5,000, which is divided equally to satisfy their needs.
 
This year, she joined GDMPC to have a way into financial services. She initially applied for a loan of PHP 5,000 to equip her business with tools and devices for motor repair. She hopes that this investment will improve the service quality and she will have more customers to deal with.

loans.use: To buy tools and devices for his motor repair business.

loans.name: Jogie

texts.en:
Jogie is a man from Aurora, Zamboanga del Sur, Philippines. He has two school-aged dependents who sometimes accompany him in roaming around various communities buying rusted or used metal items to sell. He has been doing this for two years. He gets 3,500 Philippines pesos (PHP) a month from this activity.

To have access to financial services, Jogie joined GDMPC. He is applying for a loan of PHP 5,000 from the organization to procure metal items to sell. By having additional funds borrowed, he hopes to bring in more metal items to sell at a higher price. The revenue will be used to expand business operations and sustain daily needs.

loans.use: To procure metal items to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy shoes.

loans.name: Juanita

texts.en:
Juanita is 40 years old. She is married with three school-aged dependents. She raises pigs in Aurora, Zamboanga del Sur, Philippines, her place of residence. After three years of handling the business, Juanita never plans to stop it because she realized the good inflow that these animals may give at the right time. Her husband is also working for the family and that makes them earn a total of 4,500 Philippines pesos (PHP) a month.

In the third quarter of this year, Juanita joined GDMPC. She then applied for a loan of PHP 5,000 from the cooperative to purchase feeds for piglets. She never takes things for granted, nor will she sacrifice the health of domestic animals. Juanita hopes that by feeding them appropriately, these animals will grow fast and be weighed heavily to sell them at higher price for a good return on investment. She plans to buy more piglets and expand a barred enclosure for security.

loans.use: To purchase feeds for piglets.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en: Joseph is a budding 42-year-old businessman. He is married and blessed with four children between 10 and 20 years old. For the last 12 years, he has been selling motor vehicle spare parts to make a living. He wants in the next five years to have moved into a permanent premise.  His dream is to be importing spare parts. He is requesting a loan of 60,000 Kenya shillings to buy wipers, bolts, bearings and brake oil. Thanks to Faulu Kenya, he has been able to expand his business.

loans.use: to buy wipers, bolts, bearings and brake oil

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en: Lucy is an aggressive 57-year-old business lady. She is married and blessed with nine children between 15 and 31 years old. For the last 10 years, she has been engaging in farming to make a living. She wants in the next five years to have started another business:a retail shop. Her dream is to farm in large scale and to supply produce to a wider market, especially the export market. She is requesting a loan of 30,000 Kenyan shillings to buy chemicals and fertilizers. Thanks to Faulu Kenya, she is now able to save on a weekly basis.

loans.use: to buy chemicals and fertilizers

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en: Lydia is a focused 32-year-old business lady. She is married and blessed with two children. One of her children is in school. For the last two years, she has been meeting the needs of her family by selling cereals. She wants in the next five years to have a monthly turnover of 200,000 Kenyan shillings. Her dream is to be a leading supplier of hard cereals in the region. She is requesting a loan of 20,000 Kenya shillings to buy maize and beans. Thanks to Faulu Kenya, she is now more business oriented.

loans.use: to buy maize and beans

loans.name: Leopoldo

texts.en:
Leopoldo is 59 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is married with seven children. 

Leopoldo has a computer shop that provides computer games. He has had this business for two years. He requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy tools & pay for electricity for the computer services.

Leopoldo is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Leopoldo hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy tools & pay for electricity for computer services

loans.name: John

texts.en: John is a determined 51-year-old businessman. He is married and blessed with six children. He has been meeting the needs of his family by engaging in farming. He wants in the next five years to be a major distributor of farm products in his county. His dream is to be serving and supplying major hotels in the country with farm produce. He is requesting a loan of 60,000 Kenyan shillings to buy cabbage and tomato seedlings. Thanks to Faulu Kenya, he is now able to budget his income and finances well.

loans.use: to buy cabbage and tomato seedlings

loans.name: Aretas

texts.en:
Aretas is 39 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with three children. 

Aretas has a retail shop that sells canned goods, snacks & beverages. She has had this business for one year. She requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages.

Aretas is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Aretas hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages

loans.name: David

texts.en: David is a determined 46-year-old businessman. He is married and blessed with four children who are 23, 20, 18 and 14 years old. For the last 10 years, he has been doing welding to make a living. He supplements his income with the earnings he makes from farming. Previously, he used to run a workshop. He wants in the next five years to have established another shop. He is requesting a loan of 95,000 Kenyan shillings to buy metal plates and metal bars. Thanks to Faulu Kenya, he has now embraced the culture of saving.

loans.use: to buy metal plates and metal bars

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en: Mohammad is a 20-year-old young man. He is married and lives in Jenin city located in Palestine. Mohammad has a project (business) selling perfumes. He wants to expand his project and buy more perfumes and new accessories to sell. The amount of money that Mohammad has isn't enough to pay for expanding, so he needs to take a loan of $800 from FATEN.  When Mohammad gets the FATEN loan, which is repaid on a monthly basis, he will be able to expand his project and have more collections of perfumes and accessories to sell. This will increase his income and he will live in better conditions. Mohammad is photographed in his project of selling perfumes.

loans.use: To purchase more perfumes and accessories
